title: Hasidim in Brooklyn Feuding Over Israel and Neighborhood Sanctity
description: To the outsider, the Hasidim of Brooklyn may seem basically alikebearded men in black suits rushing to work or synagogues, women wearing scarves and wigs, many of them pushing baby carriages.

title: Farm Prices Up 2%
description: WASHINGTON, May 31(AP)  The prices that farmers get for raw products as they move into the consumer pipeline rose 2 per cent between. April 15 and May 15, the sixth consecutive monthly increase, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: Efforts to Require Deposits on Bottles Opposed by Carey
description: ALBANY, May 31Governor Carey said today that he opposed efforts to require refundable deposits on bottles and cans, and indicated that he preferred instead a national resource recovery program that would collect discarded containers and find new industrial uses for the material.

title: Panel Told of Parent Involvement in ChildSex Trade
description: A Congressional subcommittee was told yesterday that child pornography was one of the fastest growing and most lucrative components of the commercial sex industry and involved more than 300,000 children below 16 years of age. The panel, the House Select Education Subcommittee. held a sparsely attended hearing at Covenant House, a Catholicbacked shelter for runaway youths on Eighth Avenue between 43d and 44th Streets in the heart of Manhattan's commercial sex district.

title: The Lindy's Cheesecake ontroversy: Which is the Real Version?
description: To THE LIVING SECTION:

title: Careers
description: While many people still equate the term accountant with being a certified public accountant, a growing corporate trend in the last five years has been the encouragement of a different type of accountant who does not have a C.P.A. after his name.

title: One Down, Two More to Play
description: PARISThree critically important Mediterranean elections are taking place this spring and it is hard to say which is historically the most significant. The first was Israel's May vote which eased from power a Labor Party that had ruled the state since its creation in 1948.

title: Steel Output High Equals '75 Total
description: Steel production for the week ended May 28 achieved its eighth consecutive weekly gain and hit 2.79 million tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. This is the highest weekly production level since the industry poured an Identical amount of steel in the week ended March 8, 1975.

title: Likud and Israel's Future
description: JERUSALEM, May 31Two weeks after Israel's surprising election result, a large number of Israelis are wondering about the country's future both internally and internationally.

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY, MAY 31, 1977

title: Alcan Will Invest $200 Million More In Quebec Capacity
description: MONTREAL, May 31The Aluminum Company of Canada has decided to proceed with plans to increase production capacity in Quebec with an initial $200 million investment and the news has given the province's buffeted Government a tremendous lift. The company is a subsidary of Alcan Aluminium Ltd.

title: France Holds Up Proposed Sale Of a Nuclear Plant to Pakistan
description: PARIS, May 31France has decided to hold up its controversial sale of a nuclear plant to Pakistan, officials disclosed here today.

title: Barry Farber Seeks Nomination for Mayor
description: Describing himself as unflinchingly conservative, Barry Farber, the radio interviewer, announced yesterday that he was a candidate for the Republican nomination for Mayor of New York.

title: The New Discos: Life Begins at Midnight
description: It's midnight and the night people are out, ready for action. The discothque scene in Manhattan has not only revived but exploded.

title: Foyt Enters Rex Mays Race
description: MILWAUKEE, May 31 (AP)Nine of the top 10 finishers in last Sunday's Indianapolis 500 race have entered the Rex Mays 150mile championship car race, slated June 1112, promoters announced today. A. J. Foyt who Sunday became the first driver to win the Indy event four times, also will be trying for his fourth victory in the Mays, which he won in 1962, '64 and '75. Johnny Parsons, who was fifth at Indy, was the only one missing of the top 10.

title: South Africans Spur Conversion Of Coal Into Gas
description: SECUNDA, South AfricaWhile the United States searches anxiously for ways to reduce its dependence on imported oil, South Africa, with no natural oil of its own, has embarked on an ambitious project to produce substantial amounts of gasoline and other liquid motor fuel from coal.

title: E. P. A. Takes Steps To Control Benzene As a Health Threat
description: WASHINGTON. May 31 (AP)The Environmental Protection Agency designated benzene a hazardous air pollutant today, the first step toward regulation of the chemical, a basic component of gasoline.

title: South Africans Spur Conversion Of Coal Into Gas
description: SECUNDA, South AfricaWhile the United States searches anxiously for ways to reduce its dependence on imported oil, South Africa, with no natural oil of its own, has embarked on an ambitious project to produce substantial amounts of gasoline and other liquid motor fuel from coal.

title: FastServe Artists Are Cranking Up
description: The big guns are gathering for a shootout Friday at the Grand Central Racquet Club.

title: Private Lives
description: IN A LIFETIME of excess and inadvertence. of guile and autodidacticism, I have given up a number of things. In no particular order of importance, I have given up dessert, croquet, Thomas Wolfe, threepiece suits, political ambitions, secretaries, owning a car, singing Danny Boy, the Ptolemaic system of astronomy., the dream of the Enlightenment, several inconvenient scruples, Sophia Loren. Lent and cigarettes (six times).

title: Credit Card System: Child of the Century
description: The credit card's ancestors appeared shortly before World War I. Oil companies were issuing some courtesy cards then, with actual gasoline credit cards arriving in 1924.

title: Deadline Is Extended In G.M. Engine Swaps
description: The deadline by which a purchaser of a 1977 Pontiac, Buick or Oldsmobile car equipped with a Chevrolet engine must choose either to exchange the car or receive a free, threeyear insurance policy on it was extended yesterday from June 1 to June 11 by State Supreme Court Justice Hyman Korn.

title: Woman Held in Slaying Of Everett, Pro Fighter
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 31 (UPI)Carolyn McKendrick, 24yearold girlfriend of Tyrone Everett the Philadelphia boxer, was charged today with his slaying. Mrs. McKendrick surrendered to the police this morning.

title: Advertising
description: It would seem that the forces Interested in the success of the Universal Product Code could mount a national educational advertising campaign that points up the consumer benefits of the revolutionary laserequipped, computerized supermarket checkout system. Perhaps it would prevent the localized outcries from consumer activists.

title: Mrs. Carter Wins Cheers in Costa Rica With Her Spanish
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, May 31Rosalynn Carter delighted some 1.500 Costa Ricans who met her at the airport here today by greeting them in Spanish.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Early Managerial Instincts
description: Shortly after taking command of the New York Mets last night, Joe Torre was sitting at his desk in the manager's office and making out his first lineup card. He did it quickly, easily, as if he had been doing it almost all his life. And in a way he has, as if born for the role.

title: LEGISLATORS ARE DUBIOUS ON EXTRA FOREIGN AID
description: WASHINGTON, May 31Congressional reaction was skeptical today to Secretary of State Cyrus R, Vance's proposal that United States foreign aid to the world's poorest nations be increased by $375 million a year.

title: Maddox's Bat Helps Phils Top Pirates for 5th in Row
description: Garry Maddox, the Philadelphia outfielder, opened the game at Veterans Stadium last night with his fourth homer of the season, then drove in two more runs with a triple in the seventh inning to spearhead the Phillies to a 65 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates. The victory was Philadelphia's fifth straight.

title: Justice, Prosecutor Criticized by Court In Groh Indictment
description: The Appellate Division in Brooklyn yesterday accused Justice Leonard H. Sandler of State Supreme Court and the special state anticorruption prosecutor, John F. Keenan, of having used coercive methods to get a Queens County grand jury to indict Judge Robert T. Groh of Civil Court last November on charges of bribery and grand larceny.

title: Westport Minibuses a Maxisuccess
description: WESTPORT, Conn.The filling stations have not gone out of business and all the cars have not been put up on blocks yet, but a federally sponsored experiment in mass transit here is beginning to make significant inroads into this suburb's heavy reliance oil the private automobile.

title: JOSEPH G. SMITH, 66, DIES; EXECUTIVE AND HISTORIAN
description: PITTSBURGH, May 31Joseph G. Smith, a steel executive, educator, historian and prominent Roman Catholic layman, died yesterday in West Penn Hospital, where he had been hospitalized for three weeks with a heart ailment. He was 66 years old.

title: Kenya Planning Drive on Poachers
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, May 31Kenya's Minister for Tourism and Wildlife said today that the Government would follow up its ban on biggame hunting with a program to crack down on poachers, whose activities are a major cause of the dwindling of the country's wildlife.

title: Mets' Box Score
description: MONTREAL (N.)

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: GENESIS In the spring of 1927 The Second Man, the first work of the late S. N. Behrman to be produced, started the illustrious career of the playwright career of the playwright and scenarist who was best known for his urbane and witty stage comedies.

title: New Bond Issues
description: Tuesday, May 31, 1977

title: Kuwait Plans Matsushita Boycott Against Products RCA Licenses
description: The Matsushita Electric Corporation of America said yesterday that it had been advised by Kuwait that productsitmade under license from the RCA Corporation would be boycotted by that Arab nation. A spokesman said that Qatar and Syria had also apparently taken similar action.

title: Carter and Castro Communicate
description: PLAINS, Ga., May 31President Carter said today that he had communicated with President Fidel Castro of Cuba through intermediaries and that Mr. Castro had responded in similar fashion.

title: Wine Talk
description: OVER A YEAR ago, mention was made in this space of a great buy in California wine: a nonvintage Cresta Blanca petite sirah that was available for under $2.50 a bottle. Cresta Blanca was having distribution problems at the time and readers experienced a great deal of frustration in trying to find the wine.

title: Deployment of New U.S. Warhead Viewed as Major Step in Arms Race
description: WASHINGTON, May 31The United States shortly will quietly pass a newand complicatingmilestone in the arms race by deploying a more accurate and powerful warhead capable of destroying Soviet missiles in their silos.

title: Does Happy End Owe a Chip To Guys and Dolls?
description: I AM NOT A troubleshooter. There are some things I can clean up for you, and some I can't. But I may be able to relieve, to a degree, one aspect of the fretful speculation that's been going on in the press over which came first, Happy End or Guys and Dolls.

title: Child's World
description: ALTHOUGH TAKING a child to a city park these days often means that you're looking at the trees and watching out for broken glass at the same time, there's still good reason to take children to Alley Pond Park in Queens.

title: Ben Grauer, NBC's AllAround Man, Is Dead at 68
description: Ben Grauer, whose name and voice were familiar to millions of radio listeners for more than four decades, died early yesterday morning in New York University Medical Center Hospital. He was admitted to the hospital with a heart ailment last Friday and is believed by doctors to have died in his sleep. He would have been 69 years old tomorrow.

title: Zoning Ban on Extended Family in Ohio Is Upset
description: WASHINGTON, May 31The Supreme Court today defended the rights of the multigeneration extended family, striking down a zoning ordinance in Ohio that tightly limited the number of persons and their relationships to one another who may live in a singlefamily dwelling.

title: Is This The Real Thing?
description: The filling:

title: Charting Life With a Daughter
description: WHEN I was growing up, one of the sights in town was a motherdaughter team in matching outfits, both their heads clipped in girlish bobs. They walked miles each day through the department stores and busiest streets on an endless shopping trip, totally absorbed in each othertalking, talking, talking down the years.

title: Deployment of New U.S Warhead Viewed as Major Step in Arms Race
description: WASHINGTON, May 31The United States shortly will quietly pass a newand complicatingmilestone in the arms race by deploying a more accurate and powerful warhead capable of destroying Soviet missiles in their silos.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: DURING MY TENURE as chef at Le Pavillon Restaurant, it almost gose without saying that the clientele that passed through those doors was both international and celebrated. It also goes without saying that the owner, Henri Soul, held some of his customers in higher esteem than others. The gentleman was inclineda natural inclinationto pamper those of whom he was particularly fond, whether it was a matter of seating or a complimentary bottle of champagne. His soliciture and care were never apparent than when those whom he particularly liked and/or admired were hospitalized.

title: Q&A
description: Q. You recently printed a recipe for a prune dessert taken from Ma Gastronomie, the cookbook published by the late Fernand Point, chef and proprietor of the Pyramide Restaurant in Vienne, France. Can you tell me if this book is available in an English translation in New York?

title: All About the Sun: A New Turn on Tans
description: WHAT'S PABA? It's not a new cereal of a Latin dance craze. It stands for paraaminobenzoic acid, whose drivatives may help keep a lot of sun worshippers from turning into wrinkled prunes or courting skin cancer as they lie on beaches this summer.

title: Lloyd Perryman, 60, Singer
description: BURBANK, Calif. (AP)Lloyd Perryman, whose voice contributed to the smooth harmonies of the Sons of the Pioneers for 40 years, and was the longestserving member of the famed western singing group, died yesterday. He was 60 years old. Mr. Perryman replaced an original member of the group in 1936 and after 1949 was informally the leader, teaching arrangements of such Pioneers classics as Cool Water and Tumbling Tumbleweeds to new members.

title: 3 ON NEW FILM UNIT SWORN IN BY BYRNE
description: FORT LEE, May 31On a sundrenched Palisades bluff not far from the birthplace of silent films here, the first three members of the new state commission that hopes to restore New Jersey as a moviemaking center were sworn into office today.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Books of The Times
description: RICHARD ELLMANN'S latest book about James Joyce is deceptive. Superficially, it looks like something of a grab bag. first, there is the apparently disparate subject matter of its three sectionson Homer and Ulysses, Shakespeare and Ulysses, and Joyce's politics. Second, there is its long and seemingly incidental appendix listing the contents of the personal library Joyce left in Trieste when, in June 1920, he moved to Paris. And third, there is the book's somewhat openended title, The Consciousness of Joyce; Professor Ellmann defines consciousness as the movement of the mind both in recognizing its own shape and in maintaining that shape in the face of attack or change.

title: For Mexican Boys Like Miguel, Slipping Into U.S. Is a Necessity
description: DEL RIO, Tex., May 31Miguel decided to come to the United States barefooted. Wearing shoes was not part of his American Dream.

title: French Entrant Is Favored In Today's English Derby
description: EPSOM, England, May 31Which do you fancy for the Derby, asks a sign in the window of a London bookmaker, a frog or a bulldog?

title: FEDERAL FUNDS RATE RISES AS HIGH AS 5%
description: The credit markets were affected by developments on several fronts yesterday. The Federal funds rate climbed as high as 5 percent and prices declined but only modestly. The Treasury announced that it would pay off $710 million of the $5.71 billion of bills that will mature next week, and fixedincome prices recovered. And in newissue activity, the Bank of America announced plans to sell a $150 million package of its 8 percent singlefamily home mortgages carrying no Government backing the first such public offering

title: World News Briefs
description: JOHANNESBURG, May 31 (AP)Hundreds have been arrested in Angola in the attempted coup last week, President Agostinho Neto of Angola said today.

title: Salvadoran Envoy In Guatemala Freed By Guerrilla Group
description: GUATEMALA, May 31 (AP)  El Salvador's ambassador to Guatemala, Eduardo Casanova Sandoval, was freed by kidnappers tonight unhurt except for a gunshot wound in the foot he received during his abduction, a family spocesman said.

title: '77 LOEB WINNERS NAMED IN BUSINESS JOURNALISM
description: LOS ANGELES, May 31 (UPI)Reporters on The Boston Globe, The San Francisco Examiner and The Anchorage Daily News were among the winners today in the 1977 Gerald Loeb Awards for distinguished business and financial journalism.

title: Report on Worker Freedom And Role of U.S. in I.L.O.
description: A new report analyzing the degree to which member countries of the International Labor Organization have lived up to their treaty commitments on worker freedom has again focused attention on what the future role of the United States in the world labor body will be. The willingness of the organization to enforce a single worldwide standard in dealing with forced labor or other infringements of worker freedom will be tested at the organization's annual conference opening in Geneva today.

title: Nancy Fox Weber Bride Of Charles Michael Platt
description: Nancy Fox Weber and Charles Michael Platt, who are authors, were married yesterday in a civil ceremony in the Municipal Building. The bride, who will continue to use her maiden name, is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Saul Weber of West Hartford, Conn. Mr. Platt's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Maurice Platt, reside in Letchworth, England.

title: Beame Council Leaders and Board of Estimate Solve Deficit Scare and Agree on Budget
description: Mayor Beanie, the Board of Estimate and the City Council leadership moved yesterday and early today toward settling their disagreements over next year's budget after resolving a momentary scare that threatened to create a $44 million deficit.

title: Blazers Rout 76ers, Even Series, 22
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 31By a nearrecord margin of 32 points, the Portland Trail Blazers blew the Philadelphia 76ers off the court again tonight, 13098, and tied the National Basketball Association's final playoff series at two games apiece.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN, Serenata, VillaLobos: Plano Concerto in E flat, No.3 (K.107), Mozart; Sonata for Flute and Continuo in E minor, Bach; Overture to La finta semplice, Mozart; Quartet front Rigoletto, Verdi.

title: The Virtue in Trade Deficits
description: The United States posted a record foreign trade deficit in Aprilsome $2.6 billionand more records are certain before 1977 runs out. Not too long ago, such news would have stirred alarm: Dollars are running out faster than they come in. But today, paradoxically, this huge excess of American imports over exports is taken as evidence of the dollar's strength in world commerce and of the dependence of the international economy on American initiative. The world economy would be much worse without the American deficit; it would be better still if other prosperous nations, notably Japan and West Germany, tried harder to help.

title: Senator to See Begin
description: WASHINGTON, May 31Senator Richard Stone, a leading supporter of Israel, is due to confer in Israel later this week with Menahem Begin on the policies of the next Israeli government and remind him of the importance to Israel of American Congressional and public opinion.

title: The Race for Governor
description: Five of the 10 Democrats and two of the four Republicans seeking their parties' governorship nominations next Tuesday are given virtually no chance of winning, though in most cases they are campaigning vigorously and optimistically.

title: Summary of Supreme Court Action
description: WASHINGTON, May 31The Sugrams Court took the following actions today:

title: Siderowf and Sander Lose In British Amateur Upsets
description: GANTON, England, May 31 (AP)Two of the most heralded American amateur golfers, Dick Siderowf, the defending titleholder, and Bill Sander, the current United States champion, were ousted today from the British Amateur tournament. The total American contingent that started 54strong yesterday was reduced to a mere handful.

title: Perskie Calls the Casino Bill Sound
description: TRENTON, May 31The principal author of the casinogambling bill Governor Byrne will sign in Atlantic City Thursday said today that it is not true that the bill might allow organized crime to move in on the operations.

title: The Labor Scene
description: A. H. Raskin asserts that attention has again been focused on the future role of the United States in the International Labor Organization by a new report analyzing the degree to which member countries have lived up to their treaty commitments on worker freedom. Page D5

title: Slumping Mets Dismiss Frazier And Select Torre as Manager
description: The New York Mets, feuding with their star players and limping along with the worst record in baseball, dismissed Joe Frazier as manager yesterday and replaced him with one of their senior players, Joe Torre.

title: Borrowed Newsprint Saves Issue
description: TRAVERSE CITY, Mich., May 31 (AP)The Traverse City Record Eagle got out the newspaper today with help from a friend. The Eagle's supply of newsprint was destroyed by fire. It was able to borrow some 50 miles away at The Cadillac Evening News.

title: Memorial Services
description: HARMONFrancis Stuart. A memorial service will be held on June 3, 1977 at 3 P.M. In the chapel of the Interchurch Center, 475 Riverside Drive, New York City. Mr. Harmon, a native of Mississippi, had lived in New York City for the past 30 years. He was a retired executive of the motion Picture industry and during World War II was Executive Vice Chairman of the industry's War Activities Commince. A lawyer by profession he had also been a newspaper editor and a YMCA executive. He was a Trustee of the Riverside Church for 20 years and at to time of his death was a Vice President of the interchurch Center. Mr. Harmon is survived by his wife, Waverley, two children, Mrs. John F. Jameson and Stuart Harmon and four grandchildren.

title: Personal Health
description: ACCIDENTS AND EMERGENCIES are by definition unexpected events. But a little planning for the fact that such things happen to everyone sooner or later can do a lot to minimize their adverse effects, make life more pleasant for the victim, and perhaps even save a life.

title: Israel Cautions U.S. on Remarks By Carter About the Palestinians
description: TEL AVIV, May 31Israel cautioned the United States today that President Carter's statements about a homeland and compensation for the Palestinians were raising Arab expectations unrealistically and might harden the Arabs' attitude in Middle East peace talks.

title: Market Place
description: An attempt to squeeze the short sellers in Resorts International Class A stock aparently ran out of fuel yesterday.

title: Stolen $250,000 Icon Is Returned
description: WEST PATERSON, N.J. May 31Call it an answer to faith, the Rev Alphonse J. Stephenson said as he looked at a $250,000 icon returned early this morning to St. Ann Melkite Catholic Church. The icon, depicting the Blessed Virgin holding the infant Jesus and surrounded by gold, silver and precious stones, was stolen from its shrine a week ago yesterday.

title: Assembly Approves Residency Bill For New York City Civil Workers
description: ALBANY, May 31A bill that would permit New York City to require that all future Civil Service employees be residents of the city was passed by the Assembly today. In previous years, such measures have failed in the Senate, but the present bill is felt to have a better chance there this year.

title: JOSEPH L. SICARI
description: Joseph L. Sicari, who headed his own publicrelations agency in New York for many years, died yesterday in Veterans Hospital, the Bronx, where he was recuperating from a heart attack. He was 59 years old and lived at 1575 Lurting Avenue in the Bronx.

title: For the DutchBorn Moluccans, No Place to Turn
description: ASSEN, the Netherlands, May 31A year ago,. Noes Sollisa'e 23yearold brother, Bob, was sentenced to six years in a Dutch prison for his role in seizing the Indonesian Consulate in Amsterdam in December 1975 and demanding freedom for the South Moluccan Islands, which are part of Indonesia.

title: Dollar Declines in Europe While the Pound Advances; Gold Drops More Than $1
description: LONDON, May 31 (AP)The dollar dropped in value against almost all West European currencies today, and the British pound shot up by more than a quartercent to close at $1.72. The price of gold dropped on European bullion markets.

title: Red Sox Top Yanks, 54, in Quiet Duel
description: BOSTON, May 31Compared with previous encounters, the game between the Yankees and the Red Sox tonight represented a pause in their intense, exciting competition, an exhibition contest almost. Not even two Gil Patterson pitches that sailed high and inside and hit George Scott and Carlton Fisk could enliven the proceedings.

title: About Real Estate
description: JERICHO, L.I.There is a spot near Exit 40 of the Long Island Expressway in Nassau County where the Meadow Brook Club is visible on the northern horizon. In the foreground, until a couple of years ago, the late George Wicks had a sod farm.

title: GENERIC DRUG LIST IS VALIDATED BY F.D.A.
description: At the urging of the New York State Assembly, the United States Food and Drug Administration has validated a list of manufacturers who have Government approval to produce generic equivalents of 1,600 brandname prescription drugs. Generic drugs generally are considerably less expensive than brandname equivalents.

title: June F. A. Wells Married to Ridgely Harrison
description: June Foster Auslander Wells of New York and Quogue, was married yesterday to Ridgely W. Harrison in New York. The ceremony was performed by Judge Charles S. Whitman Jr. of the Civil Court of New York at the home of the bride.

title: People and Business
description: Erich Hirschfeld has been reappointed president of WilloughbyPeerless, a leading chain of photographic specialty stores, Harvey Berkey, president of Berkey Photo Inc., the parent company, announced yesterday.

title: INVESTIGATORS SEEK CAUSE OF CLUB FIRE
description: SOUTHGATE, Ky., May 31A team of state and Federal investigators completed today their first full day of searching Through the ruins of the Beverly Hills Supper Club here, seeking clues to what caused the complex to erupt into an inferno that claimed the lives of 158 persons and injured more than 100 others late last Saturday.

title: Business Records
description: Tuesday, May 31, 1977

title: C.ITOH SIGNS ACCORD TO TAKE OVER ATAKA
description: C. Itoh & Company, a topranking Japanese trading company, announced yesterday in Tokyo the signing of a formal contract under which it will absorb Ataka & Company, a deficit ridden trading company, on Oct. 1. Under the contract, Ataka will transfer its textile, lumber and real estate businesses to its subsidiaries or affiliated companies, while C. Itoh will absorb Ataka's steel, heavy machinery and chemical divisions.

title: Rhodesian Force Hunting Rebels Occupies a Town in Mozambique
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 31Rhodesian troops hunting guerrilla bases inside neighboring Mozambique have seized a town 50 miles from the Rhodesian border and intend to remain until all guerrilla forces in the area are wiped out, the commander of the raid said today.

title: Young Explains Racism Remark; Mollifies Swedish U.N. Delegate
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 31Andrew Young seemed to have mollified Sweden's chief delegate today with the assurance that he had not singled out Sweden as having racist attitudes.

title: John Vander Meer, Wherever You Are
description: Dennis Eckersley had the phone off the hook all yesterday morning at home in the Cleveland suburb of North Royalton. I don't blame him, said Frank Robinson, manager of the Indians. He's going to be under a tremendous amount of pressure from the public.

title: Apples Sweep Gaters
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., May 31  Winning all five events for the first time this season, the New York Apples defeated the San Francisco Golden Gaters, 3120 in World Team Tennis tonight at the Nassau Coliseum.

title: Paul Desmond to Be Cremated
description: In accordance with his wish to be remembered in life, rather than in death, there will be no funeral service for Paul Desmond, the jazz saxophonist long associated with the Dave Brubeck quartet. Instead, Mr. Desmond, who died Monday of lung cancer, will be cremated, and a private memorial service will probably be held by his friends in the next few weeks, according to his lawyer, Noel Silverman.

title: $250,000 Icon Is Returned
description: WEST PATERSON, May 31Call it an answer to faith, the Rev. Alphonse J. Stephenson said as he looked at a $250,000 icon returned early this morning to St. Ann Melkite Catholic Church. The icon, depicting the Blessed Virgin holding the infant Jesus and surrounded by gold, silver and precious stones, was stolen from its shrine a week ago yesterday.

title: Barry Farber Seeking to Run For Mayor on Republican Line
description: Barry Farber talked with the final guest on his radio interview show at 3 A.M. yesterday, and seven hours and 40 minutes later, he was in Times Square to announce that he was running for Mayor of New York.

title: Belmont Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, JUNE 1, 1977

title: U.S. Agency to Study 60M.P.G. VW Diesel
description: BONN, May 31 (Reuters)United States Transportation Secretary Brock Adams said today that the Federal Government planned to study a newly developed diesel car from Volkswagen as part of its efforts to promote energy savings and higher safety standards.

title: Jersey Gets New Conductor
description: Thomas Michalak, a 36yearold Polishborn conductor and a resident of the United States since 1963, has been named music director of the New Jersey Symphony, effective today.

title: Notes on People
description: THE GOOD MORNING, AMERICACA show on ABCTV has signed up Margaret Trudeau to cover portions of Queen Elizabeth II's Silver Jubilee celebrations in England. A network spokesman said the estranged wife of Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada would prepare a sort of photojournal to be seen sometime next week. Mrs. Trudeau will appear on the program.

title: JUSTICES INVALIDATE A REDISTRICTING PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, May 31The Supreme Court invalidated today the latest in a series of six legislative reapportionment plans for Mississippi, saying the proposed districts were not close enough to each other in population to meet the Court's oneman, onevote formula for fair distribution of political power.

title: People in Sports
description: Auto racing, I'm sad to say, is still a white man's sport, said Wendell Scott, the first black stockcar driver, whose career spans more than two decades. His earnings in that time, he said, are just over $180,000 (less than $9,000 a year).

title: Credit Cards: Change and Uncertainty
description: Credit cards, those walletstuffing pieces of plastic that play a major role in the move toward a cashless or checkless society, are undergoing change.

title: Watching the Intelligence Watchmen
description: The Senate Select Committee on Intelligence recently celebrated its first birthday by issuing a selfcongratulatory report of its achievements. It's hard to tell whether all the felicitations are justified; much of its work overseeing the nation's intelligence services goes on in secret. But from what is known, the committee is entitled at least to some credit.

title: A Survivor of the 60's Recalls the Decade
description: FOR four years, I felt I had blown it, the 60's had blown it, and we would never again see the heights. And then one day I heard myself reciting that line and became aware that I don't feel that way anymore.

title: The U.N. Today
description: June 1, 1977

title: TV: Crusading Scientist Is a Profile of Feisty Linus Pauling
description: AQUIET but substantial package of primetime television gets under way tonight at 8 on Channel 13 with an hourlong profile of Linus C. Pauling. Crusading Scientist, written and produced by Robert Richter, is part of public television's Nova, a longrunning series put together by Boston station WGBH. The portrait of Dr. Pauling is openly admiring, if not celebratory, and more than enough supporting evidence is included for solid justification.

title: Wellwood Hanover, Joe Victors in Pace Divisions
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., May 31 Wellwood Hanover driven by Billy Haughton, scored his fourth straight victory without a los tonight inthe $35,825 division of The George M. Patchen Pace at The Meadowlands. The race was part of the track's first Grand Circuit meet and Wellwood Hanover was clocked in 2:00 3/5, a record for the 2yearold colt. He paid $3, $2.20 and $2.20 for $2. across the board.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: DESPITE CANARDS to the contrary, more than a few New Yorkers take pride in knowing their city and pleasure in helping the confused and lost.

title: Dance: Sensuous Spectre
description: AMERICAN BALLET THEATER'S minor Fokine festival, which continues at the Metropolitan Opera House until tonight's performance, has had to ring the changes on only four ballets. On Monday night it reintroduced Le Spectre de la Rose into the repertory, to share the bill with The Firebird and Petrushka.

title: Dump Explodes on Golan Heights
description: TEL AVIV, May 31 (Reuters)An ammunition dump on the occupied Golan Heights caught fire early this morning and the sounds of explosions could be heard as far away as Acre, on the Mediterranean coast 36 miles away, military sources said today. The sources did not know of any casualties in the incident and said the fire was extinguished in about an hour.

title: Stage: Scribes Caps Fine Phoenix Season
description: LESS CAN BE more. In some respects the Phoenix Theater, which opened Scribes, the last play of its current season, at the Marymcunt Manhattan Theater last night, might be thought to have pulled in its horns. Certainly, if you will forgive mixing metaphors midstream, it has changed its direction. T. Edward Hambleton's successively and successfully incendiary theater has deserted Broadwayor perhaps, more properly, Broadway has deserted itand moved to the small yet pleasing Off Broadway house operated by Marymount Manhattan College. It has also abandoned its policy of classics, old and new, for an exclusive program of New York premieres.

title: Rock: New Kingfish, Old Style
description: Kingfish is a band with strong associations with the San Francisco rock scenethe Grateful Dead and the New Riders of the Purple Sage in particular so its appearance Monday and yesterday at the Bottom Line, just before tonight's world premiere of the Grateful Dead's movie, is all the more appropriate.

title: Deaths
description: ANDRESENEmily V. on February 23, 1977. In Stratford, Ct. Survived by several nieces and nephews. Memorial services Thursday, 1:30 P.M., at The Simonson Funeral Home, 11904 Hillside Ave. Corner of Lefferts Blvd.) Richmond Hill. Graveside service to follow.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: U.S. REPORT URGES REMOVAL OF F.D.A. SECRECY ON DRUGS
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (UPI)A Government panel recommended today removal of the secrecy surrounding Food and Drug Administration regulation of drugs and urged more formal relationships between the agency and the pharmaceutical industry. Details of the report was disclosed yesterday.

title: The Standings
description: Wednesday, June 1, 1977

title: Companies Brighten Job Prospects For This Year's College Graduates
description: EVANSTON, Ill., May 31Many of the nation's largest industrial companies are offering more jobs to this year's college graduates than they had expected to earlier, indicating they believe the egonomy is improving more rapidly than they thought it would last fall.

title: E.P.A. Is Simmering With Accusations and Threats Over Disclosure of Report on Water Contamination
description: WASHINGTON, May 31On March 16 an official of the Environmental Protection Agency, William Sanjour, sent a terse note to a subordinate demanding to know, in writing, how a copy of a preluninary report on ground water contamination had found its way into the press.

title: Belmont Back in Form: Players Again Payers
description: Labor talk gave way to basic horse talk about speed, stamina and class yesterday as Belmont Park became a smoothrunning race track again. For the first time in eight days of racing at the strikeslowed meeting, horseplayers had to pay to get At the into the track as well as out of it. The postholiday Race crowd of 14,121 also had Tracks to pay for programs and parking, items that had remained free on Monday even after the 600member Independent Association of Mutuel Employees ended its 10day strike against the New York Racing Association.

title: Jets Offer Fans Jersey Package
description: The Jets, officially New Yorkers once again, have not forced their seasonticket holders to take the one regularseason game to be played New Jersey.

title: Appropriations for New Plants And Equipment Rise in Quarter
description: New plant and equipment appropriations by the nation's 1,000 largest manufacturers continued at an exceptionally high level in the first quarter of 1977, rising 30 percent above the yearago rate.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company said it would establish a subsidiary to buy communications equipment from nonBell manufacturers for use by Bell Telephone companies.

title: Bridge: Regional Tourney Title Won By Visiting British Experts
description: A strong performance by a visiting British expert brought him a title in the concluding event of the Eastern regional championships at the New York Hilton Hotel Monday night, and frustrated a bid by a famous New York partnership for two straight victories.

title: Efforts to Require Deposits on Bottles Opposed by Carey
description: ALBANY, May 31Governor Carey said today that he opposed efforts to require refundable deposits on bottles and cans, and indicated that he preferred instead a national resource recovery program that would collect discarded containers and find new industrial uses for the material.

title: Gretchen Leefmans Becomes the Bride Of Allan M. Siegal
description: The marriage of Gretchen MalletPievost Leefmans and Allan M. Siegal took place yesterday in the courthouse of the Appellate Division, First Department, New York State Supreme Court. Justice Samuel J. Silverman performed the ceremony.

title: CORRECTION
description: In Saturday's editions of The Times, it was incorrectly reported that a Michigan appeals court had upset a lower court decision that would, have permitted stock transfers to proceed in the proposed offer by the Anderson, Clayton Company for shares of the Gerber Products Company. In fact, the appeals court continued a stay already in effect while it considers the merits of the controversy. In addition, once a tender offer becomes effective, no stock may change hands for 60 days.

title: U.S. Expresses Concern
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (Reuters)The United States today expressed its concern over the latest Rhodesian raid into Mozambique and the negative effect it could have on peace efforts in southern Africa.

title: Dance: Taylor Images Premiered
description: THE PAUL TAYLOR Dance Company, one of the world's top dance troupes, opened a sixday run last night at the City Center without pomp and with some official circumstance.

title: Sharp Exchanges Mark Beginning Of Hanafi Moslems' Murder Trial
description: WASHINGTON, May 31The kidnapping and murder trial of the 12 Hanafi Moslems accused of taking 149 persons hostage last March and holding them at gunpoint for nearly thre days in three downtown buildings opend today in District of Columbia Superior Court.

title: SUPREME COURT BACKS SENIORITY WORK RULES THAT MAY DISCRIMINATE
description: WASHINGTON, May 31The Supreine Court ruled 7 to 2 today that seniority systems that perpetuate the effects of past racial discrimination, placing blacks at a disadvantage to whites in the competition for better jobs and other benefits, are not necessarily illegal.

title: Letter: On LifeandDeath Decisions
description: To the Editor:

title: Ohio Town Stunned by Loss of 13 in Fire; Victims Made Up a Third of School's Staff
description: TRENTON, Ohio, May 31Slowly, nervously, Ronald Butts, a custodian at Wayne Elementary School here, hitched the United States flag to the chain of a pole and dutifully raised the banner the length of the cylinder, then brought it back down, stopping at halfstaff.

title: Britain's Costume Party
description: LONDON, May 31We will go to London for the Queen's Jubilee, we said, and since there has been so much discord over Concorde, we win fly that supersonic bird and find out whether it was worth all the fuss. Conclusion: Very expensive, very convenient, very steady, very noisy, but worth it, yes.

title: About Education
description: Perry Lentz is an associate professor of English at Kenyon College in Ohio who graduated from the same institution in 1964. Not long ago he was looking over some classroom notes that he had inherited from Denham Sutcliffe, one of his own professors, and he made a startling discovery.

title: A Soda Jerk's True Confessions
description: In the early 1960's some friends of mine in high school had taken to working as soda jerks in an ice cream parlor called Belson's, near the old Greenwich High School. Mr. Belson was tight with his money and paid the boys, as he called them, the minimum wage. But my friends kept showing up at school with their wallets bulging and a mercenary glint in their eyes, and I didn't want to fall behind.

title: Disease Laid to Ticks Is Reported On New England Coast and on L.I.
description: NEW HAVEN, May 31A team of Yale University medical researchers said today that cases of Lyme arthritis, which is thought to be transmitted by ticks, had been found throughout a wide area of coastal New England and on Long Island.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP)More women college students are taking math and science courses, a new study shows. And women's colleges are actively expanding these courses.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, May 31The State Board of Public Utility Commissioners ordered today that all political, promotional and institutional advertising by gas, electric and telephone utilities be charged to the companies' stockholders, and not to business expenses to be paid for by customers in the form of higher rates.

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: France Holds Up Proposed Sale Of a Nuclear Plant to Pakistan
description: France Holds Up Proposed Sale Of a Nuclear Plant to Pakistan, May 31France has decided to hold up its controversial sale of a nuclear plant to Pakistan, officials disclosed here today.

title: Plains, Ga., Burdened by Tourists and Fame, Gives Hearty Welcome to Former Neighbor
description: PLAINS, Ga., May 31President Carter came home again todayhome to this dusty little village that has been burdened by his success.

title: MOLUCCANS PROPOSE A MEDIATION EFFORT
description: ASSEN, the Netherlands, May 31The South Moluccans holding 56 hostages on a train near here have asked for mediators to help end their standoff with the Dutch Government.

title: Hussein Backs U.S. Peace Bid but Sees Likud as Threat
description: AMMAN, Jordan, May 31King Hussein of Jordan gave full support today to the United States to start the process for peace in the Mideast but said that he feared the chances of a new war had increased with the recent election victory of the rightwing Likud bloc in Israel.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: ing the more interesting 19thcentury buildings and leaving comfortable spaces between the new glass and concrete highrise office structures.

title: A Swedish Sausage Shop Thrives in Brooklyn
description: Although sausages of Italy, France, Germany, and Eastern Europe are by now familiar, the delicately spiced sausages of Scandinavia are not so well known, or even as readily available. They can be found, in all their tantalizing variety, at Fredricksen & Johannesen's, the Scandinavian purveyor of choice meats in the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn. This small and impeccable shop might seem at first to be merely a specialty grocery store. Upon entering, one encounters a tidy array of items such as cloudberry preserves, flatbreads, prepared fruit soup mix (frchtesuppe) and Slotts mustard (a Swedish product, in both a coarse and smooth version, which might accompany sausages in its homeland).

title: CONVICT HOLDS LAWYER AS HOSTAGE FOR 8 HOURS
description: A 29yearold convict seized his lawyer at the Camden County jail yesterday afternoon and held her hostage for eight hours until the authorities agreed to dismiss a number of charges against him.

title: MITCHELL AND HALDEMAN LOSE PLEA ON SENTENCES
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (UPI)The Supreme Court refused today to stay the jail sentences of John N. Mitchell and H. R. Haldeman pending their final effort to win review of their Watergate coverup convictions.

title: Dollar Unchanged on Tokyo Market
description: TOKYO, May 31 (AP)The dollar remained unchanged at 277.275 yen on the Tokyo foreign exchange market today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A New York State Supreme Court justice in Ulster County decided that the State Board of Equalization and Assessment had the right to subpoena the Town Assessor of Hardenburgh, N.Y. and his records concerning the grant of taxexemptions to more than 200 of the town's 236 taxpayers as ordained ministers.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: Students Show Energy Models
description: Frank Panicoli demonstrated how to fry an egg with sunlight. Jonathan Bisignano showed how he would use a solar heater for his room at home so that he could stop arguing with his mother about how high to set the thermostat. And, Hyung Lee explained how everything around the home, even garage, could be used to produce energy.

title: Chess:
description: Grandmaster Anatoly Lein, a Russian migr living in New York, won the Moses Mitchell Tournament or ??nampions at the Manhattan Chess Club with a 5 121 12 score.

title: Iraq Is Said to Urge Mideast Confrontation
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 31Arab diplomatic sources say Iraq has sent messages to a number of Arab Governments urging them to abandon their negotiation policy toward Israel in favor of military confrontation.

title: Savoring the Best Of French Cookery
description: Freshness and quality are fundamental. France is a small, agricultural country and it deals on a human scale. It is still possible to get very special ingredients there. For example, I like to make puff pastry with butter churned from unpasteurized cream. I can get that there even in a small grocery store; here it would be impossible.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: The Flasher

title: When the Door Is Closed to Illegal Aliens, Who Pays?
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.A very predictable thing happens hi this country whenever the economy takes a sharp turn for the worst: The illegal alien is rediscovered. Politicians, journalists, organized labor, and other interest groups rush to blame him for every imaginable problem afflicting American society, from high unemployment to rising crime rates, escalating socialservice costs, overpopulation, and balanceofpayments deficits.

title: WHITLAM BARELY KEEPS AUSTRALIAN PARTY RULE
description: CANBERRA, Australia, May 31 (Reuters)Former Prime Minister Gough Whitlam narrowly retained leadership of the Australian Labor party today, then announced that he would step down 18 to 24 months after the next general election in 1978.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: WHAT is good taste, and who makes it, or, since we are raising the question, does it exist at all? These are supposed to he bad times for good taste, and there are people who think we are being buried in schlock. Men in silk shirts who drip all over with clumsy gold jewelry! Women with teased, sprayed hair! Rhinestone sunglasses! Ruffled blue shirts with dinner jackets! Even ruffled yellow shirts! The other day a poor esthete got on a subway and saw the ExLax ad. How Can You Feel Pretty When You're Constipated? it asked her. This depressed her all afternoon. Good taste, she had always thought, was what the French call raffin, which more or less means that you can go just so far and then that's far enough. ExLax ads, she decided, were not raffin.

title: Women A re Warned To Give Up Drinking During Pregnancies
description: The National Council on Alcoholism is planning a nationwide campaign to warn women of the danger of drinking during pregnancy.

title: Highs and Lows
description: Tuesday, May 31, 1977

title: Companies Issue Earnings Figures
description: For periods ended April 30 unless otherwise indicated. (N) Indicates stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) American Stock Exchange and (O) OverMeCounter

title: SAVINGS AND LOANS ACCUSED OF ABUSES IN OWNERSHIP SHIFTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 31A Congressional study released today has set the stage for a sharp legislative battle, with a finding that the Government has failed to adequately monitor an experiment in which mutual savings and loan associations converted to ownership by stockholder.

title: Fair Proposals on Crime
description: Most expert opinion has come to the view that the criminal justice system functions best when it functions swiftly, with certainty and a minimum of irrationality. That seems to have been the animating thought of the modest yet sensible crime program sent by Governor Carey to the New York Legislature.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Tuesday.

title: U.S. Offers to Join With Soviet in Aiding Third World
description: PARIS, May 31The United States has offered to join with the Communist countries in aiding the developing world, when and where they are willing to do it.

title: In Memoriam
description: JACOBS  Beatrice H. Formerly of New York City. Passed away in Los Angeles, April 21, 1977. Mallnow & Silverman Mortuary

title: COURT UPHOLDS A BAN ON SOME JOBLESS PAY
description: WASHINGTON, May 31The Supreme Court ruled 8 to 0 today that states may refuse to pay unemployment benefits to any worker who is laid off because of a strike against his employer, whether or not the worker is participating in the strike himself.

title: 3 Million Metric Tons of Wheat Sold to Chinese by Canadians
description: OTTAWA, May 31Canada has sold another 3 million metric tons of wheat to Communist China for a total so far this year of 4.5 million metric tons, the Canadian Wheat Board announced today.

title: Grand Jury Investigates New Hampshire Governor for Possible Misuse of U.S. Funds
description: CONCORD, N.H., May 31A Federal grand jury here began an investigation today into possible misuse of Federal funds by Gov. Meldrim Thomson Jr.

title: Justice, Prosecutor Criticized by Court In Groh Indictment
description: The Appellate Division in Brooklyn yesterday accused Justice Leonard H. Sandler of State Supreme Court and the special, state anticorruption prosecutor, John F. Keenan, of having used coercive methods to get a Queens County grand jury to indict Judge Robert T. Groh of Civil Court last November on.charges of bribery and grand larceny.

title: $1.8 BILLION CUT FROM BILL FUNDING LABOR AND H.E.W.
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP)Contending that the Carter Administration had overestimated costs for welfare, Supplemental Security Income and Medicaid, a Senate panel today cut $1.8 billion from an appropriations billl for the Departments of Labor and Health, Education and Welfare.

title: Children, Citing Trials of Times Sq., Seek Carter's Help
description: Jeanette Sivak, who is 13 years old, is kept awake nights by prostitutes running to get into cars, cursing and screaming when the cars won't stop, getting punched.

title: CALIFORNIA SEEKING URBAN GROWTH CURB
description: LOS ANGELES, May 31The administration of Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr., has announced a sweeping proposal, to institure powerful state controls over California's urban growth.

title: John J. Oberdorf Is Dead at 63; Transway International Executive
description: John J. Oberdorf, executive vice president of the Transway International Corporation, died Saturday of cancer in Holy Name Hospital, Teaneck, N. J. He was 63 years old.

title: Many ExStars of Stock Market Sink to Lowest Prices of Year
description: The stock market continued to display broadbased weakness yesterday as numerous former favorites hit their lowest prices of 1977.

title: Bahamas Tourism Shifts to N.W. Ayer
description: The top executives at N. W. Ayer ABH International are twice blessed today. They've gotten a nice piece of business and a swell excuse to go south come winter.

title: U.S. Links Aid to Argentina Rights
description: GUATEMALA, May 31Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal said today that United States economic aid to Argentina would depend on whether the Argentine military regime improves its respect for human rights.

title: SUPREME COURT BARS. COOK, EX S.E.C. HEAD
description: G. Bradford Cook, a former general counsel and chairman, of the securities and Exchange Commission, was barred yesterday by the United States Supreme Court from practicing before it.

title: Vilas Trounces Smith in Paris; Nastase Wins
description: PARIS, May 31 (AP)  Guillermo Vilas, the Argentine lefthander, ruthlessly knocked Stan Smith out of the $300,000 French open tennis championships, 61, 62, 61, today and moved into the quarterfinals.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: POOR COUNTRIES COOL TO OFFER BY THE RICH
description: PARIS, May 31Representatives of the world's poor and starving today criticized as inadequate a package of economic concessions offered them here yesterday at the northsouth talks by Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance and other officials of industrial countries.

title: Three Priests Who Speak Spanish Appointed Bishops in Archdiocese
description: Three priests who speak Spanish and have long been involved in Hispanic affairs were named yesterday by Pope Paul VI as auxiliary bishops of the New York Archdiocesea move that recognizes the desire of archdiocesan leaders for stronger ties to the New York Hispanic community.

title: Technology
description: What began as fundamental experi ments by two physicists at the General Electric Company's 76yearold research and development center in Schenectady, N.Y., has turned into a new technique for manufacturing semiconductor circuits up to a thousand times faster than by previous methods.

title: Slumping Mets Dismiss Frazier And Select Torre as Manager
description: The New York Mets, feuding with their star players and limping along with the worst record in baseball, dismissed Joe Frazier as manager yesterday and replaced him with one of their senior players, Joe Torre.

title: Same Gun Used in Three Shootings
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 31The police of the Westchester County town of Greenburgh said today that ballistic tests indicated that the same weapon, a 32caliber handgun, was used in three shootings into private homes or apartments Monday night.

title: Major League Scores
description: EArmas, Ogilvie. DPOakland 1, Detroit 4. LOBOakland 4, Detroit 6. 2BKemp. HR  Perez (11, MStanley (5), MMay (4). SBMAlexander, Ogilvie, LeFlore. SMMay.

title: Future Prices Climb for Corn And Soybeans
description: Dry weather, despite some rain over the weekend in Middle West crop areas, led to a surge of speculative buying of soybean and corn futures yesterday raising prices on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Australian City of 800,000 Avidly Pursues the Life of Sports
description: PERTH, AustraliaAustralians, it is sometimes said, work hard at their leisure. Weekends and sports give meaning to their lives.

title: Bill in Albany Would Slow Placing Disabled Children In OutofState Facilities
description: ALBANY, May 31Legislation intended to slow the placing of severely mentally and physically disabled New York children in institutions outside New York and to insure decent care for the 800 children already outofstate was introduced today in the Assembly.

title: Viscount Increases Lead at Devon In Competition for Open Jumpers
description: DEVON, Pa., May 31Viscount, an aged bay gelding who got a late start in his international career, moved far out front in the race for the open jumper championship by winning his second class in three starts tonight at the Devon Horse Show.

title: Japan to Aid Nation's Textile Mills
description: TOKYO, May 31 (Reuters)The Japanese Ministry of International Trade and Industry said today it would arrange $150 million in financing to aid Japanese textile mills to pull themselves out of recession. The financing will apply to cotton, spun rayon, synthetic fiber, and woolen spinners as well as rayon staple makers.

title: Best Buys
description: SOARING prices for fresh fruits and vegetables helped thrust the cost of feeding a family of four in New York City to a record level last week, the City Department of Consumer Affairs reported yesterday.

title: CHESTER J. WOOLWORTH
description: Chester J. Woolworth, founder and chairman of the Woodstream Corporation, manufacturer of sports equipment and hardware, in Lititz, Pa., died in his home in Lancaster, Pa., Friday. His age was 84.

title: I.M.F. Monthly Gold Auction
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (UPI)The International Monetary Fund in its monthly gold auction, awarded 524,800 ounces of fine gold today at a common price of $143.32 per ounce. Successful bidders submitted prices ranging from the common price to $150 an ounce and averaged $144.19 an ounce. The sale yielded $53.9 million for the benefit of developing countries.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Commonwealth Oil Refining Company filed suit yesterday in the Superior Court of Puerto Rico at San Juan seeking $400 million in damages from PPG Industries and another company for allegedly blocking a trade agreement.

title: Reds Getting Hot: Capture 5th Straight
description: You don't win pennants in April and May, was the comment of Cincinnati's Joe Morgan during a threegame series with the Dodgers in Los Angeles last week.

title: 6 Months of Detective Work Yields Young Suspect in Murder of Couple
description: It took nearly seven months and more journeys through the Manhattan telephone book than the detectives would care to remember. Not to mention the grand jury lists or the treks to Brooklyn and the Bronx and Queens. Or the many times they returned to the scene of the crime and stared at the empty apartment and wondered what they were not seeing.

title: Ethiopia Calling Home Military Men in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, June 1(AP)Ethiopia, cutting one more tie to the United States, is calling home tits last 81 military men training here.

title: Dance: Martha Graham, Fokine and History
description: TWO OF THE FEW indisputable giants of 20thcentury dance two people who left their imprint on its historyare Martha Graham and the late Michel Fokine. New York has been celebrating both American Ballet Theater at the Metropolitan Opera House last night completed a weeklong Fokine festival, while at the LuntFontanne Theater, the Martha Graham Dance Company is continuing its season of Graham works, which runs through June 11.

title: Opposition to Raises for Public Workers Found Growing in Many Cities
description: LOS ANGELES, June 1Policemen and firemen here got some good news the other day: Under a wage formula that has been in use for 52 years, their annual base pay will rise shortly to $20,358.

title: Prosecution Rests In the Murder Trial Of Michigan Nurses
description: DETROIT, June 1The prosecution ended its case today in the trial of two Filipino nurses charged with murdering two patients and poisoning seven others at the Veterans Administration Hospital in Ann Arbor. Mich.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Fed Puts Currency Stabilizations at $20 Billion
description: Major central banks around the world bought and sold approximately $20 billion to stablize the value of their currencies in the latest quarter, about unchanged from the previous quarter, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York disclosed yesterday.

title: Alexander Marcus, at 88, Taught At City College 44 Years to 1958
description: Alexander Marcus, professor emeritus of physicis at City College of New York, died May 16 at his home in Evanston, Ill. His age was 88.

title: Fair Warning Takes Jumper Title
description: DEVON, Pa., June 1When Amy Brumder checked the amateurowner jumper standing before the final class at the Devon horse show today, she could have wept.

title: Israeli Army Denies Raid
description: TEL AVIV, June 1 (Reuters)The Israeli Army tonight denied reports from Beirut that its troops made a largescale incursion into southern Lebanon last night.

title: Byrne Contends Income Tax Is Key Issue in Election; DeRose, Roe, Florio, Hoffman,Garramone Disagree
description: Governor Byrne said yesterday that if he were defeated in New Jersey's Democratic primary for Governor on Tuesday, it would be because of voter rejection of the state income tax.

title: F.C.C. Votes 43 to Allow A.T.&T.to Decide on Use Of Telpak Phone Service
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP)  The Federal Communications Commission tentatively voted 4 to 3 today to let the American Telephone & Telegraph Company decide whether to cancel or continue its Telpak bulk private telephone line service.

title: At Dutch Siege, Media Are Often the News
description: GLIMMEN, the Netherlands, June 1Political terrorists like the South Moluccans holding 56 train passengers here always call on the international press to play a major role in their hijacking dramas. Correspondents and television and radio crews have answered the call in overwhelming numbers this time.

title: A Ban on Abortions Paid for by Medicaid Criticized as Unfair
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The Carter Administration and Congress were denounced today at a meeting of organizetions and individuals opposed to a Congressional ban on the use of Medicaid funds for abortions.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: NOTHING LIKE A DAME Agatha Christie is represented Off Off Broadway in a new production believed to be the American debut of The Unexpected Guest. The late Dame Agatha's whodunit opened in London back in 1958, alongside her marathon The Mousetrap (still running), and was lost in the shuffle, although notices were good.

title: 45% in Poll Can Name One of 10 Candidates
description: The Eagleton Institute of Politics at Rutgers University said yesterday that its latest poll showed that only 45 percent of New Jersey's adults could name at least one of the 10 Democrats running for Governor in Tuesday's primary eleaion, and only 17 percent could name one or more of the four Republicans.

title: Chinese Disclose That 1976 Quake Was Deadliest in Four Centuries
description: TOKYO, June 1In a highly unusual display of official candor. Chinese authorities have described last summer's giant Tangshan earthquake as the most deadly in China in more than four centuries.

title: Israel Said to Raid Lebanese Town
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 1 (UPI)Palestinian guerrillas charged today that Israeli troops had crossed three miles into southern Lebanon and seized a border village after a fierce predawn battle that left 30 cilivians dead or wounded.

title: The Common Stake in Coop City
description: Bad news comes from both the top and bottom of Coop City, the world's largest housing project in the Bronx. On the bottom, the dredged sand has been settling into marsh, damaging the roads, sidewalks and playgrounds, and the pipe conduits that run below. At the top, there has been no settlement of the yearlong dispute over how the project can avert bankruptcy. The truce that postponed foreclosure expires within a week.

title: The Family Could Become a Relic By the Year 2000, Sociologist Says
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, June 1By the year 4000, the family could become a relic, men and women will enter the work force later and leave earlier and the gap between generations will become a chasm, Kai T. Erikson, a sociologist from Yale University, predicted today.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: GENEVA, June 1The International Labor Organization opened its annual assembly here today, amid the prospect that the United States would make good on threat to withdraw from this United Nations specialized agency.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Camden County Prosecutor said yesterday he would abandon the deal he had made with a prison inmate to gain the release of a hostage. The inmate, James Bethea, 29 years old, of Camden, held his lawyer, Barbara Rosenberg; 28, hostage for eight hours Tuesday with her metal fingernail file at her neck.

title: Advertising A Year of Firsts at Pentel
description: It's the year of the firsts for Pentel of America, a subsidiary of the Japanese, familyoperated writinginstrument manufacturer.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: KEY JOB BIAS CASES MAYBE RECONSIDERED
description: WASHINGTON, June 1Landmark job discrimination cases such as those in steel and communications might have to be reconsidered under yesterday's Supreme Court decision upholding seniority systems, legal sources said today.

title: Manhattan Plaza Gets First Tenants and the Last Laugh
description: With speeches and champagne, with showbusiness and political personalities, with the strains of music and straining moving men, the controversial Manhattan Plaza apartment complex near Times Square finally welcomed its first residents yesterday.

title: BUSING FOES ELECTED IN LOS ANGELES VOTE
description: LOS ANGELES, June 1Candidates pledged to fight mandatory busing of children to achieve racial integration of schools here were elected to two of three seats on the Los Angeles Board of Education yesterday.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Groh Jury Voiced Interest in Manes's Involvement in Bribery Charges
description: A Queens County grand jury briefly held up action against Judge Robert T. Groh of Civil Court last November on charges of bribery and grandlarceny as some of the jurors were apparently more interested in the possible involvement of the judge's former superior, Donald R. Manes, the Queens Borough President, in the alleged bribery incident.

title: Cabaret: Troupers Improve On Silvestre and Tanner Words
description: Three veterans of Godspell and a recent New Face are making a collection of songs called Words, now at Brothers and Sisters, 355 West 46th Street sound considerably better than the songs really are.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, JUNE 2, 1977

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Frederick W. Gallagher, a fire captain, was presented with the New York City Fire Department's oldest award for valor, the James Gordon Bennett Medal, for the rescue of two firemen trapped in burning rubble at a fivealarm supermarket fire in downtown Brooklyn on Jan. 7, 1976.

title: Nostalgic, Thoroughly Modern, Wicker Weaves Spell
description: Wicker is here in superabundance, rivaling the best in other furniture Materials. Add light floors, growing plants, summer slipcovers, an uncluttered room, and you'll have the recipe for the most popular look around. On the other hand, wicker is equally compatible with patchwork and chintz, rush rockers and old floors, and crowded hominess.

title: Sound
description: THE MAIL that has come to me within the short span of this column's appearance in the Home Section has been most gratifying, and I regret all the more that time and the scarcity of secretarial help do not permit me to correspond privately with my readers. But questions raised by some may interest others, and I will occasionally devote a column to matters brought up in the mail.

title: CARTER AIDES PREDICT A SAVINGS OF BILLIONS IN NEW WELFARE PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The Carter Administration's plan to revise the nation's welfare system is designed to save billions of dollars by tightening the eligibility requirements for public relief, according to Administration officials familiar with the proposal.

title: Jack McGowan
description: Jack McGowan, writer of the screenplays for some of Hollywood's betterknown musicals, died Saturday at the Sanger Nursing Home, 500 West 57th Street, where he had lived since 1972. He was 81 years old.

title: Gardening: Laurels for the Neglected Laurel
description: THERE WAS A huge grouping of rhododendrons around the mansion down the street from where I lived when I was youngperfect for hiding in. I was much more taken by their branched shelter than by the masses of flowers that almost lit up the early summer evenings; beneath those bushes I found caves worthy of Robinson Crusoe.

title: France Denies Shift On Pakistan APlant
description: PARIS, June 1The French Foreign Office spokesman today denied that France was withholding delivery of critical components of a nuclear reprocessing plant to Pakistan. as was reported in this morning's New York Times.

title: 3 Americans Left in British Golf
description: GANTON, England, June 1 (AP)Madden Hatcher 3d, a high school student from Columbus, Ga., salvaged some pride for the Americans today from the wreckage of their British Amateur challenge by winning two matches to remain among the last 32 competitors.

title: House Sets 69,000 As Limit on Dolphins Killed in Tuna Nets
description: WASHINGTON, June 11The House of Representatives voted today to impose a ceiling of 69,000 on the number of porpoises that may be killed in the nets of tuna fishermen this year, but it declined to mandate a future reduction of the quota.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Schlesinger Reduces 2 FuelSaving Goals Proposed by Carter
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (UPI)James R. Schlesinger sharply cut back today two goals of President Carter's energy programthe number of homes that can be insulated and the number that will get some solar heating and cooling

title: Cook Barred in Illinois Law Action
description: G. Bradford Cook, the former chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, who was barred Tuesday from practicing law before the United States Supreme Court, was suspended yesterday from practicing law in Illinois for three years. Mr. Cook had admitted to testifying falsely to a grand jury about a $200,000 contribution to the Nixon campaign by the fugitive financier Robert Vesco.

title: Bridge: Backgammon Is Filling Voids For Many While at Tourneys
description: A player who returned to the tournament scene after an absence of a decade or more would notice one development that has nothing to do with the game itself. He would observe large numbers of young players carrying something that looks like an attache case.

title: JOSEPHINE WILKINS, CIVIC LEADER, DIES
description: ATLANTA, June 1  Josephine Mathewson Wilkins, a civic leader, philanthropist and early supporter of the civil rights movement in the South, died Monday in Port Charlotte, Fla. She was 83 years old.

title: What The Judges Say It Is
description: The United States Constitution forbids a prison warden to inflict cruel punishment, such as flogging, on a convicted criminal who breaks prison rules. But the Constitution allows a teacher to flog a child, without giving him or her the chance to explain, for responding slowly to instructions.

title: Mets' Records
description: BATTING

title: East Bloc Is Still Puzzled About Changes at Kremlin
description: VIENNA, June 1Sovietbloc ambassadors and counselors sidle up to their Western colleagues at cocktail parties here and in other capitals these days and, after the usual bland preliminaries, ask them what they think about last week's changes in the Kremlin leadership.

title: Pat Bradley Confident In New Rochelle Golf
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., June 1 (AP) Pat Bradley is serving notice to everyone else entered in the $100,000 Ladies Professional Golf Association tournament that starts tomorrow at the Wykagyl Country Club that she intends to retain her title. The event has been increased to 72 holes and has a first prize of $15,000.

title: Miss Bueno Is Back
description: LONDON, June 1 (AP)Maria Bueno, 37yearold Brazilian, scored a victory in a grass tennis tournament at Beckenham today and talked about playing at Wimbledon again.

title: Record June Car Output Is Set For Windup of 1977 Model Year
description: DETROIT, June 1The domestic auto industry, winding up the 1977 model year, is scheduling production of a record 949,000 cars in June, up 8.6 percent from May's total.

title: STEEL PACT SEEN INCREASING PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP)  The Council on Wage and Price Stability said today that a new labor agreement in the steel industry should raise the cost of producing a ton of steel by 4 percent this year and about 3 percent in each of the succeeding years.

title: Hers
description: CASANOVA would have hated it. Don Juan would have thought it was sick. Frank Harris would suspect it was somewhat exaggerated. and Aretino would have said he told you so. As for me. I thought it was historic.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Music: A New Baton
description: THREE YEARS AGO Judith Somogi became the first woman to conduct the New York City Opera and two years ago she led her first symphonic program, directing the Los Angeles Philharmonic at Hollywood Bowl. On Tuesday night Miss Somogi's career blossomed a bit more when she made her debut with the New York Philharmonic in a Promenades concert that left no doubts about her basic musicianship and competence as a baton wielder.

title: Major League Box Scores
description: EDoRader, Winfield, ?? DP ?? Die?? 2. LOBSan Diego 7, San Francisco 4. 2B Champion. DoRader, RAndrews.

title: Leonard Silk
description: What ails the stock market? Wall Street itself is baffled. The economy is moving up at a strong clip, and the expansion probably will carry well into 1978. The Carter Administration continues to reassure business of its love and respect, even at the risk of offending the liberals of the Democratic Party. Plant and equipment spending appears to be reviving, and the McGrawHill Survey asserts that it will get a lot stronger as the year wears on. Yet the stock market stays feeble.

title: Dividends
description: WEDNESDAY, JUNE 1, 1977

title: ONE BULLET IS SUFFICIENT TO STOP 2 BANK SUSPECTS
description: A chase came to an end yesterday with an unusual display of police marksmanship: two bank robbery suspects hit by a single bullet.

title: BEAUFORT SEA DRILLING IS CLEARED BY CANADA
description: OTTAWA, June 1Overriding the objections of environmentalists, the Canadian Government authorized today offshore exploratory drilling for oil and natural gas in the Beaufort Sea for the next three years.

title: U.S. Offers to Alter Deployment of Its New Warhead
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The White House spokesman, Jody Powell, said today that if the Soviet Union was willing to undertake serious negotiations on limitation of strategic nuclear weapons, the United States can make changes in plans to deploy a more accurate intercontinental missile warhead capable of destroying more Soviet missiles in their launching silos.

title: People in Sports
description: Guy Lafleur, the right wing whose two goals and seven assists helped the Montreal Canadiens sweep the Boston Bruins in the Stanley Cup championship series, was in town yesterday to collect a plaque and a 1977 car for being Sport magazine's most valuable player in. the National Hockey League playoffs. Lafleur warned that the Canadiens planned to keep the heat on the rest of league, whether their excellence was bad for hockey or not.

title: A's Page Losing Grip
description: OAKLAND, Calif., June 1 (AP)Mitchell Page, the Oakland A's rookie outfielder whose batting average has dropped almost 100 points in the last month, had a sore hand examined here today. The problem, which has bothered Page the last four years, was described as a callous that prevents Page from gripping the bat tightly. A doctor in Detroit told Page that he Would be sidelined three weeks if the callous were cut out.

title: Home Beat
description: THE American way of designing using fashion designers to style home furnishings productsis now catching on with the French. Taco division of Texunion, the largest printers of dress and home furnishings fabrics in France (it prints 300,000 yards a day) is about to introduce its first collection by Karl Lagerfeld, the man who designs the highpriced Chloe fashions.

title: 23 Institutions in State Get $8.5 Million in Grants
description: Twentythree institutions in New York State have been awarded a total of $8.5 million in grants from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

title: Against Unionizing the Military
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.Anyone who has served in the military knows there are frustrations and inequities that need to be dealt with from time to time. There are grievance procedures within all the services that should and must work. But there is nothing a military commander can do about complaints over low pay, long working hours, and the potential for bodily injury while performing normal military duties.

title: N.B.A. Championship
description: PHILADELPHIA vs. PORTLAND

title: WILLIAM CASTLE, 63, MOVIE PRODUCER
description: William Castle, who made millions producing and directing films that horrified audiences and often left critics muttering about poor taste, suffered a heart attack at his home in Beverly Hills, Calif., Tuesday night and died at the University of California at Los Angeles Medical Center. He was 63 years old.

title: 8 Die in Brazil in Fall Of a 7Story Building
description: RECIFE, Brazil June 1 (AP)A sevenstory building of shops and apartments collapsed today, killing eight persons, the police reported.

title: TV: Cable Focuses On Homosexuals
