description: CABLE TELEVISION'S long standing promise of relief from the mass processing of tradi tional broadcasting formats creeps forward almost imperceptibly but not insignificantly. True, after nearly a decade of publicityhustling, Manhattan remains the only one of the city's boroughs covered by an official franchise, shared by Manhattan Cable and Teleprompter. But cable sales are booming in the more affluent suburbs, and the always desperate search for programming is becoming more intense.

title: Around the Nation
description: BALTIMORE, June 1 (AP)A former employee of the Central Intelligence Agency was sentenced to life in prison today on conviction of espionage and trying to sell classified documents to the Soviet Union.

title: A Paris Auction of Dufy Designs
description: PARIS An unusual collection of gouaches has been on display at the new auction hall in the former Gare d'Orsaycommercial art for fabrics by the painter Raoul Dufy.

title: Dee, Frankel CoWinners in Hochster Golf With 73's
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., June 1When Jack Nicklaus was playing in the United States Open at Winged Foot in 1974, he was asked by a proud member of that outstanding golf club, Isn't Winged Foot West as good a course as you've played, Jack?

title: World News Briefs
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Thursday, June 2 (AP)The 18,500ton cruise ship Rasa Sayang caught fire early today in the Malacca Strait with about 900 passengers and crew members aboard. Rescue officials said at least five persons had jumped overboard and were believed drowned.

title: Geraldine Fitzgerald Leaves Play for Film
description: Geraldine Fitzgerald has withdrawn from the cast of Michael Cristofer's Pulitzer Prizewinning drama, The Shadow Box, to star in The Mango Tree, a movie to be produced by Michael Pate from a novel by Ronald McKie. It will be filmed on location in Australia for Pisces Production under the direction of Kevin Dobson. The production is being partly subsidized by the Australian Govetnment in an effort to stimulate local moviemaking.

title: Eritrean Rebels Think They Scent Victory
description: NAKFA, EthiopiaAfter 15 years of armed struggle, rebels seeking independence for the northernmost Ethiopian province of Eritrea say that their goal is in sight.

title: Mrs. Carter Flies onto Ecuador And Is Given a Military Welcome
description: QUITO, Ecuador, June 1Fresh from visits to two democracies, Rosalynn Carter was given a military welcome today when she arrived in Ecuador, the first country on her diplomatic tour to be ruled by the armed forces.

title: Toiler Cranston: Lonely at the Top
description: TOILER CRANSTON has been called a Nureyev on ice, a Renaissance man, the pioneer of artistic skating, a maverick and a raging egomaniac. But now, sitting in his luxurious apartment across from Carnegie Hall, he could only be called depressed.

title: Twins Top Yanks, 43, On 3 in 9th
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., June 1After leading from the second inning against the Minnesota Twins tonight, the Yankees found themselves in an unenviable spot in the ninth inningthe tying run at third base, the winning run at second base and Rod Carew at bat.

title: Nor Any Drop to Drink
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 1One small drip of water wastes 25 gallons a day, or 9,000 gallons a year, cautioned an airport sign.

title: Art and Taxes on the Menu At Mrs. Mondale's Luncheon
description: WASHINGTON, June 1One of the country's smallest minority groups got a hearing at the VicePresidential mansion today, as Joan Mondale presided over the first in a series of working luncheons that she is having to consider the problems of artists.

title: Mexico Claims Drug Victory
description: MEXICO CITY, June 1 (UPI)Troops and policemen have destroyed 80 percent of Mexico's marijuana and poppy plants and arrested more than 900 drug traffickers in the last six months, Defense Secretary Flix Galvn Lpez said today. This has definitely been the best crackdown against drug trafficking in all the history of Mexico, he said.

title: FINANCIAL REPORTS URGED FROM MORE F.D.I.C. STAFF
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (UPI)  The General Accounting Office said today that more employees of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation should be required to file financial disclosure statements.

title: U. S. WARNS RHODESIA ON RAID OVER BORDER
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The United States said today that Rhodesia's seizure of a Mozambican town in pursuit of guerrillas could have extremely serious consequences for the region. Officials said they were considering a range of possible responses, including support for new Security Council moves against Rhodesia.

title: Shortage of Funds Forces Alabama To Postpone Scores of Civil Trials
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 1  A shortage of operating funds forced the postponement today of scores of trials in Alabama courts, which had been cited in recent years as national examples of reform and efficiency. The salaries of many court officials also were cut off.

title: Companies List Earnings Reports
description: For periods ended April 30 unless otherwise indicated. (N) Indicates stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange (A) American Stock Exchange, and (O)OvertheCounter.

title: TeenAgers Are Praised for Their Volunteer Work At Scene of Kentucky Fire and at Makeshift Morgue
description: FORT THOMAS, Ky., June 1Andrew L. Scholl's father recently characterized his son jokingly as a typical teenager who was too lazy to pick up his shoes or clean up his room. Much has happened in recent days to change that description of the 17yearold high school student and many other young people in this area.

title: Personal Beauty
description: TO SOME women, the idea of making their own cosmetics as fascinating as mud pies are to a child. Why can't you concoct your own cleansing cream, or beauty mask, or bath oil? If you have the patience to shop for ingredients and turn your kitchen into a cosmetics laboratory, and you don't mind cleaning up the mess, you can save money in the long run and know exactly what goes into your brew.

title: Home Repair Q &
description: Q. I have a dull gray plastic tile on my kitchen wall. I am now removing this tile, but I am finding that the glue, used to paste the tiles on is very hard to remove. Is there an easier way than just hours of scraping? Mrs. M.R., Baltimore.

title: Dave Anderson
description: In changing managers, the New York Mets produced one giant leap for Joe Torre, but only one small step for the organization.

title: Venice Biennale to Show Works By Eastern European Dissidents
description: ROME, May 31After weeks of delay and over the protests of the Soviet Embassy, the organizers of a major arts festival decided today to go ahead with plans to devote a major part of their new program to dissent in Eastern Europe.

title: Market Place
description: A five months' supply of copper and copper scrap overhanging the market has led domestic producers to cut prices of the metal and has helped bring about the lowest prices of the year for copper shares.

title: Books of The Times
description: KATE SAYS TO Harvey: You are incredibly full of anger, Harvey; when are you going to come to terms with that? Harvey replies to Kate: I'm not full of anger. I'm full of granola. I'm trying to come to terms with granola.

title: Unveiling
description: SANDMarcia Sugerman. A monument will be unveiled in memory of Marcia Sugerman Sand, Sunday, June 5, 11 A.M. at Mt. Neboh Cemetery, Cypress Hills, Queens.

title: Intercounty Bus Line Approved
description: ALBANY. June 1 (AP)The State Transportation Department has approved a bus line between Nanuet in Rockland County and White Plains in Westchester. Details, such as fares, hours and stops, still have to be worked out. The line is to be operated by the Bronxville Bus Company of Yonkers.

title: Bamboo and Paper Lamps Fan a Soft and Natural Glow
description: I WAS looking for somethinganythingthat would product a soft light, Ingo Maurer recalled during a visit to New York last week. That search took ,the West German lighting designer to Paris, where he found what he was looking forbamboo and lacquered: ricepaper fans: Then the quest took him t Tokyo, where he soughtand foundcraftsmen capable of executing the designs he had in mind.

title: Washington & Business
description: WASHINGTONTo Howard D. Samuel, Deputy Under Secretary of Labor for International Affairs, those who talk about free trade these days are kidding themselves. And that includes, he said, certain other agencies of the Carter Administration.

title: Concern About a Decline In Soybean Stocks Sparks Increase of 13c a Bushel
description: CHICAGO, June 1 (AP)Concern about diminishing stocks sparked a demand that lifted old crop soybean futures 13 cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade today.

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: A Meteoric Rise Finally Disturbs Japan's Politics
description: TOKYO, June 1  From the monochrome mass of Japanese politicians, Yohei Kono, 39 years old, has emerged as a new star in less than a year. In the campaign for the election to the upper house of Parliament, which will probably be held July 3, he and his party, the New Liberal Club, are the most closely watched opposition group.

title: Backgammon Column Starts Next Week
description: Beginning next Thursday, The Home Section of The New York Times will carry a regular column on backgammon, A. M. Rosenthal, the executive editor of the newspaper, announced yesterday.

title: Barri McDonough Wed To G. C. Blauvelt, Banker
description: Barri B. McDonough, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James E. McDonough of Greenwich, Conn., was married there yesterday at the home of her parents, to G. Christopher Blauvelt, son of Mrs. George W. Blauvelt of Naples, Fla., and Cotuit, Mass., and the late Mr. Blauvelt. The Rev. Jack G. Shutte of the First Presbyterian Chuch in Greenwich performed the ceremony.

title: Steps in the Legal Maze
description: Here are some basic steps to be taken when converting a commercial building in Manhattan into a residential coop:

title: KEY JOB BIAS CASES MAYBE RECONSIDERED
description: WASHINGTON, June 1Landmark job discrimination cases such as those in steel and communications might have to be reconsidered under yesterday's Supreme Court decision upholding seniority systems, legal sources said today.

title: Mrs. Jocius Leads Bowling
description: MILWAUKEE, June 1 (AP)Mary Anne Jocius of Riverdale, Md., swept into the singles and overall leads in Division II competition today at the Women's International Bowling Congress championship tournament. A 667 singles series keyed her performance, as she rolled games of 246, 226 and 195. Beth Pede of Milwaukee had previously held the lead with 597. Series of 522 in the team event and 483 in doubles gave Mrs. Jocius a 1,672 total outpinning Verla Mae Staab of Hayes, Kan., whose 1,646 had led for 54 days. Eight days remain in the 71day tournament.

title: EDWIN GASPERINI, PARTNER IN A NEW YORK LAW FIRM
description: Edwin L. Gasperini, a trial lawyer who served a number of state investigative agencies, died yesterday in the offices of his law firm, Gasperini & Savage, at 10 East 53d Street. He was 53 years old and lived in Mount Kisco, N.Y.

title: Resistance to Merger Is Continuing in N.H.L
description: Saying it is prepared to produce about $3.2 million per club as a dowry, the World Hockey Association is waiting this week for the blessing of the National Hockey League board of governors and the N.H.L: Players Association in the W.H.A.'s proposed union with the older league. But an official invitation to end the expensive fiveyear rivalry between the leagues may not be as imminent as the W.H.A. owners would like to believe.

title: Setback Is Seen in Saudi Prince's Apartthent Hunt
description: Prince Saud alFaisal, Saudi Arabia's Foreign Minister and a likely heir to the Saudi throne, has been identified as the Arab prince who has been trying to buy a luxury Park Avenue apartment. Realestate informants said yesterday that he suffered a setback Tuesday.

title: Kodak and Xerox Unveil Printers Using Lasers
description: The Xerok Corporation and the Eastman Kodak Company each introduced computer readout systems using lasers York City yesterday, marking a further penetration by lasers into the wordprocessing business.

title: Lonrho Sues Big Oil Companies, Charges They Supply Rhodesia
description: LONDON, June 1 (AP)The Lonrho Trading Company, once exclusive supplier of oil to Rhodesia, said last night that it had filed suit in London against American, British and other oil companies for allegedly suppling fuel to the white Rhodesian Government in defiance of United Nations sanctions.

title: TWO UTILITIES OFFER $300 MILLION IN BONDS
description: The Michigan Bell Telephone Company and Commonwealth Edison Company each came to the corporate bond market yesterday with $150 million offerings. By late afternoon underwriters were reporting the $300 million oneday calendar as being only partly sold. in the taxexempt market, on the other hand, an array of smaller issues were reportedly well spoken for in this holidayshortened week. In the secondary markets  Government, corporate and municipal  trading was light and price changes minimal

title: Lance Cautions Bankers in U.S. On Rising Rates
description: WASHINGTON, June 1Calling himself a lowinterestrate man, Budget Director Bert Lance said today that banks were unable to justify their higher prime lending rates on the basis of higher loan demand and warned that the new round of increases threatened to make inflation worse and weaken the business recovery.

title: Soviet Again Supplying Arms to Syria, But It Withholds Its Newest
description: DAMASCUS, SyriaThe Soviet Union has resumed the delivery of arms to Syria, but these have not included any of the new aircraft, missiles or tanks now being deployed by the Soviet forces.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Yemen Breaks With Portugal
description: SANA, Yemen, June 1 (Reuters)Yemen severed diplomatic relations today with Portugal. A Foreign Ministry statement said the measure had been taken after the decision in Lisbon to raise its diplomatic representation with Israel to ambassadorial level. The statement added that Arab governments had failed to persuade Portugal to revoke its decision.

title: Dutch Authorities, Moluccans Disagree on Mediators
description: ASSEN, The Netherlands, June 1Dutch Government authorities and South Moluccan terrorists could not agree on mediators today and for the 10th night, the armed kidnappers held 60 hostages aboard a train and in a village school in northeast Holland.

title: Lingerie Leaves The Bedroom
description: THE fashion news about underwear has long been negative, focusing on the bras women discarded, the slips they didn't wear anymore, and the Tshirts or old sweaters they slept in instead of nightgowns.

title: U.S. Offers to Alter Deployment of Its New Warhead
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The White House spokesman, Jody Powell, said today that if the Soviet Union was willing to undertake serious negotiations on limitation of strategic nuclear weapons, the United States can make changes in plans to deploy a more accurate intercontinental missile warhead capable of destroying more Soviet missiles in their launching silos.

title: Soviet Charges a Key Jewish HumanRights Activist With Treason
description: MOSCOW, June 1A leading Jewish dissident and humanrights activist has been formally charged with treason in a move by Soviet authorities that has few precedents since the days of Stalin.

title: Nightlong BudgetBalancing Act
description: The decisions about how New York City will spend its money next year were made at a meeting at Gracie Mansion that began the night before last and did not break up until dawn yesterday.

title: Tennis
description: AT PARIS $300,000 FRENCH OPEN

title: Actors Fund Shop Aids Needy Performers
description: The Actors Fund of America, like the theatrical charity organization, has opened a new shop at 210 West 44th Street featuring theater memorabilia, objets d'art, silver, jewelry, furniture records, autographed programs, photographs, books, costumes and clothing. Profits from the venture will be used to assist needy performers.

title: Horse Shows
description: AT DEVON, PA.

title: Photo Finish Thrusts Spirit Level Into Belmont Picture
description: Until yesterday, most horseplayers had never heard of Spirit Level. Now they know him as a promising newcomer, a fresh 3yearold colt that can beat horses like Sanhedrin, Giboulee and Coined Silver while going mile and an eighth with only 114 pounds on his back.

title: Broncos Sign Spurrier
description: DENVER, June 1 (AP)The Denver Broncos, who recently acquired the veteran quarterback, Craig Morton, from the New York Giants, today signed a free agent quarterback, Steve Spurrier. Spurrier spent last year with the Tampa Bay Buccandeers.

title: Carter's Woes With Congress
description: WASHINGTON, June 1They think they're supposed to run the Government, Representative David R. Obey said the other day about the Carter Administration. They would be perfectly happy if we never changed a dime. The Wisconsin Democrat's analysis was a Congressionaleye view of events last week, when the House and Senate repeatedly challenged President Carter and the Office of Management and Budget over Federal spending for farm price supports, dams and irrigation schemes and aid to education. Mr. Carter viewed those potential challenges, none of which will reach a signorveto stage until July, in another way, listing them together on Thursday as he said a lack of restraint by Congress posed a threat to his goal of a balanced budget by 1981.

title: Broadway Season Gives City a Reason to Applaud
description: There's no business like show business....

title: People and Business
description: James L. Ketelsen has been elected president of Tenneco Inc., a multiindustry company based in Houston. He succeeds Wilton E. Scott, who has been chairman, president and chief executive officer since October 1975. Mr. Scott, who is 64, continues as chairman and chief executive officer.

title: MRS. ABZUG PUTS ON HER CAMPAIGN HAT
description: With showbusiness celebrities at the press tables and a Dixieland combo next to the dais playing I like New York in June, Bella S. Abzug yesterday threw her hata bigbrimmed black strawinto the race for the Democratic nomination for Mayor of New York City.

title: Letters
description: Ingenious Solution

title: Dollar Is Mixed in Europe in Light Trading
description: LONDON, June 1 (AP)The dollar had a mixed day in erratic light trading in European money markets today. The price of gold moved up a dollar an ounce in Zurich and more in London.

title: No Immediate U.S. Comment
description: WASHINGTON, June 11Neither the White House nor the State Department had any immediate comment on the reports from Moscow that Anatoly Shcharansky, the Jewish dissident, will face treason charges.

title: Vanguard for Commuters
description: A littlenoted recommendation in President Carter's national energy plan is a call for 6,000 vans, to move Government workers to and from their jobs. The idea deserves the President's boost; Congress should now add its support. Van pooling is one of those ideas whose excellence is matched by its simplicity.

title: Calendar Of Events
description: Some events of interest for enthusiasts of the house and home.

title: Steiner Places First In N.C.A.A. Decathlon
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., June 1 (UPI)Tito Steiner, an Argentine Olympic athlete, took over first place after today's first event and never trailed in winning the National Collegiate decathlon with 7,659 points, the fourth Brigham Young University winner of the event in the last five years.

title: GoingResidential
description: WHEN THE NUMBER of commercial buildings going into default in Manhattan began to increase a year or so ago, New York City began encouraging landlords to rent vacant commercial space for residential use

title: Jury. Told That Heiress Was Target Of Murder Plot Husband Planned
description: Mary Lea Johnson D'Arc, heiress to the Johnson & Johnson pharmaceutical fortune, was the target of a murder plot allegedly planned by her husband, Dr. Victor D'Arc, a psychiatrist, a Bronx jury was told yesterday.

title: POSTMASTER IS HELD IN BIG POSTAL THEFT
description: lantic and other South Jersey counties.

title: Gottfried, 2 Sets Down, Beats Nastase
description: PARIS, June 1 (AP)Brian Gottfried battled from two sets down and beat topseeded Ilie Nastaste, 46, 36, 62, 62, 63, in the quarterfinals of the $300,000 French open tennis championships tonight.

title: Jupiter Bathing Solar System With Radiation, Probes Show
description: Spacecraft soaring into the outer parts of the solar system and toward its heart have confirmed that Jupiter is bathing a vast region with radiation.

title: The Watchdog's Bark
description: WASHINGTONOne year after Senator Frank Church's committee documented widespread abuses and lawbi eaking by the nation's intelligence agencies, its successor, the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence, has announced that the Central Intelligence Agency and other intelligence agencies are under the control of the President and fully ... accountable to Congress. If so, reform has been remarkably swift.

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: Inflation is here to stay. Nothing Jimmy Carter or Arthur Burns or anyone else does is likely to lower the inflation rate below 6 percent in the next few years. Because of the, way the American economy is structured, even the harshest antiinflationary measures would have small effect on the cost of living in the foreseeable future. The practical response is to learn to live with it.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY SE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300: NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: MOVIE STOCKS STAR IN A MARKET RALLY AS DOW GAINS 7.89
description: Movierelated stocks starred yesterday as the general market staged a sharp rally after a twoweek slump that had carried the Dow Jones industrial average to its lowest level in nearly 17 months.

title: Two Law Enforcement Agencies Are Set Up by State To Prevent Infiltration of Mob Into Atlantic City
description: TRENTON, June 1Governor Byrne announced today the creation of two lawenforcement groups to prevent efforts by three organizedcrime families to take over restaurant and liquor businesses in Atlantic City.

title: Waldheim Condemns Raid
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 1Secretary General Kurt Waldheim and United Nations diplomats have condemned Rhodesia's foray into Mozambique but there has been no move so far to take the incident to the Security Council.

title: 19 Firms Assail S.E.C.'s Stock Trade Plan
description: Nineteen major firms in the brokerge and investment banking industry issued a strong position statement yesterday backing the auction market for securities and attacking last month's Securities and Exchange Commission proposal to allow New York Stock Exchange members to trade listed stocks offboard.

title: Ballet: Homage to Magallanes
description: TOSSING back a toast five years ago, to his friend the late Igor Stravinsky, George Balanchine toted that in Russia we drink to the health ofthe guy that died. On. that particular occasion they also danced a weeklong memorial in the form of the Stravinsky Festival.

title: GOLDIN AUDIT SCORES FOSTERCARE SYSTEM
description: More than a third of the 29,000 New York City children in foster care have been kept there years longer than necessaty, the City Comptroller's office said yesterday, often harming the children and adding an unnecessary $233 million to the city budget.

title: Atlantic City Postmaster Is Held In $1 Million Post Office Robbery
description: NEWARK, June 1The postmaster in Atlantic City has been arrested for allegedly helping mastermind a $1 million robbery at the main post office there, Federal officials said today. They said that he gave the building' s master key and other security information to four men accused of looting three postal vaults on Feb. 27.

title: Connecticut Report Is Critical of Reilly's Prosecution
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn., June 1A special grand jury's report into the investigation and prosecution in the Peter Reilly murder case made public here today concluded that the youthaccused of murdering his motherwas a victim of a widespread pattern of harassment and improper activity on the part of a local prosecutor and the state police.

title: Old Flying Boat on L.I. Is Reliving Its Past
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., June 1Half boat, half aeroplaneand all nostalgia  the 34yearold, fourengine Southern Cross lifted from the waters of Manhasset Bay this afternoon on a flight to Ireland and into the past.

title: Broadway Season Gives City a Reason to Applaud
description: There's no business like show business... That refrain from the old Irving Berlin song took on new meaning in the 197677 theater season that ended Tuesday night. The season brought substantial rises in audiences and in ticket revenues, set new records for the Broadway theaters and made show business one of the few growth industries in the otherwise shrinking New York City economy.

title: T.W.A. Commercials: Grammar and Logic
description: Steven Goldberg is an assistant professor in the department of sociology at City College and a man who is interested in logic. And he objects to the Trans World Airlines slogan, Being the best isn't everything. It's the only thing, not because it's not grammatical but because it's not logical.

title: NEW & USEFUL
description: I have this belief in companionable items, Jeff London said the other day. Thus, a few years ago when his house was a bit bare, he made some furniture that looked like people. One thing led to another. Friends got interested, the word spread, and now he makes his people furniture on commission. You can order a portrait of yourself, or anyone else, in the form of a chair, sofa, bed or dining set. The zany portraits are made from cutout plywood painted with the face and figure back and front and upholstered with what appears to be parts of the clothing. Sometimes I use real shoes or other costume parts, Mr. London said. I can also make interchangeable parts, like arms or legs. Chairs start at $1,100; sofas and beds start at $1,500. Mr. London can be reached at 180 Thimble Islands Road, Stony Creek, Conn. 06405; telephone: (203) 4882939.

title: At Your Service: Bleaching Floors for a Fashionable Bare Look
description: GLORIA SWANSON has a white stained floor in her living room. The library floor of Henry Fonda's East Side townhouse is bleached, as are the floors in the Central Park West apartment of Robert Metzger, the interior designer.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, JUNE 2, 1977

title: Council Clearing Beame Budgets, Rebuffs Schools
description: With all outstanding issues resolved, the City Council last night adopted Mayor Beame's $13.9 billion expense budget for next year with only minor modifications and headed for approval of the $1.4 billion capital budget.

title: French Red Sketches Role in Power
description: PARIS, June 1The French Communist leader, Georges Marchais, told the foreign press here today that there is no more effective party in France than his.

title: Concorde Flights to Kennedy Put Off Again
description: The start of Concorde test flights to Kennedy International Airport has been delayed at least two weeks more. This resulted when a panel of Federal appeals judges yesterday sharply questioned the clarity of the Federal stand on the legality of New York City's ban on the supersonic plane.

title: Asarco Cuts Price Of Its Copper by 3c
description: Asarco Inc., sent out a trial balloon yesterday, cutting the price of copper by 3 cents, to 68 cents a pound. None of the other major producers followed its lead and none would comment on Asarco's action.

title: Recital: Violinist as Technician
description: David Davis is a violinist who can play difficult music calmly and with considerable technical success when he focuses his skill and musicianship on something like Bartk's Sonata for Solo Violin or the PaganiniKreisler I Palpiti, which he did at Alice Tully Hall on Tuesday night.

title: Beckenbauer's Local Debut a Loss
description: EAST RUTHERFORD. N.J., June 1He was playing on an artificial surface for the first time and in a rather unfamiliar position but Franz Beckenbauer's metropolitan area debut tonight was still impressive.

title: Only About Half of Public Knows U.S. Has to Import Oil, Gallup Survey Shows
description: Only a little more than half of the American public is aware that the United States must import oil to meet its energy needs, according to the latest Gallup Poll.

title: Mandel's Second Trial Begins With a Slight Accident
description: BALTIMORE, June 1The retrial of Gov. Marvin Mandel and five friends on Federal corruption charges finally began in United States District Court here today after a series of delays occasioned by the Governor's twomonth illness and a minor but dramatic accident this morning that left him shaken but unharmed.

title: Margolis TaxFraud Trial Hears Testimony of Entertainer Client
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., June 1The tax fraud trial of a Bay Area attorney, Harry Margolis, moving into its 11th week in United States District Court here, today heard testimony from the actresssinger Barbara McNair.

title: ACCORD SEEMS NEAR ON AN AID PROGRAM FOR NEEDY NATIONS
description: PARIS, Thursday, June 2After nearly 18 months of difficult and slowmoving talks, the representatives of the world's rich and poor nations appeared to be approaching agreement early today on a limited international program intended to help the developing world, but a deadlock over plans to make increases in the price of oil more difficult threatened to sour relations between the two blocs.

title: State Prison Officials Don't Know If Release Program Deters Crime
description: ALBANY, June 1State correctional officials conceded today under questioning at a Legislative hearing that they had no real evidence that the controversial temporaryrelease program for prisoners was reducing crime.

title: Bangladesh Gives Vote Tally
description: DACCA, June 1 (Reuters)President Ziaur Rahman won 98.87 per cent of the votes cast in Monday's national, referendum, according to the final count. The Bangladesh Election Commission said 33,609,869 people of the country's 38.4 million voters had voted.

title: Peter M. Fraser, 86, Long Head Of a Hartford Insurance Company
description: Peter M. Fraser, who retired in 1957 as chairman of the Connecticut Mutual Life Insurance Company, Hartford, died yesterday in Hartford Hospital after a brief illness. He lived in West Hartford, and was 86 years old.

title: The Standings
description: Thursday, June 2, 1977

title: 6 Big City Stores Show Strong Rise In Volume for May
description: In a strong turnaround from a year ago, sales in May of six of New York City's largest department stores achieved their biggest yeartoyear gain in 33 months.

title: ROBERT L. DUNCAN SR.
description: SUMMIT, N.J., May 31 (AP)Robert Laird Duncan Sr. of Westfield, N.J., a former allAmerica quarterback and longtime high school athletic director, died yesterday in Overlook Hospital. He was 74 years old.

title: Notes on People
description: THE EVOLUTION of Plains, Ga., into a tourist attraction continues to take its toll on the Hies of its residents. Now W. C. Lamb has resigned as city manager of President Carter's hometown because enforcing zoning laws there makes everybody mad. Mr. Lamb denied that a confrontation with Mr. Carter's. brother, Billy, led him to resign. Rather, he said, there's three or four times as much to this job as there was last year. After the city council meeting last month, two members resigned, and now a special election is scheduled June 14 to replace Mr. Lamb and the two former councilmen.

title: Belmont Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: LABOR MAY SIDETRACK RIGHTTOWORK PLEA
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., June 1To improve chances for Congressional passage of changes in labor laws this year, organized labor will probably sidetrack the most controversial element in its legislative package, its demand for repeal of the socalled state right to work laws.

title: About New York
description: Every month, it seems, someone must announce for Mayor, and Bella S. Abzug, who came in with June yesterday, occupied the selfconfident thoughts of Edward I. Koch, March's entry, as he finished his morning grapefruit and coffee and glanced out at a mild cloudburst keeping the city gray and wet.

title: Elizabeth Bancroft Schlesinger, Feminist and Historian's Widow
description: Elizabeth Bancroft Schlesinger, a leading feminist, died yesterday in the home of a son, Thomas B. Schlesinger, in Williamsburg, Va. She was 90 years old.

title: Design Notebook
description: COMPLAINTS ABOUT the Guggenheim Museum's supposed inhospitability to the art it was built to contain have been in the air years  since before the museum opened in 1959, in fact. When the opening did arrive, The New York Times called the building a war between architecture and painting in which both come out badly maimed, and the contestants in the battle, maimed or not, have continued to joust at least gently since that time.

title: Byrne Contends Tax Is Key Issue in Jersey Election; DeRose, Roe, Florio, Hoffman, Garramone Disagree
description: Governor Byrne said yesterday that if he were defeated in New Jersey's Democratic primary for Governor on Tuesday, it would be because of voter rejection of the state income tax.

title: 76ers Stay Inconsistent In Playoffs
description: PORTLAND, Ore., June 1The Philadelphia 76ers and Portland Trail Blazers. like a couple of dozen extratall JekyllHydes. flew across the country today to resume their struggle for the National Basketball Association championship in Philadelphia Friday night, with the basketball world wondering which would display which manifestation in game No. 5.

title: Airman Guilty in Cross Burning
description: MILDENHALL, England, June 1 (Reuters)A United States airman was found guilty today of a charge linked to the Ku Klux Klanstyle burning of a cross and was sentenced to four months at hard labor. The airman, Patrick Ryan, 20 years old, from Victor, N.Y., was the last of six United States airmen accused over the cross burning at the base at nearby Lakenheath, in eastern England, in February during an event celebrating the history and achievement of blacks.

title: Florence's Tag Sales Play S.R.O.Crowds
description: WHEN FLORENCE HECHT takes her show on the road, the fans follow. Along the highway, the signs beckon them on like marquee lights to the suburban lawns where Florence plants her billboard.

title: Amrita Ghosh Wed To Richard Douglas
description: Amrita Ghosh, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Shankar Ghosh of Calcutta, India, was married yesterday to Richard M. Douglas, son of Mr. and Mrs. G. A. Douglas of Stockholm and New York. The civil ceremony was performed in the office of the Consulate General of India at the New India House by Queens Deputy City Clerk Robert E. Whalen.

title: Eritrean Rebels Think They Scent Victory
description: NAKFA, EthiopiaAfter 15 years of armed struggle, rebels seeking independence for the northernmost Ethiopian province of Eritrea say that their goal is in sight.

title: Palestinians Create New Force
description: BEIRUT, June 1The Palestine Liberation Organization has created a new army with the double mission of fighting Israel and confronting Lebanese rightwing Christians who oppose the Palestinian presence here.

title: Orders to Factories Off a Little in April; Cars Most Affected
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP)New factory orders and shipments of manufactured products declined slightly in April, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Putnam Tax Takes Effect
description: BREWSTER, N. Y., June 1 (AP)Putnam County's local sales tax of 1 percent took effect today. Combined with the 4 percent state sales tax, the new levy means consumers in the county will have to pay 5 cents on the dollar for taxable goods and services. The tax is expected to produce $1 million for the county this year and $1.7 million next year.

title: F.D.A. Is Recalling 280,000 Jars Of Baby Food Containing a Mold
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP)The recall of 280,000 jars of Beechnut baby food containing mold has been announced by the Food and Drug Administation.

title: Alaska OilCarrying Cost Is Put at Over $6 a Barrel
description: WASHINGTON, June 1The Atlantic Richfield Company has told the Interstate Commerce Commission that the carrying of oil through the Alaska pipeline will cost $6.04 a barrelmuch higher than the $5.50 Federal officials had expected.

title: Bristol to Appeal Fine And 5Day Suspension
description: CINCINNATI, June 1 (AP)  Dave Bristol, manager of the Atlanta Braves, disclosed tonight he had received a fiveday suspension and a $500 fine from League, as a result of an alleged bumpLeague as a result of an alleged bumping incident involving an umpire. Bristol said he was appealing the ruling, thus allowing him to continue managing until the appeal is settled.

title: Disks: Blossom Dearie Sings
description: Blossom Dearie's career has undergone a series of unusual and impressive steps. It started in the 40's with her arrival in New York; local jazz aficionados recall her as the intermission pianist in a 52nd Street strip joint. A long residence in Paris followed in the 50's where she was the guiding light of a provocatively jazzoriented singing group, the Blue Stars, and later a solo performer, a singer and pianist with a distinctive and imaginative repertory and a voice that managed to combine a little girl's confidential whisper with an aura of sophistication. In recent years she has become, more and more, a selfcon tained operationshe writes many, if not most, of the songs she sings, publishes them herself and records them on her own label, Daffodil.

title: A Federal Report on Science Education Finds Some Evidence of Decay
description: American science continues to be strong, competitive and dynamic, but is showing some disturbing signs of decay, according to a study for the National Foundation.

title: Harvey, an Attack Rabbit, No Bugs Bunny, Gets a Home
description: After Harvey, a gray rabbit, had bitten six people, his owners decided to turn him over to the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animalsto prevent cruelty to humans.

title: Soviet Testing HighSpeed Train
description: MOSCOW, June 1 (AP)The Soviet Railway Administration is testing engines nd tracks for a highspeed train between Moscow and Leningrad that will cut the trip between the Soviet Union's two biggest cities from six hours to three, Pravda, the Communist Party newspaper, reported today. It said the train would cover the 396 miles at 136 miles an hour.

title: MRS. ABZUG PUTS ON HER CAMPAIGN HAT
description: With showbusiness celebrities at the press tables and a Dixieland combo next to the dais playing I like New York in June, Bella S. Abzug yesterday threw her hata bigbrimmed black strawinto the race for the Democratic nomination for Mayor of New York City.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: ANTIABORTION MOVE IS BACKED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, June 1After a long and bitter debate that resurrected nearly every argument of the last decade for and against abortion, the State Senate went on record tonight in favor of an antiabortion amendment to the United States Constitution.

title: BROWN WOULD AVOID ARMS SPENDING RISE
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, June 1Secretary of Defense Harold Brown told 851 graduating Air Force Academy cadets today that the Carter Administration hoped to avoid altogether increases in military spending beyond those forced by inflation.

title: Deaths
description: ALBERGSomer, age 69, died suddenly of a heart attack, May 31, 1977, al his home in Pound Ridge, N.Y. An actor for many years he appeared with such stars as Maurice Evans and Jose Ferrer. Later he spent sev eral years in insurance as an associate of Sidney Vyorst. He is survived by his wife, Mildred. Services private.

title: Recital: Hart's Lyrical Violin
description: Although Alfred Hart's violin recital in Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night listed familiar names, the first part of the program was not hackneyed. Bach's Sonata for violin and keyboard No. 5 in F minor, Schubert's Sonatina No. 1 in D (Op. 137) and Schumann's Sonata No. 2 in D minor (Op. 121) are not encountered as often as many other works in the repertory.

title: C.I.A. Will Leave Door Ajar to Give Tourists A Peek at Operations
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (AP)The Central Intelligence Agency, which tried to keep secret for years the site of its headquarters, in suburban Langley, Va., is planning to open its doors to tourists.

title: Indians Dance at Powwow That Reflects a New Beat
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., May 29  Dressed in festive regalia, Abe Conklin and Charles Tillman, Osage Otoe Indians from Oklahoma City, were up and prancing on nearly every dance.

title: G.O.P. REBUTS WHITE HOUSE ON NEW GAS AND CAR TAXES
description: WASHINGTON, June 1 (UPI)Eight leading Republicans endorsed today President Carter's call for energy conservation, but they challenged the need for stiff new taxes on gasoline or big cars and said that the supply of oil was not so grim as Mr. Carter suggested.

title: New JusticeSystem Complex Is Planned for Trenton
description: TRENTON, June 1Plans for a $50 million justice complex in downtown Trenton to house the state judiciary system, the Department of Law and Public Safety and the Department of the Public Advocate were announced today by Governor Byrne.

title: Monastery Site Is Consecrated By Tibet Order
description: KENT, N.Y., June 1A sacred ceremony from the mountains of Tibet was enacted today in the rustling forest of this small American town.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: DAYLIGHT SAVING TIME

title: Folk: 3 Griots Captivate
description: THE STORYTELLER from Gambia who was consulted by Alex Haley and provided crucial documentation for Mr. Haley's bestselling book Roots, may or may not have been an authentic griot. Griots are members of a hereditary caste of singing bards who function as oral historians of their people.

title: Letter From Home
description: NEW HAVEN IT USED TO BE called Decoration Day, and the memory of my first one comes back from early childhood. I can still see the middleaged men of our town marching down Main Street in the World War I uniforms that they could no longer button around their expanded waists. I still remember the flags and the band and the ceremony on the green where the war monument was decorated with flowers. I can still recall thinking how American it was, and how fitting. Anyone who had died for his country deserved to be honored. Anyone who had fought for his country deserved to dress up in his old khakis and medals to remind the townspeopleand small boys sitting on the sidewalkthat he was there.

title: ACCORD SEEMS NEAR ON AN AID PROGRAM FOR NEEDY NATIONS
description: PARIS, Thursday, June 2After nearly 18 months of difficult and slowmoving talks, the representatives of the world's rich and poor nations appeared to be approaching agreement early today on a limited international program intended to help the developing world, but a deadlock over plans to make increases in the price of oil more difficult threatened to sour relations between the rich and poor naions.

title: Piggott Pilots The Minstrel. To Victory in English Derby
description: EPSOM, England, June 1The Minstrel won the English Derby today by a neck over Hot Grove in a stretch drive hat was a double triumph for Lester Piggott his jockey.

title: Dollar Steady Against Yen
description: TOKYO, June 1 (AP)The dollar closed at 277.275 yen for the third consecutive day today in light trading on the Tokyo foreign exchange market.

title: Torre's 20 as Mets Win On Stearns Slam by 64
description: MONTREAL, June 1Joe Torre, in the midst of his instant transformation from player to manager, issued simple instructions to the Mets tonight in his first meeting with the players.

title: Washington & Business
description: Howard D. Samuel, Deputy Under Secretary of Labor for International Affairs, envisages increasing use by the United States of the escape clause in trade agreements to protect American workers' jobs from vanishing under a tide of imports. Page D9.

title: Doing Your Own Contracting
description: IT WAS BAD enough when the design for the new kitchen that had looked so good on paper proved to be so out of plumb with reality that the cabinets and sink had to be moved at an extra cost of $180.

title: World Team Tennis
description: TUESDAY NIGHT'S MATCH

title: Mr. Smith Fights Alone
description: By sending his troops 50 miles into neighboring Mozambique, Prime Minister Smith of Rhodesia has added a new tactic to a now familiar strategy. The tactic seeks to inflame an already tense situation and to bid for military advantage. The strategy is to concede nothing to the blacks who seek political power in Rhodesia in the hope that the Western nations will in the end help to preserve the regime of the minority whites.

title: Washington and Panama Reported in Agreement On Elements of a Treaty
description: PANAMA CITY, June 1 (AP)United States and Panamanian negotiators have drafted substantial portions of a general Panama Canal treaty and have prepared a second treaty designed to guarantee the canal's neutrality, informed sources close to both sides reported.

title: Manhattan Plaza Gets First Tenants and the Last Laugh
description: With speeches and champagne, with showbusiness and political personalities, with the strains of music and straining moving men, the controversial Manhattan Plaza apartment complex near Times Square finally welcomed its first residents yesterday.

title: PingPong Tables Go First Class
description: THIS IS A championship season for table tennis tables and it's about time. Although 600,000 tables were sold in this country last year, there hasn't been much progress in table tennis table design since 1902 when PingPong, the first instruction book on the game, was published. But three tables now on the market indicate that the PingPong ball is bouncing in new directions.

title: Cook Industries Puts Losses at $60 Million
description: MEMPHIS, June 1 (AP)Cook Industries, the Memphisbased agricultural commodity trading firm, said today that its fourthquarter losses would probably amount to $60 million.

title: Rail Bridges Reported Blown Up
description: DJIBOUTI, Territory of Afars and Issas, June 1 (AP)Two bridges on the railway linking the Ethiopian capital, Addis Ababa, with this port city of the Territory of Afars and Issas were reported blown up late yesterday or early today. The bridges are just west of Diredawa, capital of the Ethiopian province of Harar. It was reported that a train from Addis Ababa to Diredawa was attaked in the same period.

title: More Bodies Found
description: SOUTHGATE, Ky.Federal and state investigators searching the ruins of the supper club here this afternoon found two more bodies. Dr. Stine said that the two persons had not been identified.

title: Council Clearing Beame Budgets, Rebuffs Schools
description: With all outstanding issues resolved, the City Council last night adopted Mayor Beame's $13.9 billion expense budget for next year with only minor modifications and headed for approval of the $1.4 billion capital budget. The Board of Estimate was expected to follow suit on both budgets.

title: Pope Names Top Aide a Cardinal, Making Him Potential Successor
description: ROME, June 2Pope Paul VI today elevated his principal aide to cardinal, thus placing him among the candidates for the papacy.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A New York State Health Department researcher, who was stricken with rabies while working on a livevirus rabies vaccine was reported improving at Albany Medical Center.

title: Intrepid Put Up for Sale
description: The 12Meter yacht Intrepid, twotime defender of the America's Cup, will not participate in the trials for the 23d defense tins summer in Newport and is up for sale. The decision was announced yesterday by Rear Adm. Sheldon H. Kinney, president of the New York Maritime College at Fort Schuyler. The college's fundraising arm, Fort Schuyler Foundation Inc., owns Intrepid and the new 12Meter Enterprise, both designed by Olin Stephens.

title: G.O.P. ENERGY REPLY FEATURES NEW FACES
description: WASHINGTON, June 2The Republican Party showed off its new image as the friend of the common man on television tonight, attacking President Carter's energy proposals on a halfhour program that largely featured fresh and younger faces.

title: Swiss Banking Controls Tightened
description: ZURICH, June 2The scandalrocked Swiss banking industry today announced an agreement designed to prevent the use of the famed bank secrecy regulations as a cover for funds of dubious origin.

title: Renee Richards Signs fox WT.T.
description: CLEVELAND, June 2 (AP)Dr. Renee Richards, the transsexual tennis player from New York, today signed a twoyear contract to play World Team Tennis with the ClevelandPittsburgh Nets.

title: IN THE NATION
description: keeping the confidence of the business community at the top of their list of recovery measuresa feat which no Democrat since Cleveland has been able to bring off, and which may be greatly overrated, anyway, as a means of increasing business investment.

title: Police Get a 2d Note Signed by Son of Sam In .44Caliber Killings
description: The police have received a second letter signed son of Sam from the man they believe to be the killer who used a 44caliber pistol to slay five victims in Queens and the Bronx.

title: Produce Energy, Not Giveaways
description: In a way, the Carter Administration asked for the criticism that producers, economists and Republicans level at its energy program: Why does it offer so little encouragement to domestic production of oil and natural gas? As articulated, the Administration program does put heavy emphasis on conservation (the cornerstone of the plan). By comparison, the attention to stimulating exploration does appear slight and, rhetorically, the criticism is understandable. But on closer inspection, the criticism also appears to be largely unjust.

title: Soccer
description: NORTH AMERICAN LEAGUE

title: U.S. and Vietnam Resume Paris Negotiations in Gloomy Atmosphere
description: PARIS, June 2The United States and Vietnam today opened the second round of talks here on normalizing relations. The atmosphere was gloomier than in the first round here May 3 and 4.

title: RHODESIANS REPORT THEIR INCURSION OVER
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, June.2 (AP)The Rhodesian military command announced today that Rhodesian troops who invaded Mozambique last weekend were on their way home after having killed at least 32 black guerrillas and destroyed four rebel camps.

title: Track and Field
description: AT CHAMPAIGN, ILL. N.C.A.A. CHAMPIONSHIPS TRACK EVENTS

title: ALFRED A. FINLEY
description: CHICAGO, June 2 (AP)Alfred A. Finley, brother of the Oakland A's owner, Charles 0. Finley, died today following an illness. He was 57 years old.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: Horses listed in order of post positions. Letter designates OTB listings.

title: Major League Scores
description: EThompson, Mankowski. DP  Detroit 2. LOBCleveland 4, Detroit 5. 2BKemp 2. Ogilvie. 38Thompson. HRFuentes (1). Fosse (2). SBStaub. SKuiper, BBell, Staub.

title: U.S. and Cuba Ready to Announce A Limited Exchange of Diplomats
description: WASHINGTON, June 2The United States and Cuba are preparing to announce tomorrow their biggest step toward restoring relations since they were severed by Washington on Jan. 3, 1961.

title: Georgetown U. Says Kissinger Will Join Staff
description: WASHINGTON, June 2Former Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger will start a oneyear appointment as a full professor at the Georgetown University School of Foreign Service in September, officials of the Washington school said today. It will be announced tomorrow, the officials said.

title: Recital: Cheryl Gerson, Violist
description: MANY A CAPABLE musician who can hold down a key place in an orchestra and do well as a participant in chamber works lacks the special qualities necessary for making a career as a recitalist.

title: Court Gives Moped the GoAhead, Ending 6 Months of Legal Confusion
description: At or about 3:30 P.M. on April 14, 1977, Eleanor Schrabal was apprehended by a sharpeyed Suffolk County policeman at the Hills shopping plaza in Center Moriches. L.I.

title: Yankees' Box Score
description: ECubba??e, Smalley. DPMinnesota 1. LOBYankees 6, Minnesota 11. 2BCarew, Munson, Jackson Netties. 3BChambliss, Rivers. HRPiniella (2), Carew (4). SBWilfong, Bostock 2, Rivers, Norwood. SWhite, Dent. SFPinielia.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Broadway
description: SO, YOU HAVE NOT HEARD about Harold Prince lately, and you are wondering where he will turn up next? Well, the next time out Mr. Prince will direct Some of My Best Friends, a new comedy by Stanley Hart, which is supposed to open on Broadway the last week in October. Mr. Hart says that it is about a man who turns away from the everyday world and creates his own environment, where he can be happy and fulfilled. Then, when the man is threatened, Mr. Hart says, he is forced to come up with another, more realistic, solution. Playwrights are usually cagey about describing their new works, and Mr. Hart's description is as good a one as you are likely to get.

title: Reserve Report
description: In Billions DAILY AVERAGES

title: Despite an Outbreak of Shooting, Dutch Siege Negotiations Go On
description: ASSEN, the Netherlands, June 2 Shooting broke out this afternoon at the spot near here where South Moluccan extremists were holding 56 hostages in a hijacked railroad train.

title: Deaths
description: AKSELRODSarah. Beloved wife of the late Leon, devoted miller of Bernard, David and Emanuel, cherished grandmother of Gusrave, Leonard, Michelle and Kennein. Service Sunday, June 5, 11:30 A.M. The Riverside, 76th St. and Amsterdam Ave.

title: Soviet Air Terminal to Be Olympic Task for Germans
description: WEST BERLIN, June 2When visitors and athletes begin arriving in Moscow three years from now for the next Olympic Games, some of them will check in through a new $100 million airport terminal built by West Germans.

title: CancerCausing Compounds Found In New Tests of Mississippi River
description: New evidence that water in the lower reaches of the Mississippi River may contain cancercausing compounds that could threaten public health has been discov ered by a team of scientists from the Louisiana State University Medical Center in New Orleans.

title: People and Business
description: Ian MacGregor, who will retire on Oct. 1 as chairman of Amax Inc., is to become chairman of Lehman Brothers International, a new fullservice investment bank with headquarters in New York and London that will be managed by Lehman Brothers Inc.

title: Sixers and Blazers Work Out
description: The Philadelphia 76ers went through another of their secret twohour practices yesterday, while the Portland Trail Blazers held an open twohour workout, in preparation for tonight's, fifth game of the N.B.A. championship series. Tonight's game is at the Spectrum in Philadelphia.

title: Metropolitan Baedeker
description: EARLY IN THE morning, when the fishing boats pull out from the piers along Emmons Avenue toward the sea, when the streets are deserted and the clam bars closed, when the air is cool and brisk and the sun is rising, it could be a Maine fishing town, but as the unmistakable accents of the fishermen indicates, it is Brooklyn's Sheepshead Bay.

title: Turkish Peasants Raising Voices as Election Nears
description: DIYARBAKIR, Turkey, June 1The protesters marched through the black stone walls built by Roman armies 1,600 years ago and down the main street of this provincial capital in eastern Turkey. Some women held veils over their faces as they chanted, Water, electricity, roads, water, electricity, roads!

title: I.R.A. Summaries
description: VARSITY EIGHTS

title: 5Year, $3 Billion Plan Will Bolster 7 SubSaharan Lands and Cape Verde
description: OTTAWA, June 2Representatives of 20 countries and more than a score of international development organizations announced a fiveyear, $3 billion program today to build up the economies of seven subSaharan countries that have periodically been ravaged by severe drought.

title: CRUDE STOCKS OFF IN WEEK AFTER 4 STRAIGHT HIGHS
description: After reaching new highs for four straight weeks, crude oil stocks dropped to 308.5 million barrels in the latest reporting week, as compared with 313.8 million barrels in the previous week, and 282.9 million barrels in the yearearlier level, the American Petroleum Institute reported yesterday.

title: O'DWYER AND GOLDIN OFFICIALLY IN RACE
description: New York City's Comptroller, Harrison J. Goldin, and the City Council president, Paul O'Dwyer, announced yesterday, as expected, that they were officially candiates for reelection.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: This is dedicated to the same boatyou know, the one we're all in.

title: Rhodesian, a White, In the U.S. to Press Case for Black Rule
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 2Garfield Todd, the white Rhodesian politician who is a leading advocate of black majority rule, sat in the office of Andrew Young, the chief American delegate to the United Nations, the other day relating recents incidents of torture and murder he said had been committed by the terrorist regime of Prime Minister Ian D. Smith.

title: Stanley Fink Finds Instant Success In Albany Post
description: ALBANY, June 2It's not as if Stanley Fink wa$ sitting on a stool at the counter of Schwab's Drugstore and was suddenly discovered by a bigtime Hollywood agent. Not exactly. This is Albany, not Hollywood, and a shaggyhaired, bluntspoken Assemblyman named Fink, whose mentor is the most powerful Democratic boss in New York City and whose debating style is roughly akin to the tone one would take to pick a fight on the Brooklyn waterfront, hardly seems like a good bet for overnight stardom.

title: El Salvador a Test for Carter Stand on Human Rights
description: SAN SALVADORPresident Carter's stand against violations of human rights by Latin American dictatorships faces a serious test in El Salvador, where political violence is rife and an American who disappeared from a jail here is believed to have been killed by security agents.

title: O'Neill Urges President to Avoid Clash With Congress on Vetoes
description: WASHINGTON, June 2Thomas P. 0'Neill Jr., Speaker of the House of Representatives, told President Carter last night that, because of the President's popularity, Congress would be unable to override vetoes of farm and water projects legislation.

title: Psychedelia
description: THE GRATEFUL DEAD, distributed by Monarch Noteworthy; produced by Eddie Washington; editorial direction by Jerry Garcia; location direction by Leon Gast; executive production by Ron Rakow; edited by Susan Crutcher; animation by Gary Gutierrez; sound mixed by Dan Healy; at The Ziegfeld Theater. Running time 131 minutes. This documentary has not been rated.

title: HelpWanted Advertising Index Up 1 Point in April from March to 109
description: Helpwanted advertising in 51 major United States newspapers in April gained slightly over the preceding month, the Conference Board said today.

title: Jets' Scouting Head Quits
description: Peter Marasco, scouting director for the New York Jets the last two years, resigned yesterday. The 37yearold Marasco, who joined the Jets in 1975 after working with his brother for eight years compiling comprehensive lists of college players available for the draft, left because of personal reasons.

title: Exports Opening to Farmer Coops
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (AP)Agriculture Secretary Bob Bergland agreed today to steps that could increase the ability of farmer cooperatives to enter the lucrative trade in export grain now dominated by private corporations.

title: Flying Boat From L.I. Reaches River Shannon After 14Hour Hop
description: DUBLIN, June 2 (AP)Charles Blair set an amphibian plane carrying his actress wife Maureen O'Hara and other passengers down on Lake Derg on the River Shannon 95 miles southwest of here tonight after a flight from New York.

title: Wednesday's Fights
description: MONTREALMichael Spinks, 167 pounds, St. Louis, knocked out Joe Borden, 178, New Glasgow, N.S., 2 rounds; Leon Spinks, 201, St. Louis, knocked out Bruce Scott, 185, Beaumont, Tex., 4; Jean Lapointe, 133, Montreal, knocked out Danny Stokes, 132, Oshawa, Ontario, 4; Chris Clarke, 146, Halifax, N.S., knocked out Raymond Rousseleau, 157, Quebec City, 2; John Tate, 220, Knoxville Tenn., knocked out Norm Kues, 193, Toronto, 1.

title: For Children
description: Plays

title: Expanded Australian Effort to Aid Aborigines Backfiring
description: FITZROY CROSSING, Australia  This tiny sunbaked settlement on the shallow Fitzroy Rivera pub, a police station and a Methodist missionhas a controversial industry: governmental aid to the aborigines.

title: Screen: Cult of Dead
description: ABOUT 40 MINUTES into The Grateful Dead, a documentary that opened yesterday at the Ziegfeld Theater, two fans of that comparatively longlived rock group are recorded by the camera in the midst of a debate.

title: Tennis
description: AT PARIS FRENCH OPEN

title: Federal Reserve Statement
description: *As reported; not adjusted for transfers of loans to affiliated companies. **Over $100,000 RRevised.

title: Belger, Scott Set Stages For Duels in 800, 1,500
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., June 2Mark Belger and Steve Scott took the first steps toward their longsought revenge today. The outstanding middledistance runners comfortably won their trial heats in the National Collegiate Athletic Association track and field championships, and in doing so, put themselves in positions to reverse recent misfortunes.

title: News Summary
description: FRIDAY, JUNE 3, 1977

title: Dance: Alum's Dark Visions
description: ATOUCH of emotional darkness creeps into almost everything that Manuel Alum choreographs, whether it is an obsessional study or a comic piece such as his recent El Tango. El Tango evoked a sinister quality, although it presented a humorous ballroom trio dancing the tango.

title: Topics
description: Time was, in Washington, when if someone said he worked for the Government that meant the C.I.A.; if he said he worked for the C.I.A., that meant he worked for some agency more secret still. And time was that even the location of the C.I.A. headquarters was formally secret. Foreign governments undoubtedly knew the location before the building was finished and everybody in Washington knew that they knew. Still, the pretense went on for years. How avidly visitors to Washington would be given directions: Go out to Langley, Virginia, and look for that telltale, false sign proclaiming the route to the Public Roads.

title: Books of The Times
description: ENTERTAINING light fiction for a gentle season? Ah, but what light fiction? And why did Austin Wright's new novel, The Morley Mythology, keep catching my eye from the shelf where it has been waiting to be read for several months now? A professor of English at the University of Cincinnati, Mr. Wright is an innovative novelist who has spent two books so far  Camden's Eyes (1969 and First Persons (1973)  trying to do something new and useful with the old problems of narrative voice and point of view. But why would one even

title: Anderson Says Carey Bond Plan Needs Revision to Win Approval
description: ALBANY, June 2Warren M. Anderson, the Senate majority leader, said today that Governor Carey's proposed $750 million economicdevelopment bond issue needed substantial revision before the Senate would consider passing it.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: New Face: John Heard
description: I think this Interview is a little premature,. John Heard said diffidently. I've been seen in only one film, and I've had the lead in only one play. I'm a competent actor, I guess, but I wouldn't say I'm burning up the boards with my insight or genius.

title: Forgotten Promise
description: PARIS, June 2Europe pays more attention to the past than America, so it remembered the 30th anniversary of the European Recovery or Marshall Plan here this week, but not much. A few oldtimers and young scholars celebrated the plan, in Churchill's words, as the most generous act of the United States or any other country in the history of nation states, but even Europe seems to have forgotten the history and objectives of that extraordinary event.

title: DEVELOPING NATIONS TURN DOWN DEMANDS OVER ENERGY ISSUES
description: PARIS, Friday, June 3The 27nation northsouth talks ended tonight with major oilproducing countries and other developing lands refusing to agree to the. demands of the United States and the rest of the industrial world for continuing consultations on energy questions.

title: Laetrile Becomes Legal in Indiana, But F.D.A. Vows Continued Fight
description: INDIANAPOLIS, June 2Laetrile the controversial cancer drug, became legal in Indiana yesterday. But if the United States Food and Drug Administration has its way, the drug will never be truly legal in Indiana or anywhere else.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Friday

title: G.M. Says 6,095 Accept Offer to Exchange Cars With Chevrolet Engines
description: DETROIT, June 2The General Motors Corporation said today only 6,095 owners of 1977 model Buick, Oldsmobile and Pontiac cars accepted its offer to exchange their present cars because they have engines built by the Chevrolet division.

title: Big Counterfeiting Operation Found In Suburban Virginia, Agents Say
description: WASHINGTON, June 2Federal narcotics agents expecting to make a routine arrest of a fugitive tonight uncovered what they beleived to be a major counterfeiting operation, being run out of a suburban Virginia home.

title: Thomas E. Mullaney
description: Every month for more than a year now. the Commerce Department in Washington has had an unpalatable task among many pleasant ones in issuing periodic data on the performance of the nation's economy. The sour one has been the regular reporting of the continuing large deficit in the United States' foreign trade. This year, those trade figures have progressively worsened, and the prospect is for a 1977 deficit of $23 billion to $25 billion, Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal said at a news conference yesterday.

title: REPUBLICANS PRESS A SLASH IN WELFARE
description: ALBANY, June 2Angrily accusing Governor Carey of lacking a commitment to lower welfare costs, Senate Republicans today approved the costcutting plan that the Governor himself had submitted to the Legislature this year but then had jettisoned in a budget compromise.

title: B.P. 1 st Quarter Net Income Soars To $155.7 Million From '76 Level
description: The British Petroleum, Company reported yesterday net income of the equivalent of $155.7 million for the first quarter, compared with a net of $34.7 million in the like 1976 period.

title: Art: Extraordinary Pays Off at Modern
description: EXTRAORDINARY is the paprika of adjectives. Galvanic in the right hands, it can take away all appetite in the wrong ones. So the Museum of Modern Art took a small gamble when it chose the title Extraordinary Men for the exhibition of recently acquired portrait drawings that will be on view there through July 17. (Its successor and sequel, Extraordinary Women, will open in late July.)

title: Bridge:
description: When defending a slam contract, an average player who has an ace makes it his business to score a trick with it as quickly as possible. He is obsessed with a dread that his ace may fail to score and the slam may succeed as a result. This snatching policy will sometimes aid the declarer and help him to make his slam.

title: Archer Leading Golf by a Stroke on 66
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., June 2 (AP)George Archer, on the verge of quitting the tour until he won the Sahara Invitational last fall, birdied his last three holes for a sixunderpar 66 that staked him to a onestroke lead today in the first round of the $250,000 Kemper open golf tournament.

title: Market Place
description: Can a sciencefiction movie bring happiness to the shareholders of Twentieth CenturyFox Film as the shares hit their highest price in seven years?

title: Byrne Signs Casino Bill in Atlantic City And Tells Organized Crime to Stay Out
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 2Calling it a historic moment, Governor Byrne sat at a Boardwalk table draped in blue bunting today and, to the applause of a crowd estimated by the police at 5,000, signed legislation to permit casino gambling in Atlantic City.

title: In Memoriam
description: ANTONDavid. Remembered with love and deeply missedin my heart forever. FLO

title: Meadowlands Results
description: FIRST$13,000, pace, mile.

title: PRICES OF SOYBEANS SHOW A SHARP DROP
description: CHICAGO, June 2 (AP)Oldcrop soybeans, meal and oil futures came under heavy selling pressure on the Chicago Board of Trade today in marked contrast to trade in the two previous sessions.

title: Nets' Move to Jersey Is Unlikely
description: Talk of a move to New Jersey by the Nets was only talk as of yesterday.

title: Teddy Wilson Joins Waterloo Village Jazz
description: Teddy Wilson will appear with Ed Polcer's Jazz Band on Sunday from 3 to 7 P.M. as part of the Jazz in June program at Waterloo Village in Stanhope, N. J. With the jazz pianist the band will include Bob Wilber on clarinet, Eddie Hubble on trombone, Milt Hinton on bass and Bob Rosengarden on drums. Mr. Polcer plays cornet.

title: PLAN FOR A PIPELINE IS SHELVED IN CANADA
description: OTAWA, June 2Proposals for pipelines to carry Alaskan oil and natural gas to American and Canadian users make up the hottest controversy in Canada, and will probably cause more heat as the Government approaches a decision on which projects to accept.

title: F.T.C. Accuses Bell and Howell
description: WASHINGTON, June 2 (UPI)  The Federal Trade Commission today accused the Bell and Howell Company of using unfair and deceptive practices to promote home study courses it operated until January 1976. In announcing that a formal complaint had been filed, the agency said that it may seek full or partial refunds of tuition for persons victimized by the alleged illegal practices.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Miss Higuchi Takes Lead At Wykagyl
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., June 2Sponsors willing to offer a $100,000 purse for the Ladies' Professional Golf Association will be able to get the women to compete over 72 holes in four days for that big money instead of the traditional 54 holes in three days. The L.P.G.A. has found enough such backers to have eight 72hole tourneys at $100.000 or more this year.

title: U.S. and Cuba Ready to Announce A Limited Exchange of Diplomats
description: WASHINGTON, June 2  The United States and Cuba are preparing to announce tomorrow their biggest step toward restoring relations since they were severed by Washington on Jan. 3, 1961.

title: AnnMarie Sykes
description: AnnMarie Dunn Sykes, widow of Col. James P. Sykes, U.S.A., was married yesterday in Manalapan, Fla., to Thomas T. Sherwood of Greenwich, Conn. The ceremony was conducted at the home of Brig. Gen. Richard P. Scott, U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. Scott by Circuit Court Judge Paul Douglas of Palm Beach, Fla.

title: Stage: Shawn Alone
description: THE STAGE OF the Promenade Theater has been turned into a grimy backstage dressing room, with ancient photographs on the wall and a huge pile of torn newspapers on the floor.

title: ADAPTRONICS CHIEF SEES LAG IN STEEL SHIPMENTS
description: Steel industry shipments this year will reach only 86.6 million tons, well below industry forecasts of 95 million to 100 million tons, Roger L. Barron, president of Adaptronics Inc., of McLean, Va., said yesterday. He said a predictive model of the industry placed secondquarter shipments at 20.9 million tons, third quarter at 21.9 million tons and fourth quarter at 22.1 million tons. Industry shipments for the first quarter totaled 21.7 million tons against Adaptronics' forecast of 21.9 million tons.

title: Albany Aide Warns City Needs Revenue To Bar 1981 Deficit
description: The executive director of the New York State Emergency Financial Control Board warned yesterday that without significant new revenues New York City's annual budget deficit could approach the levels reached at the beginning of the financial emergency in 1975.

title: Kurt Lowenstein, at 78, Served As Executive of Metals Company
description: Kurt Lowenstein, a retired metals industry executive, died at his Santa Barbara, Calif., home Wednesday. He was 78 years old.

title: Egual Rights Amendment Rejected In Illinois House by Six Votes
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., June 6 (AP)The proposed equili rights athendment failed by six votes to win ipproval in the. Illinois House today.

title: Hilda Lindley Is Married
description: Hilda Lindley and Theodore Waller were married yesterday. in the chapel of the All Souls Unitarian Church by the minister, the Rev. Dr. Walter Kring. The bride is bookadvertising manager of The New York Times. Mr. Waller is president of Grolier Educational Corporation. Both the bride and bridegroom were previously married and divorced.

title: Mary C. Lind Becomes Bride
description: Mary Carlyle Lind, an interior designer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gerard Kenneth Lind of Llewellyn Park, N. J., was married yesterday to Jarvis James Slade, managing partner of the Hampton Capital Company, a private merchant banking firm.

title: Ready at the Big Apple Tasting
description: NATHAN'S FAMOUS will be there, as you might expect, with hot dogs and PepsiCola, but so will Stuart Levin, bringing with him from the Top of the Park a pheasant, veal and pistachio pt. Hamburgers? Sure, from Days Dandelion, but Warner LeRoy is sending over roasted chicken tarragon from Maxwell's Plum. Chili dogs? Tacos? Of course, and from Anita's Chili Parlor, but Vincent Sardi will be along with his cannelloni au gratin too.

title: Woman Held in Husband's Death
description: LINDEN, N. J., June 2 (UPI)A mother of two children has been charged with shooting her husband to death and dumping his body in a railroad yard in Rahway, N. J. The woman, Rose Ann Reginella, 34 years old, was held without bail yesterday in the slaying of her husband, Joseph, 36, a maintenance worker. Mrs. Reginella was also charged with contributing to the delinquency of minors because her children were aware of the crime, the police said.

title: Senator Dunne Says He Paid 1 Percent Kickbacks to G.O.P. in Nassau
description: MINEOLA, L.I., June 2State Senator John R. Dunne said today that he had been forced to contribute 1 percent of his salary to the Nassau County Republican Party to advance his political career.

title: Once Around the Park (Almost)It's the Women's Minimarathon
description: Mild Gorman, who is 42 years old, stands 4 feet 11 inches tall and weighs in at 89 pounds, will very likely not be put off her pace in the women's minimarathon tomorrow when she races in Central Parks Where the event will be competing with a lavish food spectacle.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: 9,000 Given Degrees at Rutgers At Genial 211th Commencement
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, June 2Dawn's thick haze over the campus of Rutgers University burned away by midmorning. And at 10:30 sharp, the university's 152yearold bell began tolling in Queen's Tower, summoning graduates for the processional for the state university's 211th commencement.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, June 2The Department of the Public Advocate sued the Federal Environmental Protection Agency today to prohibit immediately the jumping of sewage sludge in New Jersey coastal waters about 12 miles off Sandy Hook.

title: Byrne Signs the CasinoGambling Bill in Atlantic City
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 2Calling it historic moment, Governor Byrne said at a Boardwalk table draped in blue bunting today and, to the applause of a crowd estimated by the police at 5,000, signed legislation to permit casino gambling in Atlantic City.

title: COOK OFFICERS REPORTED TO EXCEED TRADE LIMITS
description: MEMPHIS, June 2 (UPI)A board member of the financially troubled Cook Industries says two top executives who resigned under fire last week had exceeded the company's grain trading limits.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Butler, a Morris County borough about 30 miles west of New York, will be the scene at 1:30 P.M. tomorrow of a parade to celebrate its volunteer Fire Department, which has been operated without a break since 1902. Sixtyfour volunteer fire companies from New Jersey, New York and Pennsylvania will be visiting the town to join the parade. It was reported incorrectly i?? last Sunday's New Jersey Weekly that the parade would be held Sunday.

title: Ali to Fight Righetti In July, Don King Says
description: Don King, the boxing promoter, announced here yesterday that he had signed Muhammad Ali, the heavyweight champion, to defend his title in early Jury against Alfio Righetti of Italy. No other details were available.

title: Strong Pitching Puts Power Nine Into Today's Title Game With Molloy
description: Coaching a team in the Catholic Schools Athletic Association baseball final is nothing new for Jack Curran. After all, his Archbishop Molloy teams have won 10 of the last 14 titles. So today's final game with Power Memorial should be a familiar experience. But for Power's coach, Brother Charles Grogan, it will be a new affair. Brother Grogan, in his first season as Power's coach, had never coached a high school team. 'To get this far, said Brother Grogan yesterday, is a result of total uilization Of the players abilities. That total utilization is made more difficult by the Location of the Manhattan school on West 61st Street and 10th Avenue and with the only place to practice several blocks away in Central Park.

title: Standard & Poor's to Maintain Its AA Rating on Quebec Bonds
description: The Standard & Poor's Corporation said yesterday that it was maintaining its AA rating on Quebec bonds following an extensive review of both the economy and the move for independence in the province.

title: Albany Aide Warns City Needs Revenue To Bar 1981 Deficit
description: The executive director of the New York State Emergency Financial Control Board warned yesterday that without significant new revenues New York City's annual budget deficit could approach the levels reached at the beginning of the financial emergency in 1975.

title: Commodity Price Index Declines 1.4 From the WeekEarlier Level
