Around the point the waves subside, the ferry slows, and the townscape, built., up from the docks with the wealth of ships' holds, appears.

title: Thedie Kermath Wed To David Neil Fein
description: Theodosia Hardwick Kermath and David Neil Fein were married yesterday afternoon in the Tilman Chapel of the Church Center of the United Nations by the Rev. Dr. Melvin Hawthorne.

title: Miss Leonard Has Nuptials
description: Elizabeth Lines Leonard, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph L. Leonard of Manchester, Mass., was married yesterday afternoon to David Lawson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arnold Lawson Jr. of Topsfield, Mass.

title: Albany Hearings on Power Plants Open Tuesday
description: ALBANY, June 4The Public Service Commission will open a hearing here on Tuesday to determine whether it is more economical to build coal or nuclear power plants to supply the electricity needs of the future in New York State.

title: The Mets' New Master Blends Many Elements Of His Predecessors
description: Joe Torre nodded toward the cherubic little priest in the locker room at Shea Stadium and said: He's my shrink.

title: Dr. Dolby and His Magic Gadget for Noise Reduction
description: If Dolby has become something of a household word among audiophiles, it is for excellent reasons. Nothing within the last decade has so greatly improved the general quality of reproduced sound as this ingenious device that bears the name of its inventor. Among other things, it made the cassette a medium fit and proper for serious music, it enabled disk recordings to encompass more truthfully the range between loud and soft, and, in its newest manifestation, Dolby extends the range and enhances the clarity of FM broadcasts. Disk, tape, and airDolby has made all audio his province.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif.A picture of Andrew S. Grove hangs on the wall of his office in the Intel Corporation's headquarters in a former pear orchard here. But it's no more a typical executive photograph than it's typical for an executive vice president to receive the additional title of chief ope?? officer.

title: Unveilings
description: BERNSTEINLouis, of Jackson Heights, N.Y. and Mami Beach, Fla. Unveiling of a monument on Sunday, June 121h at 10:30 A.M., Beth David Cemetery, Elmont, N.Y. Laurel Associalion, section D, block 2. No postponements.

title: Science & Social Science
description: DRAGONS OF EDEN. Speculations on the Evolution of Human Intelligence. Carl Sagan. (Random House. $8.95.) An astronomer turns his attention to natural selection. A speculative book that ranges as widely as the author's interests.

title: The Bullish Boom in the Record World
description: As little as 18 months ago, the sluggish U.S. economy and a steadily aging population made record company executives dread hard times ahead for their business. Some looked enviously towards the greener pastures of the motion picture industry, while others waited for the next big thing to replace rock n roll as the dominant popular music style.

title: 2 KILLED, 49 INJURED IN CHICAGO VIOLENCE
description: CHICAGO, June 4 (AP)A disturbance erupted in a West Side park today after a Puerto Rican Day demonstration. Two persons were shot to death and at least 49 were injured; looting was reported, and a discount store was set on fire, the authorities said.

title: Rev. Dr. C. Darby Fulton, 84, Former Presbyterian Moderator
description: The Rev. Dr. C. Darby Fulton, moderator of the Presbyterian Church in the U.S. (Southern) from 1948 to 1949 and former secretary of the denomination's board of world missions, died in Atlanta on May 27. He was 84 years old.

title: THE STYLE OF THE 70's
description: Welcome to the sexually liberated 70's. Leave your clothes at the door and be prepared to have the time of your life; no role playing here, no jealousy, no boredom, no disease; if it feels good it is good! The party has been paid for by those flower children and hippies of the 60's who declared, make love not war!, and then did just that in communes, fountains, jails and bandpainted vans. Upwind the media caught the scent and broadcast itsexual liberation became big business.

title: Police Trials
description: Thousands of shouting offduty policemen demonstrated in the streets of New York last October against deferred pay increases and longer work schedules. Their raucous behavior led to department charges against. 20 for such offenses as conduct unbecoming an officer and failure to obey the orders of superior officers.

title: VOLLARD: DEALER FOR THE DEMIGODS
description: The great epoch of the School of Paris at the turn of the centurywhen the generation of Czanne and Renoir was producing its last masterpieces, and the generation of Picasso and Matisse was producing its firstis now almost as remote from us in time and spirit as the age of Napoleon from the young Picasso. And like Napoleon, the leading figures of that distant era have acquired a legendary statusin this case, the status of demigods in the mythical saga of modern art. With their works enshrined like sacred objects in museums the world over and the artists themselves no longer with us (only Chagall, who will be 90 next month, survives), that golden age of achievement more and more recedes into the mists of memory. What only yesterday seemed a part of living historyour historyhas now taken on the quality of a timeless romance.

title: HOUSINGLOAN PLAN IS STALLED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, June 4Governor Carey's plan for an $18 million stopgap loan to Coop City and nine other troubled housing projects is caught in legislative crosscurrents over the mayoral candidacy of Mario M. Cuomo and has no chance of passage in its present form.

title: Marmalade and mustard sauce
description: cup orange marmalade

title: STAMPS
description: Two hundred years ago, a tall, redheaded Frenchman disembarked off the coast of South Carolina to assist the American Colonies in their struggle to win independ ence from the British Crown, in what was a prelude to the indispensable aid that France would give to bring about the creation of the United states.

title: Congress Urged to Compromise On Space Shuttle Vehicle Plans
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI)Congress should consider building a third manned space shuttle vehicle but delay production of two additional space shuttle program.

title: F.D.A. Absolved
description: A twoyear investigation of the Food and Drug Administration has absolved the agency from some of the harshest charges ever leveled against it and has cecommended substantial changes in the F.D.A.'s drug review process.

title: TV VIEW
description: The television interview is not new. Stepping directly out of a radio format, it established residence in the younger medium at the very beginning. Suddenly, though, the interview is bursting upon the home viewer with a vengeance. From selfimpeached Presidents to superstar entertainers to champion boxers, the prattle goes on almost incessantly. The future of cable, with its multichannel capabilities, now begins to loom as some specter of absurdity in which all of us will eventually end up interviewing one another. The circle in modern communications will have been completed.

title: AUDITORS FIND FUEL WASTE IN NEW YORK CITY OFFICES
description: Buildings owned by New York City are often a little too hot or a little too cold, but in either case it is generally in the wrong season, a state audit released said.

title: Roosevelt Field: A Shopping Giant at a Crossroads
description: GARDEN CITY ROOSEVELT Field Shopping Center, the 110acre, 164store merchandising complex, is like a massive thermometer patched into the economic heart of the Island. When Nassau and Suffolk Counties have a stomach ache from a rise in the jobless rate or a serious cold from prolonged bad weather, the center bends over in agony or suffers a coughing spasm.

title: PAPERBACK TALK
description: Books for the times. With a dozen writers in this issue of the Book Review defining, analyzing and in some cases lamenting the style of the 70's, we decided to ask a number of bookmen how they think it is manifesting itself in the softcover book. Some of the most interesting comments came from the trade paperback buyers for two chains that together have more than 700 stores across the country: Tom Simon of Waldenbooks and John Schulz of B. Dalton.

title: Prague: A Capital of Humane Proportions
description: I had always wanted to see Prague, the metropolis Goethe had called a gem in the stone crown of the world. But at the first sight of the chilly gray air terminal I was seized with an acute attack of the whatamIdoinghere syndrome common to travelers on their first visit to Eastern Europe.

title: Dave Anderson.
description: To those who consider a Hall of Fame pitcher a baseball treasure, the idea of the New York Mets trading Tom Seaver would be unthinkable. But to those in the Mets front office. it's merely unthinking. Or at least typical of their negative thinking. To them, Tom Seaver has lost the most games, 110, of any pitcher in Meta history. He also has permitted the most runs, the most hits and the most walks. And lie has been the most vocal in his accurate appraisal of M. Donald Grant's pompous plantation philosophy. The 32yearold righthanders 187 victories, his 2.47 career earnedrun average (the lowest among pitchers with more than 2,000 major league innings) and his three Cy Young Awards apparently no longer influence those who operate the franchise.

title: Frances Ines Gomez Bride of Philip S. Hill 3d
description: The marriage of Frances Ines Gomez and Philip Samuel Hill 3d took place yesterday in the Episcopal Church of St. James the Less in Scarsdale, N.Y. The Rev. Dudley J. Stroup performed the ceremony.

title: Mental Care Reform, Turned Uncaring
description: The past decade has brought a revolution in the care of the mentally ill and retarded. A forceful campaign to assert the civil rights of mental patients, a growing conviction among professionals that such patients belong in more normal settings, and the availability of new drugs led to the release of scores of thousands of people from the large, crowded and illequipped state hospitals that served as their warehouses. In 1970, the population of the nation's mental hospitals stood at 430,000; today it is about 300,000 and still declining. Unfortunately, it has been easier to clear the hospitals than to create alternative care for people who, still need so much of it.

title: THEATER
description: HAVING known Alfred Edward Simon for years, it wasn't surprising that he should call after I had interviewed him. I forgot to tell you. You might want to mention that I am the uncle of Carly, Lucy and Joanna Simon.

title: S. & L. Insiders
description: The long debate over converting depositorowned banking organizations into stock companies flared anew last week.

title: Medical Center to Benefit
description: The premiere performance of A Bridge Too Far, a motion picture about the battle of Arnheim in World War II, at the Rivoli Theater on June 14, will benefit the New York University Medical Center's faculty campaign for programs of medical education and the Metropolitan Museum of Art's general funds. The film showing will be followed by a supperdance at the Plaza Hotel's grand ballroom. A few $25 balcony seats are still available through the campaign office of the University Medical Center, at 550 First Avenue.

title: Flood Kills 10 in Iran
description: TEHERAN, Iran, June 4 (AP)Heavy rains have sent rivers over their banks in northwestern Iran, killing at least 10 pertons near the towns of Zenjan and Takistan, it was reported today.

title: Brezhnev Leadership: Bureaucracy Ascendant
description: MOSCOWSince the Soviet Union came into existence 60 years ago, only four men have sat at the pinnacle of power, and each has set his own distinct mark on the country's foreign and domestic policies: Lenin was a revolutionary. Stalin was a tyrant. Khrushchev was an erratic gambler. Leonid I. Brezhnev is a stolid bureaucrat devoted to caution, patience and firmness.

title: Ann Burford Bride of Andrew Fletcher Jr.
description: Ann Skeily Burford and Andrew Fletcher Jr., both of New York, were married yesterday at the bridegroom's summer residence in Southampton, L.I., by the Rev. Malcolm Foster of St. John's Episcopal Church in Southampton.

title: Kathleen McCabe Wed To John W. Nugent
description: Kathleen McCabe, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Thomas McCabe of Riverdale, the Bronx, was married yesterday in the Roman Catholic Church of Our Saviour to John W. Nugent, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Andrew Nugent of Garden City, L.I., Msgr. Michael O'Donnell performed the ceremony and the Rev. Eugene O'Sullivan concelebrated the nuptial mass

title: ALBANY ACCORD SET ON 2 NOFAULT ITEMS
description: ALBANY, June 4Negotiators for the Legislature and the Governor's office reached agreement in principle this week on two of the major obstacles to a bill that would revise the state's nofault automobile insurance law.

title: Beirut Newspapers Publish in Paris to Escape Censors
description: PARIS, June 4Four Lebanese weeklies, all describing themselves as hidependent, are now published in Paris as a result of censorship in Beirut.

title: Jane Fromstein Betrothed to Kenneth Henley
description: The engagement of Jane Fromstein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Mitchell S. Fromstein of Milwaukee, to Kenneth Henley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Henley or forest ??s, queens, has been annonuecd by the future bride's parents. A wedding is planned for Aug. 20.

title: Merida, Base Camp For the Yucatan
description: Are you coming or going? The first time I was asked that in Merida, by a desk clerk at the Hotel Montejo, I didn't know what to answer. I was coming from Uxmal, but going to Progreso in the morning. He neatly wrote both on the registration form and flashed a smile suitable for either welcome or adios, or both.

title: DowntoEarth Legislation
description: THE LEGISLATIVE session ending this week will enter Connecticut history as one that considered such important topics as the batteredwife, bottle and quits and fires bills. It also included a parlay that linked the praying mantis with the garnet as the official state insect and rock.

title: If You Go ...
description: ... to Nantucket in search of the Island Muse, drive or take a bus from New York City's Port Authority Bus Terminal for $21 to either Woods Hole or Hyannis on Cape Cod and board the ferry. The schedule varies with the season but reservations must be made well in advance for cars (6175402022). Passenger fare one way is $5.50; car one way, $22. The HyLine boats also take passengers from Hyannis to the islands. If at all possible, leave cars on the mainland unless you are planning a long stay.

title: The President's Solar Advocate
description: NO, said Dr. Paul Rappaport, relaxed and unassuming in shirtsleeves, it did not come as any surprise to him. In 28 years at RCA's David Sarnoff Research Center, he had become a leading authority on solar energy and had received a good number of job offers.

title: U.S. Envoy Sees Queen Elizabeth
description: LONDON, June 3 (Reuters)The new American Ambassador to Britain, Kingman Brewster, rode to Buckingham Palace in the traditional horsedrawn coach today and presented his credentials to Queen Elizabeth. He succeeds Anne Armstrong.

title: ONE CRITIC'S FICTION
description: WHAT a clumsy, outdated creature man is! What a heavy bear, as Delmore Schwartz said. After all our progress, after coming so far, to the moon and further, we're still carrying him on our back, saddled with his slowness, his literal mind, his predictability, his exasperating ordinariness.

title: THE STYLE OF THE 70's
description: It's almost as hard to strike the right note about sports as it is about humor. Take either one of them seriously and you're accused of missing the point, which is precisely their willful unseriousness. But taking sports lightly can be a bit of a pose too. I have known writers who dismiss them as fun & games, yet who contrive to talk about nothing else until the bar closes, every loving night.

title: Intellectuals in U. S. In Appeal to Poland To Free 6 Dissidents
description: Three Nobel laureates and 136 educators, writers and other American professional leaders have appealed to Poland's leadership to release six dissidents who were imprisoned three weeks ago.

title: Mrs. Mondale is Traditional
description: It has been dear from the beginning that Rosaiynn Carter wanted to go, not just to Jamaica and the six LatinAmen can countries she visited last week, but anywhere that her concept of the First Lady's role led her. It has been equally clear that no one, except possibly her husband, the President, could make her do anything.

title: Ann F. S. Szabo Is Wed
description: Ann Florence Stokes Szabo and Daniel Joseph Shine, who are with the New York Telephone Company, were married yesterday in Trinity Episcopal Church. The Rev. Robert Griffith performed the ceremony. The bride, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George M. Stokes of East Rutherford, N.J., is a management training supervisor with New York Telephone, where her husband, son of Mrs. Mary Shine of New Haven and the late Jeremiah Shine, is business systems director. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce, as did her husband's.

title: New Jersey/This Week
description: THEATER

title: Architecture
description: To me, the drawn language is a very revealing language; one can see in a few lines whether a man is really an architect, Eero Saarinen once said, and indeed, throughout history architects have tended think on paper with pencil in hand more than through words. To describe Saariuen's Ingalls Hockey Rink at Yale in words is awkward; in the architect's freehand drawing, the swooping form of the great concrete arch that is the building's spine becomes comprehensible, and it is easy to understand the story Saarinen himself loved to repeat about the player on the Yale team who said when he looked up at the concrete arch, it made him feel Go, go, go!

title: Ideas &Trends
description: After 10 months of near silence about the earthquakes that struck Tangshan City last July, Chinese officials finally let it be known that the tremors leveled 20 square miles and were the most devastating China has experienced since 1556. In that year, 830,000 people died in an earthquake. Authoritiesstill somewhat reticentdid not say exactly how many deaths there were last summer; neither did they deny published estimates of 655,000.

title: Women Athletes And Their Fears About Femininity
description: The first time I interviewed Chris Evert we were both 18. She had just helped the American team win another Wightman Cup competition and was talking about the thrill of victory while I waved a CBS microphone in front of her. Afterward, we left the press tent together and she paused in the sunlight, held out both hands and asked if I liked the shade of nail polish she was wearing. It struck me as absurd that I wanted to talk about tennis and Chris Evert wanted to talk about nail polish.

title: Malverne Sets Relay Mark In State Girls' Meet
description: MORRISVILLE, N.Y., Arne 4Malverne, L.I., posted state and meet records in the 440yard relay when its team was timed in 48.9 seconds today At the New York State girls track and field championships. Path Green of Millbrook also registered a state mark when she threw the discus 120 feet 4 inches.

title: High Marks Seen As No Guarantee Of Later Success
description: A 15year study of graduates of a small men's liberal arts college has suggested that good grades and other usual measures of academic success do not correlate with personal maturity and competence in later life.

title: An Interview With Israel's Controversial Moshe Dayan
description: The nomination of Moshe Dayan as Foreign Minister in the new Israeli Government being formed by Menahem Begin, the leader of the Likud Party, has caused great controversy in Israel. In order to take the post, Mr. Dayan, a former Israeli Defense Minister and one of Israel's better known personalities abroad, resigned from his long association with the entrenched Labor Party, which the rightofcenter Likud defeated in the May 17 general election. Mr. Dayan talked about his views in an interview in the garden of his home in the Israeli town of Zahalaa splendid spot filled with his collection of archaelogical. These are excerpts from the interview conducted by Witham E. Farrell, a correspondent for The New York Times based in Israel.

title: Pandas Mate in Tokyo Zoo
description: TOKYO, June 4 (Reuters)Japan's hopes of raising the first giant panda born in captivity outside China soared today when a pair finally mated after years of coaxing at Ueno Zoo here. Kang Kang and his mate Lan Lan were presented to Japan by China after the two countries normalized relations in 1972. The zoo said that Lan Lan could give birth in October.

title: Generic Drugs Labeled Caution
description: THE current effort to repeal or modify New Jersey's antisubstitution law is based on the false assumption that all like dosage forms of the same drug are equal.

title: ISRAEL STRENGTHENS ITS COMBAT FORCES
description: TEL AVIV, June 2Israel's forces, in a period of rising political and military tension in the Middle East, are stronger by 33,000 combat troops than they were at the beginning of the 1973 war with the Arabs and are equipped with sophisticated new weapons.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: EACH Sunday, I read the announcements of Oriental rug sales wistfully. These magnificent rugs, which cost thousands of dollars and once graced Turkish and Kurdish palaces, can never be for me because I live in the suburbs.

title: Earlier Met Managers
description: CASEY STENGEL (19621965)The onemanshow of baseball for 60 summers, onetime outfielder, fulltime talker and comic. Led the Yankees through 12 years of success and the Mets through four of failure, but charmed the public through it all. Flamboyant, tough, arbitrary. Talked in flowing Stengelese or terse epigrams: It takes 27 outs to win, and He's got an $18 glove, so why shouldn't he catch it? Ringmaster of the circus.

title: Precooked calf's brains
description: 2 sets call's brains (about one pound)

title: J. P. Metzger Is the Fiance Of Miss Stathr
description: Stephanie Ann Stahr, who is starting her third year at the University of Virginia Law School, plans to be married this fall to Jeffrey Paul Metzger, a lawyer with the Washington law firm of Collier. Shannon. Rill. Edwards & Scott.

title: Jayne Goldsmith Wed
description: The marriage of Jayne Pam Goldsmith, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alvin Goldsmith of Kings Point, L. I., to Mitchell Lewis, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Lewis, also of Kings Point, took place last night. Rabbi Harold Spivack performed the ceremony in Temple Judea in Manhasset, L. I. The bride and her husband graduated May 20 from Washington University in St. Louis.

title: A Je we] Glows in Harlem With 5 Decades of Pride
description: In 1922, Mildred and Robert Braddicks, a black couple with four children, bought a 14room brownstone in a predominantly white development known as the King Model Homes.

title: Today's Hottest Movie Stars  C3PO and R2D2
description: LOS ANGELES Scuttling across the desert of a mediocre planet like an upright gold crustacean, See Threepio (C3PO) worries about being lost and Godforsaken and getting sand in his machinery. See Threepio is a robot who would be comfortable at a cocktail party, a domestic droid hopelessly out of place amid the wars of George Lucas's Star Wars and longing only for a bath of fresh oil.

title: Major League Averages
description: National League

title: Scouts on Call for Emergency Medical Aid
description: IT IS 10:19 P.M. The emergency phone bell jangles the tiny room alive. A woman's voice, barely under control, sobs that her son has accidentally plunged one of his arms through a glass door and is bleeding severely.

title: Amina Myers Plays In Jazz Celebration
description: The Ladies' Fort's portion of the second annual Loft Jazz Celebration got under way Friday night with two sets by a Chicago composerpianistsinger named Amina Claudine Myers. She was accompanied by a New York group consisting of Marvin Horne, guitar; Fred Williams, electric bass; Jimmy Johnson, drums, and Tiros Sompa, congas.

title: This UX Prefers Her Proper Name
description: WE RECENTLY received a refund check from the Township of Princeton, which had decided to share its unbudgeted state school aid money with those who pay property taxes. We considered its action most thoughtful.

title: Excerpts From Articles of the Soviet Draft Constitution
description: Article 1. The Union of Soviet Socialist Republics is a socialist state of the whole people, expressing the will and the interests of the working class, peasants and intelligentsia of all nations and nationalities in the country.

title: Questions/Answers
description: CONIFER GROUNDCOVER

title: Red Smith
description: In the early 1920's, Phil Bieberwrites, we had a ticket agency opposite the Metropotitan Opera. House at Broadway and 39th Street. The great tenor, Enrico Caruso, would stroll in for a chat, usually about racing. One day the discussion turned to a racetrack character, Tommy Francis. Tommy was a tall, goodlooking man out of Baltimore, at variout times a bookmaker, horse owner, trainer, handicapper and pricemaker, and was often suspected of being all these at the same time. Though nobody could understand why, for they were so completely different, there was an ardent friendship between Tommy Francis and Enrico Caruso. We asked Caruso about it. Opposites attract, he said. I became fascinated, almost hypnotized by this unusual man. When he is about, am completely relaxed, and in my profession I must have relaxation. Tommy is far better than medicine.

title: Sunday Observer
description: Had the Government simply refused to watch 58 women cook three meals a day for a week, no reasonable citizen would have complained, for the Government is terribly busy. But the Government did not refuse. This, after all, was a study, and if there is one thing the Government loves, it is a study.

title: MUSIC
description: I HAVE gradually come to the conclusion that you don't have to go to the opera house to enjoy opera. Sometimes it's fun to savor the highlights without wading through endless plot manipulations, just as it can also be a refreshing change of pace to hear complete operasnot to mention selected arias and scenesdone in concert, or with limited staging.

title: Mary Bernhard Is Married
description: Mary Louise Bernhard, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Joel A. Bernhard of Orange, N.J., was married yesterday to Gary John Happel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter John Happel Jr. of Livingston, N.J. The Rev. John McKenna performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in St. Rose of Lima Roman Catholic Church in Short Hills, N.J.

title: NIXON EXPLAINS VIEW ON ADAPTING LAWS
description: WASHINGTON, June 4Richard M. Nixon, defining anew his view of power, has insisted that Presidents must be able to adapt the law to fit their idea of the nation's needs in times of stress.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: if there are more than one, they occupy more, internal space, reflect more external time and account for more of what we might call our individual souls. Images of balls thrown in the park, of wheels turning, bikes, skates, hoops, the thumping of jump ropes, the call at dusk of moving shadows, allee, allee in free, images of birthday parties, of victories over the shoelace, the clock, the written word, images of a tonedeaf mother hearing her daughter sing at the school assembly, of a father teaching a child to swim, comforting a child crying over a broken bicycle or a lost friendship, of nights spent worrying about a child's school failure, about a sore throat that wouldn't go away, images of a man and woman trying to find the money for a scout trip, or medical school, images of hours spent in the pediatrician's waiting room, in the dentist's waiting room, in the shoe store, at the barber's, of games of Monopoly and Walt Disney movies. Image after image floats up of time spent enmeshed in the seemingly trivial work of family life which, if things go well enough, can make us less alone, can hide from us the vastness of the universe and the insignificance of our individual place in it.

title: Wave Hill Is a Japanese Festival
description: ARTURO TOSCANINI lived there. So did Mark Twain and Theodore Roosevelt. Anthony Eden, Harold Macmillan, John Foster Dulles and Britain's Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother slept there. And next Sunday it will be given over to Japanese.

title: INTERVIEW
description: NOT many Americans have ever heard of district heating. One of the few who have is John Karkheck, and the 32yearold Sound Beach physicist, who works at the Brookhaven National Laboratory in Upton, regards it as an idea whose time has come in the United States.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: June 1011Jaguar Clubs of North America, Empire Division competition weekend at Lime Rock (Conn.) Park. Friday: registration: 8 A.M., drivers' meeting: 9; practice: 1 P.M. Saturday: practice: 8.A.M.; time trials: 10; acceleration runs: 1 P.M.; gymkhana: 3. Limit of 50 cars. Information: Bob Smiley, phone (516)AN 18586.

title: From Recipient...to Head of CollegeAid Program
description: LEO L. KORNFELD does not remember life as an undergraduate at the University of Michigan with much pleasure. I worked day and night to pay for it. My parents helped, toomy father was a brewery workerand we just managed. It was not a happy time.

title: Electronic Air Cleaners for Every House and Apartment
description: A well designed and properly maintained house nowadays will have efficient weatherstripping and snug fitting storm windows and doors installed to minimize air filtration and heat losses from inside to outside. As a result, indoor air often tends to become uncomfortably polluted with dust, dirt, smoke and odorsso much so that in some cases the indoor air is actually more polluted with objectionable particles and odors than the outside air is, even for people who live in heavily populated urban areas.

title: Widening U.S. Trade Deficit Tests Dollar's Durability
description: WASHINGTONIn the late 1960's the dollar had become seriously overvalued. It was undermined by inflation, deficit spending to finance the Vietnam War and energy that was higher priced in the United States than in competing countries.

title: Cornell Overtakes Penn And Wins Rowing Title
Effect of Sports on Women Sifted
description: Marlin Mackenzie has spent a lot of time concentrating on the problems of women in sport. Being a male makes it a little tricky, he admits. But Mackenzie believes that a shared struggle by men and women is the key to the ultimate liberation of both. I may not know what problems women in sport were having firsthand, he says, but I do know what a struggle it is to be autonomous.

title: Deepfried camembert balls
description: Beerbutter (see recipe)  pound corn embert Oil for deepIrving

title: HOMOSEXUAL RIGHTS: IMPACT OF THE VOTE
description: In the eyes of the law in most places, homosexuals have the same rights as other members of society, and the legal issue now before the residents of the Miami area is whether homosexuals should have added protection against discrimination in jobs and housing.

title: Summaries of I.R.A. Regatta Finals
description: VARSITY EIGHTS

title: 250 Children Meet At Hospital Reunion Of Heart Patients
description: A few weeks ago, 5yearold Matthew Coppinger of River Vale, N.J., was a sick boy. His face had a blue tinge: his hands were always cold, and he was withdrawn and usually too tired to play with otherchildren.

title: Neil Livingstone Hazard Marries Lynne Ann Binder
description: Lynne Ann Binder and Neil Livingstone Hazard, both of Chevy Chase, Md., were married yesterday afternoon by the Rev. Dr. William S. James in the Eastchester (N.Y.) Presbyterian Church.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: IF A HOMEOWNER discovered a hole big enough to throw a football through in one of the outside walls of his house, he would almost certainly take immediate steps to patch or plug this hole one way or another. Yet if that same house is missing most or all of the caulking around the outside windows, doors and other joints in siding or trim, there may be cracks or open seams whose total area could be the equivalent of an opening that is just that large in the outside walls of the house.

title: Nat Lobell Wins Rich Jersey Pace
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., June 4Failsafie Stable's Nat Lobell, closing strongly in the stretch, won the $45,000 final heat of the $113,000 Oliver Wendell Holmes Pace for 3yearolds at the Meadowlands tonight.

title: Follower of the Rev. Moon Missing After Boat Upsets on the Hudson
description: A 17yearold follower of the Rev. Sun Myung Moon was missing last night after the rowboat in which he was riding with Mr. Moon's son overturned on the Hudson River yesterday afternoon near the Unification Church's estate near Tarrytown. N.Y.

title: Cuba and Vietnam
description: The slowly improving relationships the Carter Administration is developing with Cuba and Vietnam are symbolically satisfying and politically sensible. The estrangements now being cautiously repaired date back nearly 20 years in the case of Cuba, 30 in the case of Vietnam. The one rupture resulted in the sorry Bay of Pigs episode and the gravest SovietAmerican crisis of the nuclear era; the other produced the most tragic and senseless war in American history.

title: Mayoral Candidates Don't Have to Promise So Much
description: The best of all possible political promises has two elements: It involves sometning thoroughly wortn doing, and someone else has to do it. So this year's New York( City mayoral campaign, which neared final roan last week( wnen Bella S. Abzug announced her candidacy tor the uemocratic nomination, should provide a lertile field tor imaginative pledges.

title: Brooklyn Appealing Steingut Case
description: ALBANY, June 4The Brooklyn District Attorney's office argued before the State Court of Appeals here this week that it should be allowed to press its electionviolation indictment against Assembly Speaker Stanley Steingut and his son, Robert, because the alleged crime affected Brooklyn even though it took place in Manhattan.

title: The Drama Behind the Tony Awards
description: In April, an emergency meeting was suddenly called by the committee which administers the Tony AwardsBroadway's most prestigious prizesto squelch a rumor that the Lincoln Center production of Chekhov's The Cherry Orchard might be included among the nominees for best play of 1977.

title: Votes in Congress
description: Senate

title: Debate on the Charter Is Started in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, June 4 (AP)The draft of the new Soviet constitution was released for public discussion today, and the Soviet radio and television reported that it was receiving widespread approval.

title: Manhasset Upset in Lacrosse
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., June 4Manhasset High School, the defending Nassau County lacrosse champion for the last two years, was dethroned by Elmont, 109, last night at Hofstra University stadium before a crowd of 4,200. Walter Hein led the Spartans with three goals and Kirk Baugher scored four for Manhasset. Ward Melville of Setauket defeated Brentwood Sonderling, 107, and retained its Suffolk County title.

title: 7Run 2d Survives 4Homer Attack by White Sox
description: CHICAGO, June 4The Yankees scored seven runs in the second inning for a quick 70 lead in sweltering Comiskey Park tonight and then just held on to defeat the White Sox, 86.

title: ANGOLA RADIO APPEALS FOR SUPPORT OF NETO
description: LONDON, June 4 (Reuters)The Luanda radio today appealed to officials of the governing Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola to rally around President Agostinho Neto, who crushed an attemuted coup last week.

title: Year's Traffic in the Suez Canal Is Estimated at 468 Million Tons
description: CAIRO, June 4 (AP)Traffic in the Suez Canal amounted to 468 million tons in the last year, the canal authorities said this week, indicating that the waterway was regaining its importance.

title: To Read, They Write for TV
description: UNIONDALE THE cameraman stood on a stool to reach the controls. The tiny squeak of the director's voice was barely audible. Quiet. Taping. One. Two. Three, she insisted, signaling the narrator to begin. With professional aplomb, he began a detailed discussion of why snakes are dangerous, stumbling over the word example and using a finger to point out the words of the script.

title: N.C.A.A. Title Track Summaries
description: TRACK EVENTS

title: Gavle Elinor Sciarrillo Bride
description: The marriage of Gayle Elinor Sciarrillo, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Joseph J. Sciarrillo of Bridgeport, Conn., to James Robert Kraus, son of Mr. and Mrs. Barnard Kraus of New Cannan, Conn., took place yesterday in St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Church in Bridgeport. The Rev. Thomas M. Halkovic performed the ceremony. The bridegroom is a tennis professional at the Trumbull (Conn.) Racquet Club and the Hillandale Racquet Club, also in Trumbull.

title: Monmouth
description: Time1:12 2/5. ScratchedMosha Hii, Kayos Good Music, Wheeling.

title: What's Doing in VANCOUVER
description: CROSSROADSThe serenity of the climate, the innumerable pleasing landscapes and the abundant fertility that unassisted nature puts forth, requires only to be enriched by the industry of man with villages, cottages and other buildings to render it the most lovely country that can be imagined. Capt.

title: Hope W. Schieffelin Married
description: Hope Williams Schieffelin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Jay Schieffelin 3d of Mount Kisco, N.Y., was married yesterday to Jon Dale Dooley of Hobart, Okla., son of Mr. and Mrs. Wendall Earl Dooley of Childress, Tex.

title: History
description: BIG STICKUP AT BRINK'S! Noel Behn. (Putnam's. $10.) The author of The Kremlin Letter offers a very convincing, interesting and pleasurable crook'seye view of the famous Brink's robbery in Boston in 1950.

title: No Dearth of Difficulties for N.H.L.
description: The National Hockey League's board of governors enters its annual meetings at Montreal this week confronted by a staggering list of unresolved matters: Four teams have no coach, at least three teams have dim futures, the current president has waited 17 months to find out who his successor will be, and everyone is waiting to find out whether there will be an accommodation of teams from the World Hockey Association.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: AMERICAN LEAGUE

title: Seniority Wins a Round
description: The United States Supreme Court, in some complex rulings last week, shocked the civil rights establishment and gave some hope to private employers that Government authority to sweep aside the vestige of job discrimination may be limited.

title: Jimmy Carter, an Original
description: NEW Presidents are always a little mysterious; and Jimmy Carter seems more mysterious than most. This is partly because no one knew much about him until a few months before his nomination. It is even more because he thereafter absolutely defied the conventional categorization that journalists and historians use as a substitute for analysis. Our new President is plainly an original. So we all seize avidly on any kind of evidence that might help dispel the mystery.

title: A Way Of Light Is Fading
description: YEARS ago, lighthouses were equipped with tallow candles, oil lamps or coal burners that were tended constantly by men. Today the lights in the towers are run by electronic equipmentsometimes functioning for months without direct human contact.

title: Packers Are the Only Team in N.F.L. to Keep Their Books Open
description: When Billy Sullivan acquired financial control of the New England Patriots last year, the franchise became a private one with no need to divulge its operations as in the years when the stock was widely held. That change leaves the Green Bay Packers as the only one of the National Football League's 28 teams making an annual income statement. This condition is peculiar to the Packers under their nonprofit ownership by several hundred hometown citizens.

title: New Edition of the Bible to Eliminate Many Masculine References
description: The new edition of the Revised Standard Version of the Bible, scheduled to be published in the mid1980's, may go a long way toward eliminating masculinebiased language, but not all the way, according to Dr. Bruce M. Metzger, a biblical scholar and professor of New Testament language and literature at Princeton Theological Seminary.

title: Mrs. Porter Has a New Top Setter
description: The Irish setter is unquestionably one of the more handicmte aristocrats of dogdom and the name of a lady in New York has long been synonomous with leading campaigners. Mrs. Cheever Porter has owned other top champions in various breeds over the years, but the redcoat has been her abiding interest. Ch. McKendree's Bold Venture, Mrs. Porter's current headliner, presents an exquisite portrait in style, motion and balance when viewed in the sunlight against lush green fields at the current spring shows.

title: NEW SOVIET CHARTER AVOIDS RIGHTS SHIFT
description: MOSCOW, June 4The draft of the Soviet Union's new constitution, published today in newspapers throughout the country, makes no basic legal change in the conditions of human freedom. It sets forth an array of individual rights similar to those in the existing Stalinist Constitution, but then limits them with a series of subtle caveats.

title: FISHING
description: THE best bets for the Island's fishermen this week seem to be bluefish and blue sharks off the South Shore and Montauk and fluke inshore. In Long Island Sound, blackfishing is generally good, but there is an excellent run of porgies on the eastem end and a surprisingly strong showing of weakfish off Lloyd Neck and Centre Island.

title: FOOD
description: IKE latterday Tom Sawyers, farmers have found someone to whitewash the fence. Although the minimum wage for farm labor is $2.20 an hour, many of the people picking berries, tomatoes and vegetables on local farms this summer will pay the farmer for the privilege of gathering his fresh produce.

title: Behind the Facade of Lifetime Job Security
description: The new steel contract, according to Lloyd McBride, presidentelect of the United Steel Workers, makes a start toward providing lifetime job security for the union's 340,000 steel workers, although it falls short of the U.S.W.'s stated goal.

title: Tufariello Sets 440 Mark
description: KINGS POINT, L.I., June 4Tony Tufariello of Hewlett set a New York State schoolboy record of 46.5 seconds today for the 440yard dash at the Nassau County championships. It was one of the fastest times in the country this year.

title: GARDENING
description: THE furious spring is past, and summer has arrived in New Jersey while I am still in the process of setting out seedlings. Now is the time to provide a vacation spot for house plants. Most of them benefit from spending the summer months outdoors.

title: Trudeau Faces CoverUp Charges In Case Involving Illegal BreakIn
description: OTTAWA, June 4Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau and members of his Cabinet have come under severe parliamentary questioning over a presumed connection linking a mysterious seizure of private documents seven years ago, a confessed illegal breakin two years later and the circulation among Cabinet members in 1971 of a list of Government employees accused of being subversive.

title: THE LITERARY VIEW
description: THINKING about the 70's, as we are invited to do today, it occurs to me that the books of this decade that have made the boldest claim on our attentionthe books that define the largest human issues, certainly, and remain the most heroic examples we know of the literary imagination attempting In conditions of extreme adversity to encompass the most fateful events of our timehave not been mitten in America. They have come to us from, of all places, Russia.

title: A. B. Edwards Jr. Weds Sheila O'Dea
description: Sheila Marie O'Dea, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas G. O'Dea of Massapequa Park, LI., and West Palm Beach, Fla., and Allen Braxton Edwards Jr. were married yesterday. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Edwards of Saegertown, Pa. The Rev. Harold Heindel performed the ceremony in St. Rose of Lima Roman Catholic Church in Massapequa.

title: Water Battle In Long Beach
description: LONG BEACH A YEARLONG controversy over what many residents in this South Shore seaside city feel have been unconscionable increases in water rates is headed for a showdown in court because of a decision by city officials to cut off service to some 2,000 homes for failure to pay their bills.

title: Miss Burnett, Bank Trainee, Has Nuptials
description: Elizabeth Burnett, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Mason Burnett of Newport, R.I., was married there yesterday to Albert James Macchioni, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert John Macchioni of Pittsburgh.

title: Future Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Memorial Servires
description: BEAUMONTThomas Palmer. A memorial service will be held in the West Milford Presbyterian Church, West Milford, N.J., at 8 o'clock in the evening, Wednesday, June 8. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be ma?? the Church at West Milford, N.J. ??

title: Engagements
description: BesserZuckman

title: Mary Schlegal and Peter Clarke to Marry
description: Mr. and Mrs. Harry C. Schlegal of Garden City, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Mary Ann Schlegal, to Peter Thomson Clarke, son of Mr. and Mrs. David C. Clarke of Yarmouth, Me. A July wedding is planned.

title: Better Batter
description: Although a can of flat beer may be the bane of those who dote on a frosty and lively brew, it is to a knowledgeable cook a liquid of considerable merit. Beer can be used to make a fine fermented batter for deepfrying. It yields a crusty delicate coating to such good things as shrimp, cheese (deepfried camembert balls are delicious), brains and assorted vegetables.

title: Schools Are a Taxing Issue
description: ALL true Americans are expected to believe in education. Like motherhood, it is immune from question or doubt. As a consequence, anyone voicing a reservation about the runaway costs of education is labeled a heretic.

title: Batterfried shrimp
description: 1 pounds shrimp Beer batter (see recipe)

title: A New. Swan Prepares For Flight
description: Perhaps the supreme test for any classical ballerina comes when she undertakes the grueling dual role of OdetteOdile in Swan Lake, the immensely popu lar PetipaIvanov ballet to the music of Tchaikovsky. Ever since the great Italian Pierina Legnani created the role at the St. Petersburg Maryinsky Theater in 1895, ballerinas have both dreaded and been lured by its technical and interpretative demands. Indeed, some, like the Italian Carla Fracci and the English Merle Park, did not attempt a fulllength Swan Lake until well into their mature dancing years.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: Pedestrians Warned: Don't Gamble With Cars

title: Surrogate Vacancy Will Be Filled
description: A new Manhattan surrogate will be appointed to fill the vacancy created by the death of Samuel A. Spiegel, Governor Carey said yesterday.

title: Lone Eagle, Concorde and A10 Dominate Air Show
description: LE BOURGET, France, June 4Charles A. Lindbergh was honored today on the spot where the late flier concluded his historic flight 50 years ago. But a plane crash yesterday and the continuing controversy over the supersonic Concorde sought equal time on a day dedicated to the world's most famous pilot.

title: A Major Investment in State Health
description: APART from the obvious goals set for it by the stateto train physicians, dentists and some other scientists; and to be an important center for research and public health the University of Connecticut Health Center at Farmington, which was dedicated in a threeday program here last month, has set a couple of innovative and needed objectives.

title: NONFICTION IN BRIEF
description: It was during my first attempt at book reviewing, many years ago, that the image of an aged seer materialized before me. (I knew he was wise because he had a long white beard, a lantern and a nineroom, rent. controlled apartment.) Son, he said in a quavering voice, never review the book you would have written.

title: Twothirds of Ousted Cadets Are Returning to West Point
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., June 4Twothirds of the West Point cadets ousted in last year's cheating scandal will be returning later this month after spending their time as Army privates, college seniors, pizzastand operators or shortorder cooks.

title: 13th Floor, Anyone?
description: Not long ago, a man and his son were riding in the elevator of an East Side highrise. The boy, barely of speaking age, was ticking off the floors:  three, four, five, six. . .

title: World News Briefs
description: MADRID, June 4 (AP)Unknown assailants shot and killed two paramilitary civil guards in Barcelona and bombers struck at Madridarea power stations today in a continuing campaign of violence before the Spanish elections on June 15.

title: Space Shuttle Test Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (UPI)The first manned test flight of the new space shuttle orbiter Enterprise atop a 747 jumbojet at Edwards Air Force Base in California has been delayed again the National Aeronautics and Space Administration said yesterday. The flight originally was set for May 26, then put off to June 9 because of technical troubles. The tentative new date is June 16. The space shuttle is a winged rocket plane scheduled to make its first flight into orbit in 1979.

title: THE STYLE OF THE 70's
description: In the world of politics, style is integral to the successful pursuit and exercise of power. Beyond the formal authority that his office confers on him, a political ruler depends for his effectiveness on the impression of authority that other people carry around in their minds. He creates that impression not only by his serious decisions but also by his public demeanor, his choice of words, his taste in people and amusements; by his characteristic style.

title: Fashion
description: At 26, Stephen Burrows was the brightest star of American Fashion. He did things with clothes that had never been done before and he did them with style and panache. That was in 1970. By the time he was 31, he was a hasbeen, washed upon the shores of Seventh Avenue. Now, at 33, he's up again. French designer Karl Lagerfeld says of him: Burrows is the most original American talent since Claire McCardle. Most designers don't get a second chance. Stephen Burrows did  and from the people he hurt most the first time around.

title: Sludge Study Cleared for
description: WASHINGTON WHEN it comes to recreation boating, swimming, sunbathing and snorkelingwhy not try the Connecticut Keys? Florida gets a lot of tourist mileage out of its keys, so why shouldn't Connecticut cash in a little bit, too?

title: Justice Aides Link New York City Trucker to Inquiry on I.C.G
description: WASHINGTON. June 4At least one New York City trucking company is involved in a Justice Department investigation into whether organized crime has exerted influence on Interstate Commerce Commission decisions on trucking, sources close to the investigation said today.

title: State Tennis to Miss Newfield, 15
description: MAMARONECK, N.Y., June 4Betty Newfield, a 15.yearold from Jackson Heights, Queens, won the New York State women's tennis championship today by trouncing Marilyn Aschner Katz of Ne wHyde Park, L.I., 60,60, in the final.

title: Racial Problems Seen Increasing in Netherlands
description: THE HAGUE, June 3The Netherlands bas, almost unawares, become a multiracial society with many of the problems familiar to America and other multiracial parts of the world.

title: Green BrookElegant Coed Pool
description: A SMOKEFILLED, rundown joint where downandout guys hang out. A dimly lighted, lowclass place peopled with Damon Runyontype characters. A place where your mother don't want you to go. Jackie Gleason as Minnesota Fats in The Hustler.

title: Pilot Lands Damaged Jet Safely
description: TUCSON, Ariz., June 4 (AP)Tom Gullett, pilot of a Continental Air Lines Boeing 727 jet that ripped through power lines on takeoff in high winds yesterday at Tucson International Airport, rupturing a wing fuel tank, landed the plane with no injuries to the 95 persons on board. Airport officials said that it was almost impossible to control the plane with that wing damage.

title: Escape to Litchfield: A Graceful Green,
description: The county of Litchfield covers the northwest corner of Connecticut, bordering Massachusetts and Dutchess County, N. Y. It is the state's most spacious county but its least densely populated, an entire region with no interstate highway or toll road, no amusement park or large resort. Its one real city, Torrington, holds about 30,000 inhabitants; the town of Litchfield, the county seat, just two hours by car from Manhattan, has only 7,500.

title: Rosemarie Dorothy Potz Wed To Michael Edward McGerr
description: Rosemarie Dorothy Potz and Michael Edward McGerr, students at the Yale Graduate School, were married yesterday in New Haven. The ceremony was performed in the Dwight Memorial Chapel at Yale University by the Rev. Norbert Firnhaber, pastor of the Bethany Lutheran Church in West Hartford, Conn.

title: $27.40 Filly Wins Stakes At Belmont
description: Although he saw pigeons become airborne right in his path as he approached the sixteenth pole, Eddie Maple had little difficulty scoring with Windfields Farms' Pacific Princess in yesterday's $54,500 Hempstead Handicap at Belmont Park.

title: Births
description: Bonheim

title: DANCE VIEW
description: What is it Tevye sings in Fiddler on the Roof? (Obviously, I know, otherwise I would not have made this somewhat cumbersome opening.) Tradition! Ah, tradition! Dance actually lives or dies by itand we have scarcely more than our traditions to keep us going. However fast we in dance are advancingand we are advancing fastdance notation is still not as readily obtainable or accessible to dance students as music notation is to music students. As a result, dance is still very mush a verbal traditiona handing down of traditions from one generation of dancer to another, andhave you ever thought of this?in a curious way the handing down of traditions from one generation of audience to another.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: UNEMPLOYMENT DECLINED in May to a 30month low of 6.9 percent, from 7 percent in April. The number of people with jobs increased by 385,000, the Labor Department reported... Wholesale prices last month rose at a 4.8 percent annual rate, the lowest increase in nine months.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Most of our politicians and economists are still trying to make mixed capitalism work by redistributing income from the rich to the poor. They stick to income redistribution because they think it is the only way to make capitalism work in a democracy whose people have high expectations. They ignore the possibility that broadening ownership of wealth can make capitalism work betteror even make capitalism universal. Wealth is part of the fixed social structure, not to be tinkered with, said Keynes in his 1936 General Theory. But by 1940 Keynes had smelled inflation coming and had written that the solution was a piece of the ownership action for everyone.

title: Jobs Program Backed by House
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (UPI)  The House yesterday passed and sent to President Carter a oneyear extension of an $8.3 billion program to create jobs and train workers for them. The House, as the Senate did last week, approved the measure by voice vote. It authorizes continuation for one year of the Comprehensive Employment and Training Act, which includes the public service jobs program.

title: BRIDGE
description: In any recreational activity the beginner needs plenty of encouragement, and the instructor is likely to shower praise on him if he executes a simple maneuver successfully. But the teaching pro may be left speechless if the student suddenly does something really advancedif the golf novice hits his first trap shot six inches from the hole or the tennis neophyte hits a topspin lob to the baseline.

title: Article 12  No Title
description: A fashion original, Stephen Burrows triumphs once more after three troubled years. Here he's photographed with the people who made it possible. From left to right: friend Diane Strafaci in clothes from his summer collection; accessory designer Bobby Breslau; model Pat Cleveland in one of Burrows's newest dresses, a bronze metalmesh top with ruby chiffon skirt; Joel Schumacher, who discovered Burrows's talent; model Bethann Hardison, dressed from his summer collection; Geraldine Stutz, president of Henri Bendel; Burrows; his grandmother Beatrice Simmons who wears his clothes; friend Norton Sloan; former classmate Carolyn Moy; friend Don Fendley; Joseph Strafaci, Diane's husband; Burrows's mother, Octavio Banks, also wearing a Burrows.

title: Mosquito Viruses: State Is on Guard
description: TWO summers ago, 29 persons in New Jersey were bitten by mosquitoes and infected with St. Louis encephalitis. One of them died from the disease, which attacks the central nervous system.

title: A Soccer Diplomat With a Mission
description: BORN in England, Clive Toye of Scarsdale hasn't served in the diplomatic corps of a Prime Minister or President, yet he is known to more people around the world than many diplomats or politicians.

title: Next Round in the NorthSouth Talks Goes Beyond Principles
description: PARIS  The final session of the NorthSouth dialogue last week turned out a field day for those who distrust free markets. Perhaps field night would be a better expression, for it took ministers of the 27 rich and poor countries at the conference four days and two consecutive nights of nonstop negotiation to reach a disappointingly limited agreement. Such Herculean endeavors prove that the issues at stake are sensitive.

title: Washington Warns Hartford on Pollution
description: BECAUSE of the failure of the Connecticut General Assembly to pass automobile air pollution controls, the United States En vironmental Protection Agency has warned Governor Grasso that it will begin the necessary steps for a federally promulgated inspection and maintenance program.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Joe Torre discloses that his 11yearold daughter. Lauren, wasn't keen about him taking over as Mets' manager: Lauren said she didn't want me to do it because all that managers do is get booed and get fired.

title: Trophy Sailing Postponed
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., June 4  The 29th annual Long Island Sound Associate sailing championship for the Jesse A. B. Smith Thophy, scheduled to be held at Larchrnont Yacht Club today, was postponed because of Y.R.A. racing regatta conflicts. The championship, for Y.R.A. members at least 18 and under 25 years of age, will be rescheduled later this summer.

title: Wings for Foreign Pilots
description: NAPA, Calif. When the International Air Service Company opened its $12.1 million flight training school in this fertile wineproducing valley in 1971, the company felt that it had more than just yearround flying weather to offer student pilots from abroad.

title: How to Remodel the F.D.A.and Where
description: How to Remodel the F.D. A.and Where

title: Home of the Solid Old Cadillac
description: NEW cars are terrific, right? They ride like clouds. They don't rattle or squeak, and whatever problems come upwell, the warranty will take care of them. They are something to be proud of, to polish and look at and smile over. And they smell good.

title: Classical Curios That Could Only Happen on Disks
description: What possible connection could exist between Joan Sutherland in the role of a 15yearold Chinese virgin and a Hurrian cult song from ancient Ugarit, circa 1400 B.C.? The answer: both of these phenomena may only be heard via recordings and the chances of ever encountering them live are slim indeed.

title: When Mothers Take a Hand in Education
description: SOME of the most innovative programs for students in Westbury schools got their start through the efforts of a group of black women who became disenchanted, years ago, with the kind of education their children were receiving.

title: LETTERS TO THE CONNECTICUT EDITOR
description: Help Cancer Patients To Live, Not to Die

title: 3 Yacht Races on Course For Bermuda This Month
description: This is not the year for the biennial Bermuda Race and that is fortunate. The sea routesto the British colony will be busy enough with yachts from three races heading there this month. Two of the races are new and all attest to the growth and diversity of yacht racing. One is a cruising yacht race. Another is for singlehanded sailors. And the third is for multihulls.

title: A Lively Challenge for Vergari
description: CARL A. VERGARI, District Attorney of Westchester since 1968 and one of the county's most formidable votegetters, is being challenged by Michael S. Bank, a 31yearold former assistant to Maurice H. Nadjari, in what promises to be one of the liveliest battles of this election year.

title: Jane B. Clark Wed in Virginia
description: Jane Bennett Clark, an assistant copy editor at Changing Times, the Kiplinger magazine in Washington, and Christopher King Madison, a reporter with McGrawHill Publication, also in Washington, were married yesterday in the Roman Catholic Church of the Incarnation in Charlottesville, Va. The pastor, the Rev. William A. Gardner, performed the ceremony. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Champ Clark of Ruckersville, Va. Mr. Madison's parents are Mr. and Mrs. William Madison of New York.

title: THE STYLE OF THE 70's
description: Is there a poetic style of the 70's? And is that a serious or interesting question? Between the interesting but petty Muse of Gossip (who's in, who's out, who's being imitated, who's imitating himself) on one side and deeper questions on the other lies a large, dull, gray area. To give an accurate and exhaustive account of that period, wrote a very young Max Beerbohm in 1894, looking back at the early 80's, would need a far less brilliant pen than mine. And too close a look at any brief, recent period needs a pen less brilliant than nearly anybody's.

title: Outdoor Festival Revisits Hartford
description: THE biggest outdoor exposition of the visual and performing arts in New England is under way in Hartford and, among other things, the price is right. There is no admission charge for any of the exhibits, concerts and demonstrations that will keep Constitution Plaza a cultural Utopia straight through till next weekend.

title: Radio
description: Today: Leading Events

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: AN OVERWHELMING favorite he is not, but let it be said that Governor Byrne is at least the underwhelming choice to win the Democratic gubernatorial primary on Tuesday, according to a poll of New Jersey's members of Congress.

title: Merely Firm, Fair and Compassionate
description: IN view of the enormous impact Earl Warren had upon this nation, it is startling to be reminded that he did not begin his monumental labors until he was 62 years old. Before that he had been a regional figure, able, affable and photogenic, but hardly a dynamo. And then he undertook what he calls, in this posthumously published autobiography, an entirely new way of life, three thousand miles from where I had lived and worked during my entire career and in an environment almost totally unfamiliar to me.

title: CARTER SEEKS EXTENSION OF RUMANIAN TRADE TIES
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (UPI)President Carter has asked Congress,to extend for 12 months a waiver granting mostfavorednation status to Rumania, but he warned that he would monitor closely any repressive emigration tactics by the Bucharest Government, the White House said today.

title: Teachers: Are There Enough?
description: THE teaching business (I have trouble calling it a profession) never ceases to present intriguing possibilities. For in stance, we are all aware that the cur. rent mood of taxpayers is to give the schools fewer and fewer of their precious dollars.

title: Clarke Nickerson Weds Helen Vaughan
description: Helen Shreve Vaughan was married yesterday in Christ Episcopal Church in Pelham, N.Y., to Clarke Case Nickerson of Tilton, N.H. The Rev. David Hoag performed the ceremony. He was assisted by the Rev. Robert Back of Darien, Conn.

title: Doctors End Strike in Sri Lanka
description: COLOMBO, June 4 (Reuters)Doctors in Sri Lanka today called off a strike that for two days had paralyzed the island's staterun hospitals.

title: Kathryn M. Steward Is Married
description: The marriage of Kathryn Merrill Steward, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Merrill Franklin Steward of North Haven, Conn., and StraffordBow Lake, N.H., to John Hamilton Lewis Bingham took place at Trinity Episcopal ChurchontheGreen in New Haven yesterday. The bridegroom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Hiram Bingham of Salem, Conn., and a grandson of the late Hiram Bingham, who directed the 1912 expedition from Yale that rediscovered the lost Inca civilization at Machu Picchu in Peru, and who served as Governor of Connecticut and as United States Senator from Connecticut. The Rev. Craig Biddle 3d, rector of the church, performed the ceremony.

title: A Group Meeting Last Week at Notre Dame Is Convinced Vatican II Left Much Unfinished Business
description: Even as the Roman Catholic Church continued to reckon with the Second Vatican Council (196265), an international group of 70 church scholars, Including social scientists as well as theologians, met at Notre Dame University to sketch a scenario for Vatican III, if and when such a council should take place.

title: Enyeart Captures N.C.A.A. 800 Title
description: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., June 4Alert running gave impressive victories to Mark Enyeart and Wilson Waigwa today at the National Collegiate Athletic Association's outdoor track and field championships.

title: Fair Food, Good Value
description: WHEN you arrive at a restaurant at 7:15 on a midweek evening to find it so crowded that you have to wait for a table, you know the place is doing something right. It's either good or cheap or, in the best of all possible worlds, both good and cheap.

title: GARDENING
description: JUNE belongs to the roses. This is the month when the gardener is rewarded for all the attention the plants have been given. In spite of the rough winter, a majority of rosebushes came through beautifully, and the buds are bursting with blossoms in all their glorious colors.

title: SPEAKING PERSONALLY
description: MY fantasy, not including those kinky dreams I wouldnot share with an analyst, is to send myself to tennis camp. Some July or August, leaving my children and their father, I shall take myself to Florida or Arizona or New Hampshire or Vermont, my bag packed with sparkling whites, my other hand clutching a newly strung, newly purchased, finely balanced racket, my spirit ready for the rigors of long mornings and afternoons on the courts, perfecting a crashing backhand, a beautiful overhead smash, an ace serve, and perfect concentration.

title: Peter Wyman Marries Amy Holzworth
description: At the Old Wye Episcopal Church in Easton. Md., yesterday Amy Blythe Holzworth, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Wendover Peter Holzworth of Shaker Heights, Ohio, was married to Peter George Wyman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas G. Wyman of New York and Easton. The Rev. H. M. Richardson performed the ceremony.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: ALBERTSONNature etchings by Gail Cohen Edelman; through June 30; Shelter Rock Public Library, 165 Searington Rd. For hours call CH 87363.

title: The Velvet Baranello Touch
description: HOURS after the Democratic majority of the Suffolk County Legislature had rammed through the appointment of Donald Dilworth as the new County Police Commissioner, County Executive John V.N. Klein warned his fellow Republicans of a new era of raw political power in the county. That was on Feb. 1, when Dominic J. Baranello had completed his long climb up from the obscure post of chairman of an almost nonexistent Suffolk County Democratic Party to the leadership of the state party organization.

title: JUSTICE GAVE WORK TO 2 IN INLAW'S FIRM
description: Justice Abraham J. Gellinoff of New York State Supreme Court chose two law partners of his soninlaw to serve as guardians, referees or receivers in cases that have come before him, positions for which the two lawyers received more than $35,000 in legal fees over the last two years.

title: Apples' Rally Beats Soviets
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., June 4Trailing, 30, in the final match, Virginia Wade and Billie Jean King rallied to win the next six games in the women's double, to give the New York Apples a 2623 victory over the Soviets tonight at Nassau Coliseum. The triumph was the Apples' seventh straight and lifted them into a virtual tie with the Boston Lobsters for first place in the Eastern Division of World Team Tennis.

title: FORMER K.C.I.A HEAD SAYS PARK TONG SUN WAS KOREAN AGENT
description: WASHINGTON, June 4A former Director of the Korean Central Intelligence Agency, Kim Hyung Wook, has broken a long silence to identify Park Tong Sun as a K.C.I.A. agent who spent millions of dollars on an allegedly illegal scheme to influence American policy on Korea.

title: The Nation
description: President Carter has again signaled his seriousness in trying to limit the proliferation of atomic weapons: He has chosen Gerard C. Smith, a respected disarmament specialist who has served in four Administrations, to renegotiatewith stricter termsnuclearcooperation agreements with countries seeking advanced nuclear technology. Mr. Smith will also try to persuade other countries that export such technology to follow the American example.

title: Beer Batter
description: cup flour

title: In Memoriam
description: AVRUTISJohn. June 8, 1971. Cherished memories of a beloved brother in our hearts forever.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Marking the 65th anniversary of Universal Pictures, the Museum of Modern Art beginning an extensive, eightmonth retrospective on Thursday. Popular and classic films will be shown, along with others not seen since their original release. What has been left outwhich speaks for the extraordinary output of the companyare those films frequently revived in New York or on TV. (See Film)

title: When The Giants Quarrel
description: PARIS, June 4United StatesSoviet relations are very much on the minds of Western European officials these days. They are saying nothing in public, but privately they express concern about the mounting criticism between the new Administration in Washington and the aging regime in Moscow.

title: Connecticut/This Week
description: GREENWICHGreenwich Art Society annual show, today 10 to 5, East Putnam Ave. from Greenwich Ave. to the YMCA. Auction at Y corner 3 P.M.

title: 12 States Observe 100th Anniversary Of Fresh Air Fund
description: Because of a sermon by a young minister 100 years ago, Mayor Beame and Gov. Milton Shapp of Pennsylvania have issued proclamations, 500 children received free tickets to Shea Stadium and a quarter of a million worshipers planned special services this weekend in churches and synagogues in 12 states.

title: But Much of the PrePresidential Stubbornness Still Only Shows in Talk
description: WASHINGTONJimmy Carter has finally begun to show some of his celebrated toughness and whether he can make it stick could determine the course of his Presidency.

title: Events Today
description: SALUTE TO ISRAEL PARADE: noon; Filth Avenue from 57th to 86th Streets.

title: IN AMERICA
description: ST. LOUIS. The shopping complex that's taking shape on McKelvey Road in suburban Maryland Heights, just off the Interstate, already has its McDonald's and its BaskinRobbins. Its KMart is under construction across the road from its newly opened Kentucky Fried Chicken, which is roofed in red tiles that radiantly catch the midday sun, outgleaming all the other plastic landmarks in the vicinity except one: an equally radiant tower that appears to have been finished in the same red tiles. The first reaction is to wonder why the corporate keepers of Colonel Sanders allowed two of their outlets to he established so close together. Then you draw near enough to read the logo. It's not Kentucky Fried Chicken. It's Kinder Care  a chain of daycare centers that's relentlessly replicating itself near the Interstates and Beltways that funnel suburban American to work.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: THE FLAP over tighter credit conditions and rising interest rates that erupted in recent weeks between Washington political personalities and the banking community has aroused the attention of the business community, but it has not yet caused any significant ripples in the markets or the national economy.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: WASHINGTON, D.C. Iwonder if God likes the movies. The theater has never been able to make up its mind whether it does or not. Usually, let's say when it's kidding the likes of Busby Berkeley in a little musical called Dames at Sea, it starts out as though it were going to be pretty wicked about that plot in which the understudy gets to go on because the star has broken her leg. But, practically before you can say Bebe Daniels, the satire has lost its sting and the show is turning foolishly tender. I well remember the single tear that glistened on heroine Bernadette Peters's cheek as she sang It's Raining in My Heart. And I realize now that it was a very symbolic tear: it represented the entire audience's wistful yearning for its own youth, for the Saturdaymatinee miracles that would never come again, for the very gullibility that had once led to pleasure but had had to give wayalas, alas to what we think of as sophistication, if not maturity.

title: British Boys Find Gold in Rain
description: WINCHESTER, England, June 4 (Reuters)Two schoolboys described the other day how they took shelter from a storm under a tree and found gold coins worth $50,000. Harry King and Jeremy de Montfalcon, both aged 15, explained to a special jury that they had been out treasure hunting with metal detectors. Under the tree, the detectors began buzzing and they found 97 buried gold coins dated between 1773 and 1822. The jury decided they were hidden more than 100 years ago and therefore the property of the crown.

title: A Nun's Challenge on Women's Rights
description: EVERY morning Sister Mary Ramona Pena wakes up In her small apartment on the top floor of one of Yale University's Gothic dormitories and sees her antique map of Spain and a blackandwhite etching of Don Quixote.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Fortune Makes a Choice
description: A few nights ago, Dan North of CrotononHudson, N. Y., called to say that his son David wanted to talk to me.

title: Architecture
description: T me, the drawn language is a very revealing language; one can see in a few lines whether a man is really an architect, Eero Saarinen once said, and indeed, throughout history architects have tended to think on paper with pencil in hand more than through words. To describe Saarinen's Ingalls Hockey Rink at Yale in words is awkward; in the architect's freehand drawing, the swooping form of the great concrete arch that is the building's spine becomes comprehensible, and it is easy to understand the story Saarinen himself loved to repeat about the player on the Yale team who said when he looked up at the concrete arch, it made him feel Go, go, go!

title: DINING OUT
description: TAKE an old building with a waterfront view, fix it up with imagination and serve good food at moderate prices. Sound like the impossible dream? Look again. The Old Oyster Factory Restaurant is a reality in Greenport.

title: Brains in beer batter
description: Beer batter (see recipe)

title: DINING OUT
description: WHEN you arrive at a restaurant at 7:15 on a midweek evening to find it so crowded that you have to wait for a table, you know the place is doing something right. It's either good or cheap or, in the best of all possible worlds, both good and cheap.

title: Deborah Stone Is Affianced
description: Deborah Stone and Kurt E. Brown plan an August wedding in the chapel at the United States Merchant Marine Academy at Kings Point, L.I., from which Mr. Btown graduated in 1975. Mr. and Mrs. Richard M. Stone of Garden City, L.I., have announced their daughter's engagement to the son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. Brown of Corpus Christi, Tex. The bridetobe graduated from Molloy College.

title: TRENTON NOTEBOOK
description: APOLITICAL time bomb awaits the State Legislature when it returns to Trenton two weeks from tomorrow. About half of the state government's 60,000 employees are threatening a strike on July 1.

title: Cutting the Juice in West Windsor
description: BEFORE energy conservation became a national slogan, RCA's David Sarnoff Research Center in West Windsor decided to practice it seriously.

title: Better Bonds With Caulking
description: IF A HOMEOWNER discovered a hole big enough to throw a football through in one of the outside walls of his house, he would almost certainly take immediate steps to patch or plug this hole one way or another. Yet if that same house is missing most or all of the caulking around the outside windows, doors and other joints in siding or trim, there may be cracks or open seams whose total area could be the equivalent of an opening that is just that large in the outside walls of the house.

title: SALVATION ARMY DUE FOR 36 NEW OFFICERS
description: SUFFERN, N.Y.The Salvation Army officers training school, a blend of religious seminary and military establishment that fled here from the Bronx five years ago because quarters were cramped and cadets were being mugged, will graduate 36 men and women next weekend.

title: Peugeot Promotes Its Luxury 604 In the U.S.
description: Since April, readers of major newspapers on the East and West Coasts and of 34 magazines, have been barraged by advertisements for Peugeot's new luxury car, the 604, which the French automaker is introducing to the American market. The $11,000plus sedan is being pushed as the alternative to a Jaguar, a B.M.W. or a Mercedes.

title: City Hovercraft
description: Hovercraft service from Wall Street to La Guardia Airport. Hovercraft commuter runs from Riverdale to West 42d Street and from Coop. City to East 34th Street. And, at night, a Staten Island Ferry operated with hovercraft.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 10:30 A.M. (Channel 4) Sunday: David Dinkins, candidate for Manhattan Borough President; Genie Bonne, president of the Federation of West Side Block Associations

title: If No Board of Education, How to Run the Schools?
description: If Mayor Beame has his way, New York City will reorganize the top administration of its 1.1million  pupil school system, and thereby become the only city in the country to run its schools without a board of education.
