Two days of hearings will begin tomorrow on the Mayor's plan to abolish the sevenmember lay board as well as the system's top job, the chancellorship. Control of the schools would pass to a City Hall appointee, a commissioner with power similar to that of the commissioner of police or any other municipal agency.

title: Turkey's Opposition Party Is Favored in the General Elections Today
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, June 4As Turkey's tumultuous election campaign ended today, the Republican People's Party was the strong fayorite to lead in the voting tomorrow and make their leader, Bulent Ecevit, the next prime minister. Most analysts believe, however, that the Republicans, a social democratic party, will not get a majority in the 450member Parliament and will have to form a coalition government.

title: Why Have More Than One?
description: Images of man's future that have us standing on our allotted one square foot of space or waiting on infinite lines for a cup of desalinated water; women's newfound drive for selfrealization, for doctoral degrees and executive secretaries of their own; concern about holocaust, revolution, depressionthese cause many young couples to pause before conceiving a second child. What rational reason could there be for having another baby? The first, after all, has made them parents, has given them the experience of process, of wonder, of exhaustion, of change in life style. Their firstborn has succeeded in muting their egotism and shifting the marriage from mere romance to the earnest discipline of baby sitters, tuition plans and Saturdays spent at the zoo. What more could the second child do or be? What vacuum remains for it to fill? Isn't one of nature's miracles and all the complications that follow enough? Apparently not. For nearly 50 percent of the parents in the labor rooms in New York Hospital last month, one child was only the beginning. ;nay be fewer new families being started in America nowadays. Many more young people are delaying or deciding against having children altogether, but for those young Americans who have decided to become parents, the majority still plan on that second baby and maybe more.

title: Track and Field
description: AT TOTTENVILLE, S.I.

title: Orgmism's Trite Special Effects Steal Attention From the Music
description: Organism, a mixedmedia presentation ending a fournight run this evening at the Beacon Theater, is a curious hybrid. Conceived, according to the posters, by George Cree, and featuring Leonard Raver, a contmeporary organist, as star performer and master of ceremonies, the show also includes modern dance choreographed by Diane Boardman and the sort of special effectslaser and strobe lights, smoke machines, backlighted projectionone associates with rock.

title: BOOK ENDS
description: THE crush of littlemagazine editors, poets and writers in the Gotham Book Mart's gallery seemed the realization of Ortega y Gasset's prophecy  glut in the conduits of culture. The literati were gathered at the invitation of the Coordinating Council of Literary Magazines to hear former Senator Eugene McCarthy, poet and newspaper columnist, announce prizewinners for the best poems and short stories published in the littles last year.

title: LEISURE
description: June opens the rose season with the first blooms that should continue through summer, with proper care. And it's that proper care that must be emphasized. For some knowledge aforethought will assure abundant flowers on healthy plants.

title: Critics Charge City Dawdles Over Grants
description: In a 16block area of the troubled East New York section of Brooklyn, work has begun on the rehabilitation of 27 vacant and deteriorated small homes that have long been a sore spot in a community struggling to reverse years of decline.

title: ABOUT NEW JERSEY
description: BREAKFAST a couple of weeks ago was the tipoff. My older son, Chris, came downstairs to the kitchen table, smiling and dressed. I mean dressed a bit differently than usual.

title: ART
description: IF there were a law against voluptuousness in art, Stan Brodsky would surely be in jail and his paintings, now on view in New York at the LernerHeller Gallery, would surely be impounded.

title: Appalachian Spring
description: ABROWSING customer new to Appalachian House, 1591 Post Road, Fairfield, found herself intrigued by a flounced calicocovered footstool in the shape of a turtle priced at $18. This would be nice for my daughter's room, she said. Does it come in yellow?

title: The Record Of the MiniBoards Is Spotty
description: A familar question, whether the decentralization of New York City's public schools has been worth the trouble and expense, is being asked once again by public officials. Some of the answers they are getting have not been encouraging, though no major reforms are likely for now.

title: CRIME
description: Leonard Simon, a clinical psychologist and psychoanalyst, has observed New York and found that its condition is not good. So he has written a book about the plight of the city (and, by extension, of any overcrowded metropolis). In THE IRVING SOLUTION (Arbor House, $7.95) he draws upon research concerning rats under stress and extends it to people under stress. The material about rats is factual; many such experiments have been done in recent years. The experiments on humans are imaginative extrapolationbut Simon makes a strong and scary case.

title: Westchester/This Week
description: ARMONKThe Optimimes, George and Marina Stavitskaya Gots. Sponsored by the Chappaqua Drama Group. Saturday, 8:30 P.M. Byram Hills High School. $3.50. Tickets available at door beginning 7:15 P.M. 2384915.

title: Music: Melange
description: The musical smorgasbord that Gunther Schuller spread out at the New York Philharmonic Promenades on Friday evening at Avery Fisher Hall was a provocative sampling of a range and depth in American music that is only beginning to be appreciated, thanks in no small measure to Mr. Schuller's efforts.

title: Truth and Lies About a Composer's Craft
description: Music's the grandest lie. Music's not Truth, but a representation of one aspect of fact which in turn is but one aspect of truth. Possibly truth has no needed tie to fact. In which case, yes, truth approaches music (or vice versa) but only in that generalized befuddled PoloniusBrowning equation of truth and beauty.

title: No Bloodbaths
description: WHEN Democratic District Attorneys were elected in Republican Nassau and Suffolk Counties, many Republicans braced themselves for what they feared would be political bloodbathswidespread indictments of Republican politicians that could have the effect of turning the two counties Democratic.

title: Indiana's Runaway Parent Pursuit Reported Yielding Good Dividends
description: INDIANAPOLIS, June 4 (UPI)  Indiana's runaway parent program has located more than 3,900 missing parents in the last seven months and has collected $4.5 million in support payments from them.

title: Seattle Slew Facing a Rabbit Test in Belmont on Saturday
description: It isn't even 8 A.M. yet, but Seattle Slew's workday has ended.

title: The IvyLeaved Geraniums Are Charmers
description: Ivy geraniums are different. Their faintly scented vines are topped with lovely blossoms and the colors tend toward the pink and lavender end of the spectrum rather than the salmons and oranges. Blossoms come in both single and double types and the foliage is occasionally variegated.

title: Religion Is Still A Potent Force To Armenians
description: GEGARD, U.S.S.R.On summer Sundays Archimandrite Daniel Shamlian has so many children to baptize that he does not have time to eat. He spends virtually his entire day in the ancient stone church here at the center of a small mountain monastery, which draws families from throughout the Armenian Republic, from all levels of society and even from the Communist Party.

title: Hot mustard
description: Combine six tablespoons of powdered mustard in a mixing bowl with three tablespoons beer or water. Add salt to taste. Let stand 20 minutes to develop flavor.

title: Wanted: A Vacation Home. Found: A Greek Idyll
description: I sat in the office of the Greek Consul on East 79th Street in New York City, sipping a tiny, sweet cup of coffee. My business was finished; I now owned a house in Greece, a house I had first seen three years earlier, loved, coveted and unwillingly tried to forget.

title: Lockwood Rescues. EspinosaGrote Singles In Runs
description: Joe Torre looked into Jerry Grote's eyes, and that's how easy it was to manage the Mets' 20 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies yesterday at Shea Stadium.

title: The Wages of Trade
description: The Secretary of Labor, Ray Marshall, wants a global minimum wage of, say, $1 an hour. Before he is laughed off stage as some kind of international demagogue union empire builder let us suggest that he is serious and deserves to be taken seriously.

title: Weequahic Reunion: 31 Years Later
description: THE Class of 1946 at Weequahic High School in Newark held its 31st reunion yesterday at the Cedar Hill Country Club in Livingston. No, not its 30th; its 31st. We had planned to have a 30th, said one of the reunion organizers. We had a meeting and a cocktail party to plan it, and that's as far as we got.

title: Fireworks Employee Killed
description: PASSAIC TOWNSHIP, N.J., June 4An explosion at a fireworks plant in this rural Morris County community yesterday killed a worker and shook homes as far as two miles away. Authorities said Philip Cerulli, 22 years old, of Berkeley Heights, apparently was mixing saltpeter in a barrel shortly before 11 A.M. at the New Vernon Firework Company when the substance exploded, killing him.

title: Roses Are Busting Out All Over
description: JUNE belongs to the roses. This is the month when the gardener is rewarded for all the attention the plants have been given. In spite of the rough winter, the majority of rosebushes came through beautifully, and their buds are bursting with blossoms in all the glorious colors.

title: The Bottle Bill and Tomo Kenyatta
description: IN THE UNLIKELY event that Kenya, in chaste, darkest, unlittered Africa, ever gets into a parliamentary bog over a bottle bill, and decisions need to be made, President Jomo Kenyatta, if he holds true to form, will summon all the members of Parliament to a Councilhouse away from the Parliament building, or to the shade of a spreading thorn tree, and a barazaa long, informal talk.

title: Why All Those Fund Appeals On NonCommercial TV?
description: Some viewers deemed it crass, but no one was too surprised when the Public Broadcasting Service's recent twohour farewell party for the muchadored British series, Upstairs, Downstairs, turned out to be a fundraising telethon.

title: Rev. Daniel F. Lenahan, at 66, A Maryknoll Missionary Priest
description: The Rev. Daniel F. Lenahan, a Brooklynborn Maryknoll missionary priest, died Wednesday of a heart attack in Honolulu. He was 66 years old.

title: Did You Hear the One About the Humor Consultant?
description: Scenes like this sometimes occur at annual meetings: The company's chief executive officer steps stiffly to the microphone and gazes into a frozen sea of stockholders' unsmiling faces. He coughs nervously.

title: Alexander P. Haig Becomes the Fiance Of Wendy A. White
description: The engagement of Wendy Ann White to Alexander Patrick Haig has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Edward C. White of New Canaan, Conn., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is a son of Gen. Alexander Meigs Haig Jr., U.S.A., Commander of North Atlantic Treaty Organization forces, and Mrs. Haig of Mons, Belgium.

title: Elizabeth L. Mirabile Bride of Gerald DiChiara
description: Elizabeth Lucy Mirabile, daughter of State Supreme Court Justice Thomas J. Mirabile and Mrs. Mirabile of Jamaica Estates, Queens, was married yesterday afternoon to Gerald DiChiara, son of Mr. and Mrs. Salvatore DiChiara of Brooklyn.

title: Article 9  No Title
description: workbench

title: Rolla A. Clymer, Kansas Editor, Called Creator of Editorial Page
description: EL DORADO, Kan., June 4 (AP)Rolla A. Clymer, who was the editor of The El Dorado Times for nearly 60 years and was credited by some with being the originator of the editorial page, died today at Allen Memorial Hospital. He was 88 years old.

title: Television This Week
description: Today

title: Article 8  No Title
description: Hummelwerk

title: Women Are Still Absent From Labor's Top Ranks
description: The padlocks are coming off some of the doors that have shut women out of executive suites in the multistoried House of Labor, but the Men Only sign is still firmly in place on the staircase leading to unionism's top floor.

title: The Dance: Primitive Mysteries
description: The most exciting revival of the current season by the Martha Graham Dance Company has been the 1931 Primitive Mysteries. On Friday night at the LuntFontanne Theater, Pearl Lang stepped for the first time into the central role of the figure of the Virgin.

title: DINING OUT
description: THE OLD '76 HOUSE gets a very good rating, but just barely, and mostly for intent and potential rather than for performance. First opened as an inn more than 220 years ago, it has been a restaurant of one sort or another for much of the time since.

title: Tottenville Captures Title In Track for First Time
description: When Downing Stadium on Randalls Island was found to be unfit earlier this spring for the Public Schools. Athletic League track and field championships, Tottenville High School on Staten Island agreed to become host for the meet.

title: Notes: A Russian Violinist Heads West
description: There are two things that I'm very glad about. One is that I was born and educated in Russia; the other is that Russia let me go. Rostilav Dubinsky was talking by phone from Amsterdam, where he has been living since leaving his native land last year. His comments were pertinent because he is coming here next month to be in residence with the Borodin Trio at Sarah Lawrence College in Bronxville.

title: Major League Scores
description: EGeronfrno. OPHouston LOBHouston 7, Cincinnati 9. 28Fergoson, Watson, [Johnson, Bailey. HRHowe (4). SBDriessen, JCruz. SJGonzalez.

title: MIAMI ACTS TUESDAY ON HOMOSEXUAL LAW
description: MIAMI, June 4After four and onehalf months of acrimonious argument, Miami voters will decide Tuesday whether to uphold or repeal a county ordinance that bars discrimination against homosexuals in employment, housing and public accommodations.

title: NEW GUIDELINES PROPOSED ON RELEASE OF NIXON DATA
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (AP)  The General Services Administration is trying rice more to get Congress to approve guidelines for public disclosure of former President Richard M. Nixon's papers and tapes.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The stock market began last week with a whimper and wound up with a bang as a big Friday rally raised both prices and spirits on Wall Street.

title: Rabbi's Wife, Novel's Author
description: EAST HAMPTON RACHEL is the rabbi's wife. She and Rabbi Sunshine live on the Island's North Shore, where Rachel attends to the duties that are those of most rebbetzin. She mothers her children, marches for peace, writes and keeps track of baseball scores. Rachel Sunshine also knows the emotions that go with having a husband who has been discharged by one of his congregations.

title: ABOUT WESTCHESTER
description: Amazing things happened when Myrna Youdelman decided to go underground. Water appeared in the middle of the rocky field where a great financier's horses once frolicked. The barren land was divided into neat 9foot by 12foot plots. Rows of Swiss chard, mustard greens, corn, cauliflower and Brussels sprouts broke through and flourished.

title: 2,000 Protesters Seek U. S. Amnesty For Illegal Aliens
description: Chanting and carrying banners and posters, 2,000 demonstrators marched behind a color guard of Latin American flags in midtown Manhattan yesterday in support of amnesty for millions of aliens living illegally in the United States.

title: If You Buy...
description: Experts advise those in the market for a vacation home abroad to take a rental in the area of their choice and shop around at leisure among local listings. Once you've settled on a house, the nearest American Embassy can recommend a local lawyer to guide you through the intricacies of tax laws and title searches. If the seller is an American, the transaction can, under some circumstances, be made on this side of the Atlantic through the appropriate consulate or an American agency.

title: GARDENING
description: THERE was a time in the not too distant past when home gardeners no longer grew vegetables. To be certain, a few tomatoes were planted for old times' sake or to have them handy, but everyone knew that vegetablegrowing was best left to the specialists in California, Florida or somewhere out in the countryside.

title: A Wary Note on Suburban Watersheds
description: AS AN environmentalist I suppose I should be glad to have an ally in the effort to preserve the thousands of acres of waterutility land in the state that may be classed as surplus and put up for sale. But I could only react with skepticism when Weston Selectman Susan Hutchinson invoked regional openspace and publichealth needs to justify state fund ing of the necessary studies leading to municipal ownership of that land [Opinion Page, May 1].

title: Cornell Rallies to Take Rowing Title
description: SYRACUSE, N.Y., June 4Back in April few paid attention to the Cornell crew, which had six seniors in its varsity boat who could not win a race last year plus a new head coach, Findley Meislahn. The sport seemed to be contracting on the shores of Lake Cayuga, but it all turned around today as the Big Red varsity won the national championship with a blazing finish in the 75th annual Intercollegiate Rowing Association regatta.

title: Kalmbach Suspended From Law Practice
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 4 (AP)Herbert W. Kalmbach, President Nixon's lawyer, who pleaded guilty to a felony in the Watergate scandal, was formally suspended yesterday from the practice of law by the California Supreme Court.

title: News Summary
description: Uganda's Minister of Health, Henry Kyemba, has defected and is seeking refuge in Britain, a Home Office spokesman said in London. The London Sunday Times published what it said was, Mr. Kyemba's full account of murders carried out in Uganda under President Idi Amin. The newspaper article included Mr. Kyemba's account of the death, attributed to President Amin's lust for vengeance, of Dora Bloch, a BritishIsraeli woman who disappeared in Uganda after the Israeli commando raid on Entebbe Airport last July. Archbishop Johan Luwuum and two Cabinet ministers who died last Feb. 16 had been shot at very close range, the account said. [Page 1, Columns 45.1

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: Following are readers responses to A Fair Test for the Concorde, by N.C. Lonnie, publicrelations manager in the United States for British Airways (Opinion Page, May 8]:

title: Invest in Today's Stars, Not Tomorrow's
description: It was with something less than enthusiasm that I greeted the announcement that Sears Roebuck had taken over sponsorship of the Amateur Athletic Union's Junior Olympic sports program. It's fantastic, of course, to see corporate money reaching track, and to hear someone like A. Dean Swift, the Sears president, say, ... support for these training programs should come from industry.

title: BEGIN AIDE WORRIED OVER LIKUD'S IMAGE
description: JERUSALEM, June 4Ezer Weizman, a former commander of the Israeli Air Force, looked with satisfaction at his desktopa smooth gray surface devoid of paperand at his spare, almost empty, office.

title: New San Francisco F.B.I. Chief
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 4 (UP)Charles B. McKinnon, special agent, it charge of the Federal Bureau of Inves??gation office in Cleveland, has been appointed the new head of the San Francisco bureau. Mr. McKinnon, 46 years old, will replace Charles W. Bates, who is to retire June 17.

title: All in the NonNuclear Family
description: MARIN County, Marin County. As that verse from World War II put it, 'Today we have naming of parts. ACLU and the Sierra Club, Motobecane tenspeed and Cuisinart, Birkenstock sandals and Adidas, the Eames chair and the Mitchell brothers brand of documentaryand this is only a limited selection of California pop artifacts from the first few pages of the book. The surface of this collation is all winged thinginess, and the wives meet new husbands at Creative Divorce groups. The household pets are named Kat Vonnegut Jr. and Dog Donald Barthelme. When a woman decides to take a lover, the question is: whose?

title: Gottfried, Vilas Reach French Final
description: PARIS, June 4There is nothing flashy about his strokes or his personality. He drinks Hawaiian Punch instead of wine and rates scrambled eggs and baked beans ahead of crepes.

title: School Board Headquarters Shaken By Beame Commissioner Proposal
description: A new controversy is shaking the structure of the massive headquarters operation that serves as nerve center for the New York City school system.

title: Pacino
description: Serpico? He laughs at the notion and jokes, I'm going to have a party this week, invite them all, and see if it works out.

title: MiddleClass Return Displaces Some Urban Poor
description: WASHINGTON, June 4Bob Corcoran and Beatrice Pointdexter don't know each other, but they are at opposite ends of an intense tugofwar over the fate of America's urban core.

title: Paris Allows Visits To Nuclear Forces By Foreign Press
description: PARIS. June 4In the wake of the Communist Party's sudden abandonment of its longterm opposition to France's nuclear farceand after foreign criticism of the force's effectivenessthe French Defense Ministry has displayed its major weapons to a group of foreign journalists for the first time.

title: A Special Touch
description: HAVING known Alfred Edward Simon for years, it wasn't surprising that he should call after I had interviewed him. I forgot to tell you. You might want to mention that I am the uncle of Carly, Lucy and Joanna Simon.

title: Elizabeth Andrews Wed
description: Elizabeth Phillips Andrews and Richard Charles Reed were married yesterday at the North Congregational Church in Woodbury, Conn., by the Rev. Edgar Barnes.

title: The Tennis Clinic
description: The forehand is the most basic of all the shots in tennis, the cornerstone around which most players build their games.

title: IN POSTGANDHI INDIA, A RESIDUE OF ANGER
description: NEW DELHI, June 3Toward the end of a recent convention of ranking Indian industrialists celebrating the golden jubilee of the Chamber of Commerce, the Communications Minister, George Fernandes, rose to speak. After polite opening remarks about the courage of those businessmen who had opposed the recent authoritarian rule of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, Mr. Fernandes, a bitter enemy of her government, electrified his audience with the sarcastic observation that most of you would have been happy if the dictatorship had succeeded in legitimizine itself.

title: A Spectrum of Art for the Juries at Silvermine
description: ONE of the biggest and most comprehensively representative art shows in New England is the annual juried exhibition at the Silvermine Guild of Artists in New Canaan, which opened yesterday. It is nothing short of gargantuan in size, attracting more than 1,600 entries from not only New England but also New York, Pennsylvania and New Jersey.

title: Deaths
description: AKSELRODSarah, beloved wife of the late Leon, devoted mother of Bernard, David and Emanuel, cherished grandmother of Gustave, Leonard, Michelie and Kenneth. Services Sunday, June 5, 11:30 A.M. The Riverside, 76 Street and Amsterdam Avenue.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: A highlight of the Bowers and Ruddy auction sale that will take place in Los Angeles on June 2022 is the Oak Tree shilling, pictured here, which came from the first mint established in this country. It is Lot Number 3126 (out of a total of 3776) and will come up for bids on Tuesday evening, the 21st. (A fullcolor photograph of this remarkable coin may be seen on page 4 of their June Auction Catalogue, available from Bowers and Ruddy Galleries, 6922 Hollywood Boulevard, Suite 600, Los Angeles, Calif. 90028; $5 by surface mail and $7 by air.)

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodayGlen Head, King's Dairy Farm, Jericho Turnpike, Huntington, L.I. Regular, green, amaturowner, limut, young, nonthoroughbred, maiden and special working hunters; intermediate, amateurowner, novice, junior and special jumpers; ponies, adult horsemanship, equitation. 8:30 A.M.

title: THE STYLE OF THE 70's
description: So far as anything in economics is predictable, its literary expression is on the edge of a fairly major change. That is because what is taught about the structure of modern economic society now teeters rather precariously between the unbelievable and the absurd. And for businessmen, the heads the large corporations in particular, the old orthodoxy is becoming a public relations disaster. Three books on the economics of the oil industry published in the last two years admirably show the shape of the problem. They are Anthony Sampson's The Seven Sisters, the late John Blair's The Control of Oil and, most recently, Robert Engler's The Brotherhood of Oil: Energy Policy and the Public Interest.

title: How I Went To the Festival But Missed All the Movies
description: CANNES There was once a great hooker called The Movies. She was shameless, joyful, amoral and innocently nubile. She took on all comers, the price was right and she didn't give a damn what the straight world of art thought about her. She played to her customers' dreams and exotic fantasies and never tried to develop mind or character. The Hollywood moguls used The Movies perfectly and had her turning more tricks than a bordello on a Pacific island Navy base.

title: Current Affairs
description: AIRBORNE. William F. Buckley. Illustrated by Christopher Buckley. (Macmillan. $12.95.) The columnist's account of a transAtlantic voyage in a 60foot schooner.

title: Children's Books
description: THE NAMES. A Memoir. N. Scott Momaday. (Harper & Row. $10.) Autobiography by the American  Indian Pulitzer Prizewinning novelist and poet.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: IF A HOMEOWNER discovered a hole big enough to throw a football through in one of the outside walls of his house, he would almost certainly take immediate steps to patch or plug this hole one way or another. Yet if that same house is missing most or all of the caulking around the outside windows, doors and other joints in siding or trim, there may be cracks or open seams whose total area could be the equivalent of an opening that is just that large in the outside walls of the house.

title: MOYNIHAN SAYS CITY IS SHORTED ON FUNDS
description: Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan yesterday accused the Federal Government, as well as Congress, of denying New York City its merited share of funds for its huge, financially troubled school system.

title: The Last Hurrah For an Old School
description: ON TUESDAY evening, about 75 students of the Lake Drive School in Mountain Lakes will pose for a class picture outside the old stone schoolhouse to celebrate a reunion and the phasing out of the 63yearold building.

title: Wildlife Units Check Travelers For Contraband
description: With the foreign travel season about to get into full swing, a detail of 60 Federal specialists are braced for the sometimes unpleasant task of having to confiscate souvenirs in large quantities. The specialists are employees of the Interior Department's Fish and Wildlife Service and of the Agriculture Department's Plant Quarantine division. Fish and Wildlife personnel enforce Federal wildlife laws. One important recent feature is the ban on importing anything that falls under the heading of endangered species. Agriculture is interested in keeping diseased plant life out of the country.

title: High Schools Suspended For Girls on Boys' Teams
description: LOS ANGELES, June 4 (AP)All high schools in the city have been suspended from sports competition by the California Interscholastic Federation for permitting girls to play on boys' teams.

title: Sharks at Gulf Coast Island Vanish As Mysteriously as They Arrived
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., June 4As mysteriously as they arrived here three days ago, the sharks disappeared from Padre Island today.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox: Worry Not About Games
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Carey Is Given Hint on Future By Democrats
description: When Governor Carey was booed off the stage at the Brooklyn Democrats' annual dinner the other night, there was more to the message than a simple chance to hoot in the dark at a man who was breaking the political rules by trying to defeat their friendand his onetime supporterMayor Beame. The message was this: Democrats who do not like the Governor are starting to talk quietly about the chances of doing to him when his term expires next year what he is trying to do to Mayor Beame this year.

title: C. J. Coulter 3d Weds Maura P. McGourty
description: Maura Philomene McGourty and Charles James Coulter 3d were married yesterday afternoon in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Joseph the Good Provider in Berlin. Mass.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: TodayDelaware County K.C 47th dog show and obedience trial, Horse Show Grounds. Ludwig Corner, Pa.; 1,5613 dogs; to 7 P.M.

title: Sally G. Damon Is Wed To Roger Turner Upstate
description: Sally Georgia Damon and Roger Dale Turner, who are New York lawyers, were married yesterday in St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Rochester. The Rev. Robert Wainwright performed the ceremony.

title: JOHN JACQUELIN TRASK, 73, OFFICER IN BROKERAGE FIRM
description: John Jacquelin Trask, a partner and vice president of the brokerage firm of Francis I. du Pont & Company from 1941 antil his retirement in 1971, died Friday of emphysema at his home in Stonington, Conn. He was 73 years old.

title: Florida Moves to Combat Fraudulent Practices in the Sale of Solar Energy Equipment
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., June 4The state solar energy agency and the Attorney General's office met this week to discuss programs, apparently among the first in the nation, to protect consumers against purchases of ineffective or fraudulent solar devices.

title: Dr. Jeannette Lee, Dr.P.J.Kenney Wed
description: The Roman Catholic Church of the Assumption in Westport, Conn., was the setting yesterday morning for the marriage of Dr. Jeannette Yen Lee, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Shu Lee of Westport. to Dr. Philip James Kenney, son of Dr. and Mrs.. James t. Kenney of Syracuse.

title: Under the Yoke in Wilton
description: TOM AND JERRY stand passively side by side, chewing constantly and swishing the flies away. Sometimes Jerry swings his head around and gives Tom a lick, and if Tom wanders off, Jerry follows, as if joined by some unseen spirit of togetherness.

title: How to Bake a Wedding Cake
description: JUNE is a bonanza month for brides and bakers. Homemade or customordered, cake and ceremony seem inevitably intertwined. It's the personal touch that people seem to care about today, and the equality of the ingredients, Carole Spence, the proprietor of CreateaCake, said recently as she dispensed advice on bow to bake cakes for virtually any occasion.

title: Diane May Groeneveld Wed
description: Diane May Groeneveld, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David Groeneveld of Warwick, R. I., was married yesterday to Richard Addison Howell, son of Mr. and Mrs. Addison Howell of Elmont, L.I. The Rev. Harold Burchett performed the ceremony in the Quidnessett Baptist Church in North Kingstown, R. I.

title: Latin America Waits Policy Details
description: BUENOS AIRESPresident Carter is making use of a familiar device by which new United States Presidents try to show an interest in the concerns of our neighbors to the south without actually getting directly Involved themselves.

title: If You Go . . .
description: . . . to Prague, you'll need a Czechoslovak visa, obtainable by presenting a valid passport and a completed application form, with two passport photographs, to any Czechoslovak embassy or consulate.

title: Working Papers
description: The Soviet Government has published the draft of a new Constitution, which, like the three that preceded it, will probably have little practical effect on the rights of Soviet citizens or the way their country is governed. But if the existence of a Constitution in a dictatorship seems paradoxical, the new document does reflect changes in the Soviet Union since the time of Stalin and in the way the current occupants of the Kremlin would like to be seen by their people and the rest of the world.

title: Hollis Ann Kimbriel Wed
description: Hollis Ann Kimbriel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Augustus Kimbriel Jr. of Southport, Conn., was married there yesterday in Trinity Episcopal Church, to Charlie Matthew Stroud, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gilbert Stroud of Dallas. The Rev. Ray Averett Jr., assisted by the Rev. Mills Omaly of Pleasant Valley, N.Y., performed the ??remony.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Around the Nation
description: TAMPA, Fla., June 4 (UPI) When a heavy thunderstorm cut short a Led Zeppelin rock concert last night, thousands of people in the audience at Tampa Stadium rioted. Scores of police officers and fans were injured, and at least 20 persons were arrested.

title: Counterculture Capitalists
description: The advertisement announcing the opening of a School for Entrepreneurs appeared in a counterculture magazine called New Age, and it ran only once. The need for a new breed of entrepreneurs is transparently clear, wrote Robert Schwartz, chairman of the Tarrytown House Executive Conference Center, and he invited the readers of the ad to enroll in the threeweek course for $400.

description: Bringing down the curtain on the 1977 Indianapolis 500:
