title: Congressional Official Asserts Insulation of Houses Is Good Investment, Even Without Tax Credit Plan
description: WASHINGTON, June 6Alice M. Rivlin, director of the Congressional Budget Office, told the House Ways and Means Committee today that, even without a proposed Federal tax credit, insulating a house is already a good investment.

title: Carter Pleased With His Family And Presidency
description: WASHINGTON june 6  President Carter pronounced himself satisfied today with his family's diplomatic skills, with his own success with Congress and with his daughter's table manners. He expressed displeasure, however, that she had not invited him to a White House movie showing last night.

title: Yankees Box Score
description: EHargrove. DPYankees 2, Texas 2. LOBYankees 6, Texas 4. 2BD. May, C. May, Rivers, Randolph, Hargrove. HRJackson 2, (11), Randolph (2).

title: Events Today
description: THE MARCH ON PARIS 1914. . . OF GENERAL OBERST ALEXANDER VON KLUCK AND HIS MEMORY OF JESSIE HOLLADAY, by Walter Gutman, at the Whitney Museum of American Art.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Federal Trade Commission yesterday accused Sunkist Growers Inc., a marketing cooperative, of monopolizing the citrus business in the western United States through anticompetitive methods.

title: Brezhnev Trip to Paris Discussed
description: MOSCOW, June 6 (Reuters)Final preparations for the trip to Paris this month by Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist Party chief, were discussed today at a meeting between the French Foreign Minister, Louis de Guiringuad, and the Soviet Foreign Minister, Andrei A. Gromyko. French sources said they understood that finishing touches were being put to two documents to be signed during Mr. Brezhnev's visit. One reportedly deals with general political questions and the other with trade.

title: Adults Electronic Toys: Gamble With High Stakes
description: CHICAGO, June 6We take fun seriously is a slogan being used by Atari Inc., a leading manufacturer of television games, at the 12th annual summer Consumer Electronics Show here.

title: CORRECTION
description: Karl J. Niklas, a paleobotanist at the New York Botanical Garden, was incorrectly identified in The Times yesterday as administrator of the garden's Harding Research Laboratory. David E, Giannasi is the administrator.

title: Korean Lobby Said to Involve U.S. CoverUp
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Justice Department has expanded its investigation into the allegedly illegal Korean lobbying effort to determine whether it was deliberately covered up by senior United States Government officials, according to sources knowledgeable about the inquiry.

title: The Standings
description: Tuesday, June 7, 1977

title: HAROLD G. ISRAELSON, LABOR MEDIATOR, DIES
description: Harold G. Israelson, one of the city's most respected mediators and a prominent labor lawyer, died yesterday at University Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 1130 Park Avenue.

title: About New York
description: It is not that you can't go home again to Brooklyn. It's that, once you're there, you can't seem to get back on the Cyclone roller coaster.

title: Peruvian's Hearing On Residency Put Off
description: A hearing scheduled for today on permanent resident status for Isabel Carrasco, a 13yearold Peruvian facing possible deportation as an illegal alien, was postponed yesterday for a week.

title: House Panel Votes to Let Strikers Continue Getting Food Stamps
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI)The House Agriculture Committee, reversing a stand taken last year, voted today to allow strikers to continue getting food stamps if they meet income tests and their assets do not exceed Federal standards.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BIG APPLE ORCHARD City as Theater is the current series of free forums on the drama of life in New York, conducted by experts in a particular field. Audience participation is encouraged in the Tuesday sessions at 7:30 P.M. at the sponsoring Institute for Architecture and Urban Studies, 8 West 40th Street (top floor).

title: Notes on People
description: The Council of Churches of the City of New York announced yesterday that President Carter would receive its 1977 Family of Man Gold Medallion. Dr. Kenneth L Folkes, president of the council, said the President would be honored because coming to the Presidency at this important juncture in history, Mr. Carter has brought new hope to all mankind, both at home and abroad, and especially has he lifted the aspirations of the underprivileged. Past recipients of the award have included Presidents Dwight D. Eisenhower, John F. Kennedy, Lyndon B. Johnson and Gerald R. Ford.

title: Galindez Title Bout Off
description: JOHANNESBURG, June 6 (UPI)The scheduled World Boxing Association lightheavyweight title bout between the champion, Victor Galindez of Argentina, and Richie Kates of the United States has been canceled, Wilf Garforth, chairman of the Transvaal Province Boxing Board of Control, said today. Garforth said the June 18 fight was called off because Galindez had not signed a contract yet.

title: Second Letter From .44 Slayer Has Police Chasing 4 Nicknames
description: The special police unit investigating the killer who calls himself Son of Sam was striving yesterday to find the source of four bizarre nicknames the killer used in a second letter.

title: Carey Lists the Projects He Would Like to See Benefit Under His DevelopmentBond Plan
description: ALBANY, June 6Governor Carey today released a list of 776 projects he would like to see benefit from his proposed $750 million economicdevelopment bond issue.

title: Television
description: 5:00(4)TODAY: Coverage of the festivities in London to celebrate the silver anniversary of Queen Elizabeth 11's reign, including the procession to St. Paul's Cathedral; the Queen's walk to the Guildhall

title: INSTALLMENT CREDIT CLIMBED FOR APRIL ON BIG GAIN IN AUTOS
description: WASHINGTON,June 6 (AP)Consumers continued installment borrowing at near record levels in April, raising their outstanding credit by $2.66 billion, the Federal Reserve said today.

title: 3 STEEL UNITS INDICTED BY FED FOR PRICE FIXING
description: WASHINGTON, June 6(AP)A Federal Grand Jury indicted three steel companies today on charges of fixing prices for reinforcing steel bars sold in western Missouri and Kansas from 1963 to 1972.

title: U. S. TO PRESS SOVIET ON HELSINKI ACCORDS
description: WASHINGTON, June 6Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that the United States, at an EastWest review conference later this year, would urge the Soviet Union and its allies to carry out all provisions of the Helsinki accords, including the controversial human rights clauses.

title: Vance Expects to Travel to China During the Second Half of August
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (Reuters)Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance expects to visit China in the second half of August, the State Department said today.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, JUNE 7, 1977

title: A Look at How Women Have Bowed to Fashion's Demands
description: Women have, over the last couple of hundred years, adapted the shapes of their bodies as well as their stances to the demands of fashion.

title: DECLINE IN UNFIXED RATES CONTINUES, S.E.C. REPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Securities and Exchange Commission said today that commission rates on stocks, unfixed since May 1975, continued to decline during the fourth quarter of last year and now stand at an average 15.7 percent below the level that prevailed before the agency ordered free competition among brokers

title: Article 3
description: Article 3  No Title

title: PEDIATRICIAN SLAIN OUTSIDE OF HOSPITAL
description: A 39yearold pediatrician on his way to work at Kings County Hospital in Brooklyn was fatally stabbed in a parking lot of the sprawling medical complex yesterday afternoon by one of three youths who accosted him in an apparent robbery attempt, the police said.

title: 2 New TaxExempt Bond Issues Sold to Yield Less Than Expected
description: Taxexemptbond dealers, preparing to handle this week's heavy volume of new issues, showed little inclination yesterday to raise yields to attract investors, Two new issues$150 million of Georgia Municipal Electric Authority bonds and $24

title: On Parade: The Taste and Nonsmell of UnFood
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 6The 37th annual meeting of the Institute of Food Technologists opened here last night with 240 exhibitors displaying their wares in an atmosphere that some visitors found disturbingly free of any food smells whatever.

title: ALBANY PASSES RULES ON LAS VEGAS NIGHTS
description: ALBANY, June 6The Legislature gave final approval today to liberalized rules for the conduct of Las Vegas Nights at which religious and charitable organizations can raise money through games of chance.

title: S.E.C. VIOLATIONS LAID TO FOREST AND 4 AIDES
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged Forest Laboratories Inc. and four officials with numerous securities violations, including overstating the company's revenues by about $4 million over a 12year period.

title: Coal Cars Roll Into River
description: ROCHESTER, June 6 (AP)At least three cars loaded with coal rolled down a railroad track and plunged into the Genesee River today, blocking the east channel of Rochester Harbor.

title: DR. I. M. TARLOV, AT 72, TAUGHT NEUROSURGERY
description: Dr. I. M. Tarlov, a former professor of neurology and neurosurgery at New York Medical College, died Saturday at his Nantucket, Mass., home. He was 72 years old.

title: Summary of the Actions Taken by the United States Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: High Court Backs Opening of Mail On Suspicion of Customs Agents
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Supreme Court held today, by a vote of 6 to 3, that inspectors for the Federal Customs Service looking for contraband may open man from abroad without first getting search warrants if they have first complied with Federal law and regulations regarding such searches.

title: I.R.S.: No Inquiry On Amateur Sports
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI)The Internal Revenue Service denied today that it had started an investigation into underthetable income allegedly received by some of the nation's top amateur athletes.

title: High Tides Around New York
description: For high tide at Asbury Park and Belmar, deduct 34 min. from Sandy Hook time.

title: New York Death Penalty Is Similar to Louisiana's
description: New York's death penalty statute is similar, but not identical, to the Louisiana law struck down yesterday by the Supreme Court. However, few lawyers familiar with the statutes felt the differences were constitutionally significant.

title: Court Decides Against F.T.C., Backs TennecoMonroe Merger
description: Tenneco Inc., a Houstonbased petroleum and industrial conglomerate, and the Monroe Auto Equipment Company announced yesterday that a Federal Trade Commission motion to block the $182.5 million acquisition of Monroe by Tenneco had been denied by the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia. The commission's motion for an injunction pending appeal, denied by the court on Friday, was the latest F.T.C. effort to delay the merger on the ground that it would cut competition in the auto parts market. The motion was made after the District Court denied the agency's initial bid for a preliminary injunction on May 23.

title: Dutch Seek to Improve Status of South Moluccans
description: ASSEN, the Netherlands,June 6The Government announced today that it was consulting with leaders of the South Moluccan community to seek improvements in the status of the group in the Netherlands.

title: Tax Curb Supported For Some in Congress
description: WASHINGTON,June 6 (UPI)Members of Congress, except those representing Virginia, Maryland and the District of Columbia, would be exempted from taxes by Washingtonarea governments under a bill approved today in the House.

title: Engagements
description: UsbayGoldsmith

title: New York City and Board of Education Are Reported Near Accord on Suit Over Budget
description: The Board of Education and New York City are preparing to settle the board's suit against the city for $12 millionless than the board had sought but more than the city's last offerofficials close to the discussions said yesterday.

title: Apples Lose; Evert, King Draw 13,675
description: A pair of 22yearold expert racquet wieldersChris Evert and Butch Walts led the Phoenix Racquets to a 2724 victory over the New York Apples last night before a crowd of 13,675 at Madison Square Garden. The turnout was the largest in the fouryear history of World Team Tennis.

title: SEYCHELLES CAPITAL IS CALM AFTER COUP
description: VICTORIA, Seychelles, June 6Thirty hours after the Government of this idyllic Indian Ocean archipelago was overthrown, a sense of calm prevails. But there is also a sense of mystery about who the plotters were.

title: Books of The Times
description: In an age of specialization, only a handful of historians is capable of crisscrossing time and the centuries as if the world itself was their field. In The Empire of Reason, Henry Steele Cornmager goes beyond his knowledge of the American Republic into the trickier realm of ideas summed up in the subtitle: How Europe Imagined and America Realized the Enlightenment. It is his most brilliant work  in conception, in the crystalline clarity of the writing, in causing explosions in the reader's mind.

title: 12 New York State Auto Insurers Given Rate Rises of 3.7% to 32.8%
description: The New York State Insurance Department has granted auto insurance rate increases to 12 companies, including an average 19 percent increase to State Farm, the second largest insurer in the state. which covers 433,000 cars.

title: 100 Bonfires Mark Elizabeth's Jubilee
description: LONDON, June 6Queen Elizabeth II inaugurated a weeklong celebration of her silver jubilee on the British throne tonight by lighting a 30foot bonfire on a hill near Windsor Castle.

title: Navy to Resume Its Dredging Of Groton Submarine Channel
description: GROTON, Con?., June 6 (AP)  The Navy said today it planned to resume a controversial dredging project on June 15 under the terms of an agreement reached in court with environmentalist opponents.

title: Resources Survey Voted
description: WASHINGTON,June 6(AP)  The House passed and sent to the Senate today a measure requiring the Agriculture Department to regularly take stock of the nation's soil and water resources and develop a conservation program for them. The vote was 365 to 16.

title: H. Clifton Whiteman Marries Joan Coffin Leib
description: Joan Coffin Leib was married yesterterday to H. Clifton Whiteman, president of the Bowery Savings Bank. The ceremony was performed in the chapel of St. James Episcopal Church by the, rector, the Rev. Hays H. Rockwell. There was a reception at the River Club.

title: ExRCA Executive Conrad Fails 2d Time to Heed Tax Summons
description: Anthony L. Conrad, who resigned last Sept. 16 as chief executive of the RCA Corporation after acknowledging failure to file Federal, state or local income taxes for five years through 1975, failed yesterday for the second time to appear at his arraignment in Manhattan Criminal Court on criminal charges brought by the State of New York.

title: NEW CARTER POLICY MAY REQUIRE BUSING TO GET SCHOOL FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Carter Administration, in a reversal of the Ford Administration's position, has determined that it is legal, in some circumstances, for the Government to withhold funds from school districts that refuse to merge black and white schools to facilitate desegregation.

description: CIUDAD GUAYANA, VenezuelaI mean, nobody has ever put in four million tons of steel in one shot before, said Kenneth Miller, an American engineer.

title: Divers Seeking Youth Drowned While Boating With Moon's Son
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 6Divers were searching channels into Lord Tivoli Bay on the grounds of the Barrytown Seminary of the Unification Church today for the body of a 17yearold boy who apparently drowned in a boating accident over the weekend.

title: Saudi Oil Prices Expected to Rise 3 to 5% This Year
description: WASHINGTON, June 6Saudi Arabia appears virtually certain to raise its oil prices between now and the end of the year in an effort to erase a pricing division within the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries.

title: Today's Primary Election for Governor
description: Voters will choose the Democratic and Republican candidates for Governor, the candidates for 80 seats in the State Assembly and 40 in the State Senate, and candidates for county posts.

title: CORRECTION
description: Karl J. Niklas, a paleobotanist at the New York Botanical Garden, was in correctly identified in The Times yesterday as administrator of the garden's Harding Research Laboratory. David E. Giannasi is the administrator.

title: Congo Foreign Minister Says U.S. Has Agreed to Resume Relations
description: BONN, June 6 (Reuters)The United States and Congo have agreed to resume diplomatic relations broken off in 1965, Foreign Minister Theophile Obenga of Congo said today.

title: DOW DROPS BY 9.16; INFLATION WORRIES, PRIME AND OIL CITED
description: A worryprone stock market retreated sharply yesterday, erasing last Friday's big gain, while movierelated issues continued to attract buying.

title: New Yorkers Volunteer to Maintain Parks
description: Distressed by rampant vandalism in their neighborhood parks and aware that efforts by fisically strained New York City to revitalize the parks almost certainly will fall short of announced goals, New Yorkers in increasing numbers are volunteering their help to maintain the parks for another summer.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: The search for a public accounting firm to conduct the enormous, pathbreaking initial audit of New York Citys financial books and records has narrowed to two firms, and the selection may be made by the end of the week, according to John C. (Sandy) Burton, Deputy Mayor for Finance.

title: 4 Canadiens on N.H.L. AllStars; Denis Potvin Makes Second Team
description: MONTREAL, June 6The Montreal Canadiens, who overpowered the rest of the National Hockey League last season, took the main honors today as the league announced its AllStar teams.

title: New Jersey Lottery Chairman
description: The fivemember New Jersey Lottery Commission unanimously elected Reese Palley, an Atlantic City art dealer, as its new chairman in a meeting in Trenton yesterday. Mr. Palley, who was named to the commission by Governor Byrne in 1975, is one of the new owners of the MarlboroughBlenheim Hotel in Atlantic City, which plans to apply for a gambling casino license.

title: As If the Super Bowl Were in the U.N.
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md.Like Gulliver held captive by the Lilliputians, the United States and other powers are seeing their influence eroded by the rapid proliferation of tiny Contries and the remolding of the world community.

title: The Queen Is Honored In Old North Church
description: BOSTON, June 6 (UPI)In the Old North Church, where colonists plotted against her ancestors two centuries ago, the strains of God Save the Queen rang out yesterday to mark the Silver Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II of England.

title: House Votes to Spend $3.5 Billion On Construction at Military Bases
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI)The House approved a $3.5 billion measure today authorizing construction at military bases at home and abroad that included $130.7 million to increase security at nuclear and special weapons sites. The vote was 351 to 24, sending the measure to the Senate.

title: The Continuing Strong Pace Of Spending by Consumers
description: Of the score of major economic indicators that regularly pour out of Washington, the most closely watched for the rest of 1977 are likely to be those that most closely affect the consumer and register his reactions in the

title: DOMESTIC SECURITY CASES DROP SHARPLY, F.B.I. SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP)Carter Administration officials told Congress today that the number of inquiries by the Federal Bureau of Investigation into domestic security, cases, including terrorist activities, had dropped to 214 from 4,868 under new bureau guidelines.

title: Obscenity Finding Is Linked to Ads
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Supreme Court ruled today that the kind of advertising and promotion given sexually oriented motion pictures can properly affect'a jury's judgment of whether the films themselves are obscene.

title: End Of Term
description: The headmaster sends final reports to the parents:

title: U.S. BRIEF OPPOSES PORT AUTHORITY BAN ON CONCORDE FLIGHT
description: The Carter Administration urged a Federal appeals court yesterday to rule out the ban by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey on test flights of the supersonic Concorde airliner, declaring that the agency's actions had been unfair, dilatory, arbitrary and unreasonable.

title: Blacks and Whites Found to Have Misapprehensions on Impact of Roots
description: Sociologists examining the impact of the television series Roots on black and white viewers have concluded that viewers of both races thought the programs would have effects on the other that it did not have.

title: Anita Bryant's Crusade
description: Anita Bryant and her Save Our Children Inc. are doing the 20 million lesbians and gay men in America an enormous favor: They are focusing for the public the nature of the prejudice and discrimination we face.

title: Dollar Is Steady In Trade Abroad; Gold Closes Ahead
description: LONDON, June 6 (AP)The dollar ended nearly unchanged on Europe's currency markets today, and gold finished the day at $143.125 an ounce at Zurich, up from Friday's $141.875.

title: U.S. Communists Visit Cuba
description: HAVANA, June 6 (Agence FrancePresse)Three United States Communist Party leaders arrived here last night for talks with Cuban leaders, the Cuban party newspaper, Gramma, reported today. They are Arnold Becchetti, the national secretary, and Simon Gelson and Lorenzo Torres, both central committee members.

title: Haideman Joins Mitchell as Court Sets Prison Date
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP)In a fourminute ceremony, with Watergate never mentioned, H. R. Haldeman and John N. Mitchell were ordered today to begin serving their prison terms by noon on June 22 for their role in conspiring to cover up the historic burglary.

title: Dealing With Grief for a Lost One May Often Prompt Fantasies of a Reunion
description: You know it's irrational. But you can't stop the fantasies. You keep imagining that a dead spouse has returned. Or that a divorced end now remarried spouse will come back into your life. It doesn't make any sense, does it?

title: Sir John Masterman, 86, Director of World War II System of Double Agents
description: LONDON, June 6 (Reuters)Sir John Cecil Masterman, who engineered a largescale takeover of the World War II German spy system by British agents, died today. He was 86 years old.

title: Jane Sherry, 41, Who Managed Movie Stars, in Los Angeles
description: Jane Oliver Sherry, a motion picture and television agent and personal manager, died of cancer Saturday at Cedars of Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles. She was 41 years old and a resident of Beverly Hills. Calif.

title: BAR GROUP EXPLAINS RATING FOR NADJARI
description: The judiciary committee of Queens County Bar Association, in a report made public yesterday, said Maurice H. Nadjari was unqualified to be Queens District Attorney because he had seriously. abused the public trust placed in him, as special state prosecutor.

title: Advertising
description: A dramatic testimonial to the impact of advertising and special product displays on supermarket sales is contained is a study released yesterday by the Point of Purchase Advertising Institute and E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Company,

title: Sentences To Fit The Crime
description: The Senate Judiciary Committee is about to begin hearings on a bill that would all but eliminate the parole system, with its demonstrated inequities, while providing an innovative means of giving fixed but fair sentences to Federal criminal offenders.

title: Veterans Are Guests At DDay Ceremonies
description: ST. MEREEGLISE, France, June 6 (UPI)American World War II veterans who took part in the Normandy landing on DDay 33 years ago were guests of honor at commemorative ceremonies today.

title: Remains of 22 Missing in Vietnam Will Not Reach U.S. Until August
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI)The chairman of a House committee on United States servicemen missing in Southeast Asia said today that the remains of 22 Americans to be returned by Vietnam would not reach this country until August at the earliest.

title: HOUSE MEASURE IS AIMED AT AIDING CROP AGENCY
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP)  The House completed Congressional action today on a measure to rescue temporarily the technically bankrupt Federal Crop Insurance Corporation by increasing its capita] stock by $50 million.

title: 2 LIVELY RACES TODAY IN PRIMARY IN JERSEY
description: Candidates for the Democratic and Republican gubernatorial nominations in New Jersey spent their final primary campaign moments yesterday looking for the few votes they believed could mean the difference today in what is likely to be the two close contests.

title: Korean Lobby Said to Involve U.S CoverUp
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Justice Department has expanded its investigation into the allegedly illegal Korean lobbying effort to determine whether it was deliberately covered up by senior United States Government officials, according to sources knowledgeable about the inquiry.

title: Cautious Kissinger and Outspoken Young: Both Approaches to Africa Left Commitments Unspecified
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, June 6Andrew Young's recent African trip came exactly a year after a visit there by Henry A. Kissinger, and while the differences between the missions delineated the contours of emerging American policies for Africa,

title: Two Sides in Middle East Speak Casually of a War As Stress Shifts From Political to Military Solution
description: LONDON, June 6A general deterioration in the political situation and, in consequence, increased emphasis on military options are apparent on both the Arab and Israeli sides in the Middle East.

title: State Finds No Radioactivity in AtomPlant Spill
description: TRENTON, June 6State officials said today there were no indications that any radioactive material had escaped into the environment as the result of a minor accident at the Salem One nucleargenerating plant in Lower Alloways Creek Township. The incident caused the immediate shutdown of the facility.

title: WILLIAM K. DOGGETT
description: William K. Doggett, a retired banker, died Sunday at Cape Cod Hospital in Hyannis, Mass. He was 83 years old and lived an Chatham. Mass.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Article 6  No Title

title: Dividends
description: MONDAY, JUNE 6, 1977

title: Diver Hurt at Great Adventure
description: JACKSON, N.J., June 6 (UPI)A member of the divingexhibition team at Great Adventure amusement park was injured yesterday in a practice dive from a 10meter board. A park spokesman said James Boring of the Great American High Diving Show was admitted to Freehold Area Hospital for observation.

title: Texas Ranger Hall of Fame Shows History of Entire State
description: WACO, Tex., June 2A decade after their controversial involvement in bloody farm workers strike produced official suggestions that they ought to be done away with, the Texas Rangers are still around. And it is beginning to look as though, in the words of one of their favorite aphorisms, As long as there is a Texas, there will be a Texas Ranger.

title: International Olympic Committee Ordered to Appear in Satra Suit
description: The Satra Corporation, which filed a $275 million lawsuit against the National Broadcasting Company Inc., over the rights to broadcast the 1980 summer Olympics in Moscow, yesterday obtained a court order requiring an executive of the International Olympic Committee to appear in New York or else risk default.

title: Shipping Bureau Buys New Offices
description: Mayor Beanie announced that the American Bureau of Shipping, the world's largest ship classification organization, has purchased the former headquarters of the American Express Company at 65 Broadway. The bureau, which has 500 employees, is now at 45 Broad Street.

title: Albany Votes Ban on Topless Bars
description: ALBANY, June 6The Legislature tonight voted to ban topless entertainment i nbars, an action the State Liquor Authority refused to take on its own last year. The measure approved tonight would authorize the Liquor Authority to suspend or revoke the license of any establishment that allowed its female employees to appear topless or that features topless entertainment.

title: Curtains Up and Down
description: William Shakespeare is better known as the creator of Hamlet than for his contributions to the London tourist trade in Elizabethan times. There is, nevertheless, a strong tie between live theater performances and the willingness of the population to spend money on travel and on eating and drinking to celebrate the occasion. Providentially, the growing dinginess of the New York theatrical districta phenomenon that has been noticeable for at least fifty yearshas not totally blighted Broadway's attraction for tourists. So concludes William Baumol, of Princeton and New York University, who took advantage of a threeweek strike of theater musicians in 1975 to measure the relationship between theatergoing and the patronage it affords related enterprises.

title: NEW CARTER POLICY MAY REQUIRE BUSING TO GET SCHOOL FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Carter Administration, in a reversal of the Ford Administration's position, has determined that it is legal, in some circumstances, for the Government to withhold funds from school districts that refuse to merge black and white schools to facilitate desegregation.

title: Recital:Delphine Brownlee Sings
description: Delphine Brownlee, a soprano with considerable experience on Broadway and in opera, gave a recital in Carnegie Recital Hall on Sunday night that raised serious doubts as to the state of her voice and her affinity for the artsong genre. Her choice of such virtuoso items as Jauchzet Gott in allen Landen from Bach's Cantata No. 51 was clearly misguided, bravura vocalism not being one of her strong points and a flexible, clarion tone being beyond her reach. But the heavily dramatic declamation of Barber's Andromache's Farewell, at the opposite end of the technical scale, proved equally unsatisfactory. Either Miss Brownlee was temporarily out of voice or she is in trouble.

title: The Mays (Lee, Rudy) Lead Orioles to Victory
description: When the Baltimore Orioles arrived at Milwaukee's County Stadium last night for the opener of their twogame series with the Brewers they produced an invasion of their own to coincide with the 33d anniversary of DDay, the World War II allied invasion of France.

title: Sisco Meets Chinese Official
description: TOKYO, June 6 (AP)The Chinese Foreign Minister, Huang Hua, had a friendly talk in Peking today with Joseph Sisco, a former Under Secretary of State who is now president of American University, the official Chinese press agency, Hshinhua, reported. The broadcast, monitored in Tokyo, did not say what was discussed.

title: Fire Damages 9 Bronx Stores
description: A fire that swept through nine singlestory stores in the Bronx early yesterday caused extensive damage but only two minor injuries to firemen. A spokesman for the Fire Department said it could not be determined how the fire started in the row of stores at East 170th Street at Grant Avenue in the Morrisania section.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, June 6A special emergency program for monitoring the state's 127 miles of Atlantic Ocean beaches, with an early warning system for potential threats of fish kills or deposits of trash and sewage, goes into effect this week in a joint effort by the state and Federal Governments to safeguard swimmers and tourists from polluted water.

title: Comoros Deny Coup Attempt
description: MORONI, Comoro Islands, June 6 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Government today denied Western radio reports that there had been a coup attempt against President Ali Soilih. An official statement said the reports had misinterpreted a broadcast describing a debate within the ruling People's National Committee, in which four members had been accused of ideological opportunism.

title: Saudi Oil Prices Expected to Rise 3 to 5% This Year
description: WASHINGTON, June 6Saudi Arabia appears virtually certain to raise its oil prices between now and the end of the year in an effort to erase a pricing division within the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries.

title: An Unlikely Celebrity Scoffs At Commercialism
description: After George Willig's, walk up the side of the 1,350foot South Tower of the World Trade Center last May 26, a television news reporter looked him in the eye and asked, What's your angle. anyhow?

title: Billy Taylor Brings His Trio To Symphony
description: The obvious and familiar peril of music that combines a jazz combo with a symphony orchestra is that of creating a stylistic hybrid compromising the integrity of both components. Billy Taylor's Suite for Jazz Piano and Orchestra, performed Sunday night at Alice Tully Hall by Mr. Taylor's trio and the New York City Housing Authority Symphony Orchestra, strives more ambitiously for an integrated idiom than many such works, but the inherent problems are not surmounted.

title: STEEL OUTPUT OFF 1.9% AFTER AN 8WEEK RISE
description: Steel production in the week ended June 4 fell 1.9 percent from the preceding week's output, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. The decline, which was traced to the Memorial Day holiday, followed eight consecutive weeks of production gains.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: POPLAR BRANCH, N.C.  Largemouth bass were breaking water in pursuit of tiny minnows all about us, but for the most part they ignored the flies, popping bugs and lures we offered them for five hours in the morning.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: Article 7  No Title

title: Market Place
description: Motorola Inc., the dominant worldwide producer of portable communications equipment, may soon face new competition in this, its most important, market, and its stock has been dropping sharply over the prospect.

title: Uganda Says Amin Is Going to England
description: NAIROBI, Kenya June 6 (Reuters)The Uganda radio, quoting a reliable source, said tonight that President Idi Amin would leave by special plane tomorrow to attend the Commonwealth conference in London.

title: Palmer and Open: Qualified Maybe
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., June 6 (UPI) Arnold Palmer seems to have passed the qualifying procedure for the United States Open golf tournamentbut he won't know for sure until tomorrow. The 47yearold Palmer, winner of 61 tour events, played two qualifying rounds today and had a 36hole total of 142.

title: CARTER TO PROPOSE ABOLITION OF PAROLE
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Carter Administration will propose tomorrow a major change in Federal criminal justice policy, supporting abolition of parole for convicts, an aide to Attorney General Griffin B. Bell said today.

title: Authors Urge the Government To Curb Mergers in Publishing
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI)Authors led by John Hersey and Herman Wouk urged the Government today to halt the sinister process of conglomerate takeover and mergers in publishing. They said the trend was sacrificing quality in writing to maximize profits.

title: Joan Mondale Dedicates Art Works
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 6 (AP)Joan Mondale, the Vice President's wife, visited here today to dedicate four American works commissioned to beautify new Federal buildings. Mrs. Mondale's itinerary, which included tours of the city's museums and art galleries, was billed as a celebration of Buildings. Art and People.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Early in Bill Walton's second season with the Portland Trail Blazers, he was asked to assess his career that had been hounded by injuries.

title: Hui Ying Liu Plays Piano Fluently
description: Hui ding Liu, a young ChineseAmerican pianist who gave a wellreceived New York debut last season in Carnegie Recital Hall, returned there for a second concert late Sunday afternoon. Her program encompassed a wide range of styles, and Miss Liu polished off each piece with technical fluency, digital accuracy and poised selfassurance to spare.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Oil Burner, World Record Pacer, Draws $2.7 Million in Syndication
description: Oil Burner, who as a 3yearold matched the world pacing record of 1:54  for the mile, has been syndicated by Alan J. Leavitt, president of Lana Lobell Farms, Hanover, Pa., for $2.7 million. According to the United

title: An Energy Czar Without Power
description: Congress is about to create an Energy Department but without the authority to set natural gas prices. That spells enduring trouble for the President's energy program, for without the power to regulate the price of gas, the new agency simply cannot do its job.

title: Judy Jarvis's Dance Imagery Is Surrealistic
description: Judy Jarvis has a theatrical imagination, but very little choreographic facility. The program of her works at the Theater of Riverside Church on Sunday was static to the point of tedium. Tableaux succeeded tableaux, and while they had some initial interest pictorially all tended to be boringly repetitive.

title: Turkish Opposition Wins Election Few Seats Short of a Majority
description: ANKARA, Turkey, June 6The party of former Prime Minister Bulent Ecevit, who ordered the Turkish invasion of Cyprus in 1974, has emerged from yesterday's general election with close to a majority in Parliament.

title: Mandatory Death of Police Killers Barred by Supreme Court, 5 to 4
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Supreme Court ruled 5to4 today that states may not make the death penalty the mandatory, automatic punishment for anyone convicted of murdering a police officer.

title: Welfare Reform, but Not Alone
description: As President Carter's welfare package takes shape, it presents immediate problems, one of which is fundamental. Sweeping change without additional spending produces winners and losers; attention will focus on the latter. The homeless and hungry may average out in statistical tables, but are not readily overlooked by Congressmen.

title: Topics
description: High Design

title: Time to Settle Coop City Dispute Is Extended Again
description: The deadline for reaching an agreement in the protracted financial dispute involving the huge Coop City housing project in the Bronx has been postponed once morefrom tomorrow until June 30as project leaders and state officials continue negotiations.

title: Debate Opening Today in Quebec On Controversial Language Curbs
description: MONTREAL, June 6A debate opens tomorrow in the Quebec Assembly on how far to go to make French virtually the only language of this Canadian province.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, JUNE 7, 1977

title: Ohio School Forced To Reopen Despite Six Deaths in Fire
description: JACKSONBURG, Ohio, June 6 (AP)The law has overruled an attempt to close, as an emotional tribute, the Wayne Elementary School, which lost six of its 18 employees in last month's fire at a Kentucky supper club.

title: O'Donnell, in Albany Ever Since the Governorship of Dewey, Resigns as Aide to Carey
description: ALBANY, June 6Harry J. O'Donnell, whose Albany career has spanned four Governors across the lines of party and generation, resigned today as Governor Carey's director of communications.

title: The Trend in France
description: Three years of recession and the worst unemployment since the Thirties are swinging France leftward toward a government with ministers from a Communist Party that has only recently and unconvincingly renounced its Stalinist path. The 52 percent vote rung up by the CommunistSocialist Union of the Left in municipal elections two months ago has risen to 56 percent in recent polls. The stock market is sagging. Capital is leaving the country in increasing amounts. The malaise has dried up investment, complicating President Giscard dEstaing's efforts to spur recovery before the next parliamentary election, which must be held by March.

title: YOUNG BACKING OFF ON 'RACIST' CHARGE
description: WASHINGTON, June 6Andrew Young said today that, in describing Gerald R. Ford and Richard M. Nixon as racists, I certainly didn't mean anything derogatory about the personal lives of either.

title: U.S. SEEKS NEW TALKS ON CYPRUS PROBLEM
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The Carter Administration is preparing to make another push to mediate a solution of the Cyprus problem this summer, a highranking Administration official said today.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: Article 8  No Title

title: Lively Baseballs Pass Tests
description: There really is more life in this year's baseballs. Scientific tests confirmed that the coefficient of restitution of the balls used in the major leagues this year is up 1.3 percent over last year.

title: McAdoo On List of Free Agents
description: Fiftyseven National Basketball Association players were listed as free agents yesterday, a result of the 1976 settlement of the Oscar Robertson lawsuit that eliminated the option clause from the contracts of established players. The players were immediately eligible to sign with any of the 22 teams in the league.

title: Wives and Friends Are Now as Much Part Of the Tennis Tour as Agents and Lawyers
description: PARIS, June 6It was to be a quiet dinner among doubles partners to celebrate their victory in the French open tennis championships. But Melissa Roan, a friend of Raul Ramirez, could not resist teasing Brian Gottfried, casually dropping a wad of butter on Gottfried's loafers.

title: Times Expanding Its Market Tables
description: The market tables published by The New York Times have been amended to provide additional information for the reader and investor.

title: Haldeman Joins Mitchell as Court Sets Prison Date
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP)In a fourminute ceremony, with Watergate never mentioned, H. R. Haldeman and John N. Mitchell were ordered today to begin serving their prison terms by noon on June 22 for their role in conspiring to cover up the historic burglary.

title: Bridge:
description: A single devastating burst proved sufficient to win the Grand National zonal title for New England in play at the Sheraton Motor Inn, 42d Street and 12th Avenue, Sunday night.

title: ProAm for Charity Is Aces With Golfers in New Jersey
description: Golfers are either the most charitable sportsmen or else they just don't know enough to come in out of the rain. There were 244 good and bad swingers who played in a pouring rain yesterday at Old Orchard Country Club in Eatontown, N.J., for the benefit of the Monmouth County  Ocean County Chapter of the National Multiple Sclerosis Society. This was the fourth annual Old Orchard M. S. proamateur day. Proams are a dime a dozen across the nation. But this particular one has become one of the most successful golf outings in the Northeast. Few of these benefits attract as many golfers in a oneday affair as this Old Orchard. clambake which is held on one of New Jersey's finest public golf courses.

title: Cunard to Refit QE2 in Jersey, A Decision Resented in Britain
description: The Cunard Line passenger ship Queen Elizabeth 2, the world's largest active passenger liner, will spend 17 days at the Bethlehem Steel Corporation drydock at Bayonne's Military Ocean Terminal late this year.

title: MORE ENGINE SWAPS ARE CHARGED TO G.M.
description: New York State's Attorney General yesterday expanded his charges of engineswitching by the General Motors Corporation to include the highpriced Cadillac Seville and also charged that G.M. had engaged in a general interchange of engines involving Oldsmobile, Buick and Pontiac cars.

title: Gillette Splits Hairs For Its Safety Razors
description: Gillette's Safety Razor division has shifted its Trac II shaving system from Benton & Bowles, which introduced it in 1971, to Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn. The product was backed by $6 million in advertising last year.

title: Condominium camping     Easing Life in the Rough
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., June 6They call it condominium camping, and according to some people it is the best thing to happen to roughing it since they put floors in tents.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: 1976 NewCar Price Rose $700 Over 1975
description: DETROIT, June 6 (AP)The American consumer paid an average $5,450 for a new car in 1976, $700 more than in 1975, according to an annual survey by the National Automobile Dealers Association. It was the biggest relative increase from one year to the next in at least a decade.

title: OTB Official Accused Of Stealing $128,000
description: A former manager of the Offtrack Betting parlor at 1015 Second Avenue was arrested yesterday on charges of stealing $128,000 by cashing checks against an OTB bank account.

title: Tiffany Earnings and Sales Set Record
description: Tiffany & Company reported yesterday the highest sales, earnings and percentage gains in its 141year history for the first fiscal quarter ended April 30.

title: Prices of Coffee Futures Rebound From Recent ThreeMonth Lows
description: Coffee futures prices, which fell to a threemonth low last week, rebounded yesterday with limit gains of 6 cents a pound on all except the spot July delivery. The spot contract rose 15 cents a pound.

title: Hunter Wins, 9 to 2; Jackson Belts Pair
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., June 6Catfish Hunter and Reggie Jackson, two of the pillars in Yankee hopes for another pennant, both produced big games tonight as New York defeated the Texas Rangers, 92.

title: Albany Votes Ban on Topless Bars;
description: ALBANY, June 6The Legislature tonight voted to ban topless entertainment in bars, an action the State Liquor Authority refused to take on its own last year. The measure approved tonight would authorize the Liquor Authority to suspend or revoke the license of any establishment that allowed its female employees to appear topless or that features topless entertainment.

title: Appeals Court Refuses to Allow Benzene Rule to Be Enforced
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 6 (AP)A Federal appeals court refused today to allow immediate enforcement of an emergency Government regulation to lower the amount of benzene fumes that workers can be exposed to.

title: U.S. BRIEF OPPOSES PORT AUTHORITY BAN ON CONCORDE FLIGHT
description: The Carter Administration urged a Federal appeals court yesterday to rule out the ban by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey on test flights of the supersonic Concorde airliner, declaring that the agency's actions had been unfair, dilatory, arbitrary and unreasonable.

title: Chicago Mayor Sees Hispanic Chiefs
description: CHICAGO, June 6Chicago's Acting Mayor, Michael A. Bilandic, and leaders of the Puerto Rican community met today to talk over the problems of Chicago's HispanicAmericans. The meeting, which was held after calm returned to the Humboldt Park section following two days of rioting, was termed satisfactory by some of the leaders, and terrible by others.

title: Portland Throws a Party for Blazers
description: PORTLAND, Ore., June 6 (UPI)The celebrating went on and on today in a continuing salute to the Portland Trail Blazers, new champions of the National Basketball Association.

title: Walter K. Scott, at 62, Executive Of U.S. Radio for the Soviet Bloc
description: MUNICH, West Germany, June 6 (AP)Walter K. Scott, executive vice president of Radio Free EuropeRadio. Liberty and a former State Department official, is dead at the age of 62.

title: Best Buys
description: THE COST of feeding a family of four in New York City receded last week by sixtenths of 1 percent from the record high established during the week that ended May 27.

title: Concentrate Producers Raise Juice Prices
description: A number of producers of orange juice concentrate in central Florida announced price increases of up to 8.7 percent, Citrus World raised its prices by 8.7 percent, Lykes Pasco Packing Company by 7.2 percent and Garden Citrus Products Cooperative by about 8 percent.

title: Abadan Refinery: Saga of Superlatives
description: ABADAN, IranWhen a newly built unit goes into operation later this month at this Persian Gulf oil center here, what is already the world's largest refinery in area will become the world's largest in output.

title: Books: The Seamy Side Of Criminal Prosecution
description: SOME OF OUR BEST police novels these days have been written by former lawenforcement peopleJoseph Wambaugh, George Higgins, Dorothy Uhnak and Robert Daley come immediately to mind. Now add to that list Edwin Torres, who did time with the Manhattan District Attorney's office in the homicide bureau before setting up a private criminal law practice; recently, he was appointed a Criminal Court judge in New York City.

title: Carter Insulation Tax Credit Plan Survives House Panel Vote, 1312
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Carter Administration narrowly escaped a politically embarrassing setback today as the House Ways and Means Committee voted 13 to 12 in favor of tax credits for people who put insulation or other energysaving devices into their houses.

title: WIFE OF SLAIN DOCTOR IS RETURNING TO IRAN
description: The widow of an Iranian physician who was murdered in Brooklyn on Monday said yesterday that she and her young sons would move from Brooklyn to Teheran, the Iranian capital, for greater safety and security.

title: World Team Tennis
description: East Division

title: The U.N. Today
description: June 8, 1977

title: Britain Marks the Queen's Silver Jubilee
description: LONDON, June 7With solemn splendor and ardent affection, the British people celebrated today the silver jubilee of their sovereign, Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Transcontinental Plans To Buy Oil Interests
description: The Transcontinental Oil Corporation said it had agreed to buy certain oil and gas interests in producing properties and undeveloped acreage from a group of limited partnerships in which the CRC Corporation of New York and affiliated corporations are the general partners.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, JUNE 8, 1977

title: BYRNE IS RENOMINATED BY JERSEY'S DEMOCRATS; BATEMAN DEFEATS KERN
description: Governor Byrne won nomination for a second term yesterday in the New Jersey primary election. His victory, by considerably less than a majority, was made possible by the record field of nine challengers, who splintered the Democratic vote.

title: SENATE VOTES SHIFT IN FUNDS FOR HOUSING TO THE OLDER CITIES
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Senate, reversing a pattern of three decades, today enacted a new urban aid formula that would shift the spending of millions of Federal dollars from the Sunbelt to the older cities of the Northeast and the Middle West. The vote was 79 to 7, with all the negative votes cast by conservative Republicans.

title: Chip Carter in London For the Celebrations
description: LONDON, June 7 (Reuters) President Carter's son Chip arrived in London yesterday to join in celebrations of Queen Elizabeth's Silver Jubileee and look up his family tree.

title: Wine Talk
description: THERE are superb wines made from the sauvignon blanc grape. The best whites of Bordeaux are among them. The noble riesling yields some of the world's greatest bottles in the Rheingau, and some California vintners have worked minor miracles with the chenin blanc. But the chardonnay remains the most famous of all white wine grapes.

title: WEIVEN YAO KUNG
description: WeiVen (Helen) Yao Kung, wife of Dr. ShienWoo Kung, board chairman of the Bank of Canton in San Francisco, died Monday at Presbyterian Hospital in San Fracisco. She was 64 years old and a resident of San Francisco.

title: Foyt Out of Mays Race
description: MILWAUKEE, June 7 (UPI)A. J. Foyt, who won his fourth Indianapolis 500 title this year, said today he would not be competing in the Rex Mays 150mile race for championibip cars this Sunday. Tony Foyt Sr., the driver's father, said his son would drop out because he was ill with the flu and was tired. Foyt cracked up a car in the Texas 500 stock car race last weekend but was not injured.

title: Home Sources
description: Places that arrange paid social stays include:

title: Americanization of Pro Tennis Feared and Criticized in Europe
description: PARIS, June 7At a time when organized tennis is enjoying unparalleled popularity, bitter feelings have surfaced over American money and influence in the sport.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: JOE MUSIAL, 72, DREW KATZENJAMMER KIDS
description: Joe Musial, who for the last 25 years drew the Katzenjammer Kids, the nation's oldest continuing comic strip, died Monday at North Shore Hospital in Manhasset, L.I. He was 72 years old and a resident of Manhasset.

title: Nuts to SOUP
description: JIMMY and Rosalynn Carter are undoubtedly the biggest peanut promoters ever to occupy the White House, but that honor might easily have gone to Franklin and Eleanor Roosevelt if Robert P. Patterson, the Undersecretary of War at the time, had liked Mary McLeod Bethune's recommendation for peanut soup.

title: Bell Asks Senators To Fix Prison Terms And Discard Parole
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  Releasing prisoners on parole does not rehabilitate them, and the system should be abolished, Attorney General Griffin B. Bell said today.

title: Democrats Start Celebrating Before It's Official
description: While the triumphant Republican candidate in the New Jersey primary election, Raymond H. Bateman, flashed the broadcast of smiles last night, jubilant Democratic supporters of Governor Byrne began their victory celebration without him.

title: Mutual Fund Sales Surged 80% in April
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (UPI)Sales of all types of conventional mutual fund shares spurted in April to $556 million up more than 80 percent from the $305 million sales a year earlier, the Investment Company Institute reported today. It was one of the biggest monthly gains in the industry's history.

title: Senate Passes Compromise Bill Aimed to Counter Arab Boycott
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP)The Senate passed compromise legislation today that is aimed a discouraging the participation of United States corporations in the Arab boycot of Israel.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: IT IS preserved, intact, and if three electricians are summoned to make it work, even the old dance floor will revolve. You rather expect Joan Crawford or Carole Lombard to sweep down the stairs, and while the men who run it say it is really a restaurant, they are wrong Indisputably,

title: Rights Group Tells U.N. Guinea Tortures Prisoners
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 7A rights group, in a report to the United Nations, accused Guinea today of having tortured and murdered political prisoners and appealed to Secretary General Kurt Waldheim to intervene to halt the reign of terror instigated by President Skou Tour

title: Badillo Says There Is an Attempt To Link Him to AntiSemitic Mail
description: Herman Badillo, in a warmup of sorts for the mayoral campaign hat he plans to begin officially tomorrow, complained yesterday that someone wos sending out scurrilous antiSemitic literature and trying to blame him for it.

title: Planned Capital Spending To Rise 12.3% This Year
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Commerce Department today released an eagerly awaited report on capital spending, showing an upward revision that signifies that businessmen are a little less skittish about the future.

title: L.I.R.R. Trains Delayed
description: Up to 25,000 commuters were delayed up to an hour last evening when a switching problem interfered with traffic in two of the Long Island Rail Road's four tunnels under the East River. A spokesman for the commuter line said that the trouble started at 5:15 P.M. and that the backup of scheduled trains had begun to clear up by 7 o'clock.

title: Erving Tells What He Thinks of 76ers
description: The recently concluded National Basketball Association season will be best remembered for two significant events the emergence of Bill Walton as one of the game's dominant centers, and the proof that Julius Erving could play the game of basketball as well as anyone who had ever played before him.

title: BYRNE IS RENOMINATED BY JERSEY'S DEMOCRATS; BATEMAN DEFEATS KERN
description: Governor Byrne won nomination for a second term yesterday in the New Jersey primary election. His victory, by considerably less than a majority, was made possible by the record field of nine challengers, who splintered the Democratic vote.

title: ExCastro Soldier Balks at House Hearing on Assassination of Kennedy
description: WASHINGTON, June 7Loran E. Hall, a selfstyled soldier of fortune who fought for Fidel Castro in Cuba before turning against him in 1959, refused to answer questions put to him today by a House assassination subcommittee, which had hoped to get information from him about a possible conspiracy in the murder of President Kennedy.

title: UGANDAREPORTSAMIN IS FLYING TO LONDON
description: Air traffic controllers and policemen in capital cities across Europe watched yesterday for an unidentified plane that was reported by the Uganda radio to be carrying President Idi Amin to Britain for a Commonwealth conference despite warnings that he was not welcome.

title: What Democrats Say in Area That Called 73 Mayoral Race
description: Before Pauline Selzer began circulating her KochforMayor petitions, she had a neighborly argument in the lobby of the Petersfield apartment house with Mary Bums.

title: French Hold Two in Slaying
description: PARIS, June 7 (Reuters)Two men have been charged with the murder of a strike picketer this weekend, the police said today. The police in Rheims, east of Paris, identified the men as Claude Lecomte, a member of the Gaullist Service Action Civique group, and Henri Mangematin, who belongs to a small trade union. Thousands of workers throughout France stopped work for five minutes today in memory of the slain picket.

title: Abducted Banker Free in Bogota
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, June 7 (Reuter)An Italian banker named Giuseppe Mondini, kidnapped here three months ago, has been freed, members of his family said today. Mr. Mondini, 55 years old, manager of the Colombian branch of the FrancoItalian Bank, was seized from his home by five armed men on March 10.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: Horses listed In order of roost positions Letter designates OTB listing.

title: Books of The Times
description: IT WAS IN the old Madison Square Garden and Jos Torres had just taken the lightheavyweight title from Willie Pastrano with a punch to the liver. Outside Pastrano's dressing room, his wife pounded the door. Willie! Let me in! Willie! It's me. Please let me in! But the people around Willie Pastrano would not. And as I walked away, she was crying and clawing at the door.

title: UGANDA REPORTS AMIN IS FLYING TO LONDON
description: Air traffic controllers and policemen in capital cities across Europe watched yesterday for an unidentified plane that was reported by the Uganda radio to be carrying President Idi Amin to Britain for a Commonwealth conference despite warnings that he was not welcome.

title: Merrill Lynch Continues Program Of Common Stock Reacquisition
description: Merrill Lynch & Company said it planned to continue its common stock reacquisition program and authorized the purchase of up to an additional million shares during the period ending July 1 1978. This supplements 90,400 shares still available from prior authorizations.

title: Britain Rejoices at Queen's Silver Jubilee
description: LONDON, June 7With solemn splendor and ardent affection, the British people celebrated today the silver jubilee of their sovereign, Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Wealthy Queens Woman Arrested On Charge of Bid to Kill SoninLaw
description: A wealthy Queens grandmother whose hired hit man, according to the police, got cold feet and turned informer was arrested yesterday on charges of plotting to kill her soninlaw.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: F.D.A. Unit Backs SmithKline Ulcer Drug
description: The SmithKline Corporation announced that a committee of the Federal Drug Administration had reaffirmed a recommendation that its drug Tagamet, developed for ulcer treatment, be approved by the F.D.A. for shortterm use in treating duodenal ulcers and for use in certain other digestive abnormalities.

title: Personal Health
description: Jane E.Brody

title: Rangers Score 5 in 4th and Win, 73
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., June 7A flyball lost in a high Texas evening sky led to a 73 defeat for the Yankees tonight as they bowed to the Rangers at Arlington Stadium.

title: Stakeout for .44Caliber Killer Becomes a TV Show
description: For an undercover operation meant to trap a killer, the cover seemed about as secret as the 11 o'clock news.

title: Weakness in Swiss Franc Helps Dollar Rise Abroad; Gold Unchanged in Zurich
description: LONDON, June 7 (AP)The dollar gained ground across Europe today. Currency dealers attributed the gain to weakness in the Swiss franc.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Talks on Canal Zone to Resume In Washington Instead of Panama
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP)In a change of plans, the United States and Panama have decided to resume Canal Zone treaty negotiations later this week in Washington, the State Department said today.

title: School Chief for Alexandria, Va.
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., June 7 (AP)Dr. John Bristow, 44 years old, school superintendent of the RosemontApple Valley School District in suburban Minneapolis, has been chosen to head the Alexandria school system.

title: Seoul Assails EXK.C.I.A. Chief
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 7A spokesman for the South Korean Government issued a severely worded statement today condemning Mr. Kim for blaming President Park for the scandal.

title: Wright, Furst Set Pace
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 7Jimmy Wright of Fenway, with 73, 72145, and Farrel Furst of Rolling Hills, 76, 69145, were comedalists by one stroke at The Stanwich Club today in metropolitan sectional qualifying for the United States Open.

title: JAMES J. O'BRIEN
description: James J. O'Brien, a department store executive, died Monday at Greater Paterson Memorial Hospital in Wayne,N.J. He was 54 years old and a resident of Wayne.

title: SIX BANK UNITS STUDIED BY S.E.C. OVER. PAYMENTS
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating six banking organizations to determine whether they failed to disclose improper or questionable payments, it was disclosed today.

title: ERNEST C. OBERHOLTZER, ENVIRONMENTAL PIONEER
description: Ernest C. Oberholtzer, a veteran conservationist, died Monday in the Falls Nursing Home in International Falls, Minn. He was 93 years old and had lived at Rainy Lake, near International Falls, since 1912.

title: New Bond Issues
description: Tuesday, June 7. 1977

title: A Turk With 2 Talents Poetry and Politics
description: ANKARA, Turkey, June 7When he was a young man, Bulent Ecevit wrote a poem about GreekTurkish friendship that contained these lines: No matter if it is not the same racial blood flowing in our veinsthis wild wind within us is of the same spirit. ?? later years, when he was criticized for such tender sentiments, Mr. Ecevit stood by the verse. But in 1974, when he was Prime

title: Democratic Chairman Defeated in Primary
description: James P. Dugan, the Democratic state chairman in New Jersey who came to power four years ago with Governor Byrne, lost renomination yesterday for the State Senate seat he held in Hudson County's Jersey CityBayonne legislative district. Mr. Dugan was defeated by Walter Shiel.

title: BEAME ENDS HEARINGS ON EDUCATION BOARD
description: The chairman of the Economic Development Council said yesterday that one reason companies were leaving New York or deciding not to relocate in the city was that many high school graduates did not know enough reading, writing and arithmetic to handle their jobs.

title: Showdown on Auto Emissions
description: The Senate begins today a momentous debate on changes in the Clean Air Act of 1970. Several of its provisions are worthy of comment, but the greatest urgency attaches to the debate over automobile emissions. After numerous attempts to placate a dilatory industry without seriously eroding the nation's declared objectives, the House of Representatives caved in to industry and union pressure two weeks ago. It adopted amendments which could slow down the original timetable for cleaner cars even more than a conciliatory Carter Administration had wanted. What are you going to do, a dispirited legislator asked, when you have Henry Ford and Leonard Woodcock on the same side? Mr. Woodcock is no longer leader of the auto workers, but the question lingers on.

title: CEMETERIES
description: FOUR GRAVES, Private family ?????? for sale. Both Israel Cemetery. Wood bridge, N.J. Call 212260.2477.

title: Pallottines Pay $9,000 in Taxes
description: BALTIMORE, June 7 (AP)Pallottine Fathers paid nearly $9,000 today in taxes on four documents involved in their liquidation of real estate and other assets valued at $10 million. The Roman Catholic missionary order, under investigation by a city grand jury for its fundraising and investment activities, had challenged the payments on land in Harford, Cecil and Baltimore Counties, contending that the documents, were taxexempt. But Jan K. Guben, an attorney for the Rallottines, said the order had advised him to drop legal objections to the payments and send the checks to the various courts.

title: Queens College Exercises Are Shifted to Indoors Because of the Weather
description: Rain clouds forced thousands of graduates and their relatives and guests indoors at yesterday's 53d commencement exercises at Queens College. Since there was no hall big enough to seat them all, thousands had to make do with closedcircuit television to follow the proceedings.

title: Cubs Trounce Slumping Dodgers, 104
description: The slumping Los Angeles Dodgers, leaders of tithe National League's Western Division, lost to the Chicago Cubs, the Eastern leaders, for the second day in a row yesterday. This time it was a 104 trouncing.

title: Begin Agrees to Set Up a Regime And Again Calls On Labor to Join It
description: JERUSALEM, June 7Menahern Begin, officially accepting a call to form a new Israeli government, renewed his call today for a nationalunity coalition that would include the defeated Labor Party.

title: Her Turning Points
description: Her Turning Points

title: Rights Stressed As Carter Goal In Strauss Talk
description: Robert S. Strauss, the United States special trade representative, indicated yesterday that in the priorities of the Carter Administration, fostering human rights abroad came ahead of expanding American foreign trade.

title: Bridge:
description: One might suppose that bridge talent, even of the highest order, would grow rusty with disuse, but Morrie Elis of Oceanside, L.I., is proof positive to the contrary.

title: Helsinki and Warsaw
description: Following are excerpts from testimony presented to Congress's Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe by the Polish writer Gustaw HerlingGrudzinski on behalf of the writer Adam Michnik, arrested May 14 in connection with protests against the death of a student in Cracow.

title: Oberammergau to Pick 1980 Passion Play Text
description: OBERAMMERGAU, West Germany (AP)Test performances of a modernized version of this Alpine town's 300yearold Passion Play will take place on Aug. 13, 14, 15, 19, 20 and 21. The dress rehearsals are to help decide which script to use for the 1980 production of the play, which is staged every 10 years. Some rehearsals are to be open to the public, a town council spokesman said.

title: School Board Joins Move to Oust Judge for Remarks in Rape Case
description: MADISON, Wis., June 7 (UPI)The school board voted unanimously last night to call for the resignation of Judge Archie Simonson of Dane County, who suggested that rape was a normal reaction to sexual permissiveness and provocative attire.

title: Strudel: An Awesome Feat Even Amateurs Can Achieve
description: Among the many triumphs of the baker's art, few represent so awesome an achievement as strudel. Whether the layers of crisply fragile,. parchmentlike pastry are wrapped around such sweet fillings as apples, nuts and cinnamon, or lemony cheese, or nuts or winy cherries, or savory cabbage seasoned with bacon, onions, salt and pepper, the final result is bound to seem a masterpiece beyond the skills of any but the most proficient of pastry makers.

title: Senate in Albany Advances a Bill To Pay for AtHorne Care for Aged
description: ALBANY, June 7A bill that would allow more elderly people to receive care at home, instead of in nursing homes, under Medicare and Medicaid was reported favorably from the Senate Health Committee today.

title: Italy's Durable Andreotti
description: ROME, June 7  In this city of heroic monuments and feeble governments, Giulio Andreotti stands out as the most durable politician in Europe, with the lone exception of Marshal Tito of Yugoslavia. For over 30 years, he has survived in the service of his countrysix times as Under Secretary to the President of the Council of Ministers, 14 times as Minister of Internal Affairs, Finance, Treasury, Defense or Industry, and now for the third time, as Prime Minister at the age of 58.

title: MISS SIEBERT TO OVERSEE NEW YORK STATE BANKS
description: Muriel Siebert, who opposes the idea of requiring New York banks to invest more funds within the state, was confirmed as Superintendent of Banking yesterday in Albany by the New York State Senate.

title: Stored Remnants of Landmark Building Stolen
description: Three years ago, thieves made off with most of the castiron facade panels of a landmark building that was being stored in a downtown lot that the building had once occupied. The remaining 59 panels, which were considered irreplaceable, were moved to a building on West 52d Street, where they were placed under lock and key and where yesterday it was discovered that they, too, had been stolen.

title: Cucumber Raita
description: 1. Peel the cucumber and grate it (see note). Place it in a mixing bowl.

title: Swept Up by a Waltz, Swayed by the Swing
description: I WANTED to dance. Dancing seemed stylish and elegant; promised romance and recognition. I first sensed its magic one summer night at a boating club party in the small Long Island town where my family spent summers. I was perhaps 11 or 12, but all during the evening I kept my eye on a pretty redhaired girl who was a year older than I and seemed inaccessible.

title: Philadelphia Fire Kills Four
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 7 (AP)Four men died and a fifth was injured in a rooming house fire early today. The injured man, James McTillnan, 29 years old, escaped from a room on the first floor, but suffered severe burns. The bodies of the other four men have not been identified.

title: U.S. Said to Bar Sale of 250 Jets Ordered by Iran
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Administration has decided against selling 250 fighter planes to Iran, according to Government sources.

title: Mandatory Retirement Scored
description: PITTSBURGH, June 7 (UPI)Harriet Miller, the executive director of the nation's two largest organizations for retired persons today pledged that the groups 10 million members would fight to abolish forced retirement. More than 2,000 persons, aged 55 and older, are attending a threeday regional conference sponsored by the American Association of Retired Persons and the National Retired Teachers Association.

title: Berner Nine Wins Title
description: EAST MEADOW, L. I., June 7 Berner High School of Massapequa defeated Calhoun Merrick, 72, today and won the Nassau County South Shore baseball championships at Eisenhower Park. In the NassauSuffolk Catholic school championship, Holy Trinity of Hickisville beat Chaminade of Mineola, 64, to even their twoofthreegame series.

title: SENATE VOTES SHIFT IN FUNDS FOR HOUSING TO THE OLDER CITIES
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Senate, reversing a pattern of three decades, today enacted a new urban aid formula that would shift the spending of millions of Federal dollars from the Sunbelt to the older cities of the Northeast and the Middle West. The vote was 79 to 7, with all the negative votes cast by conservative Republicans.

title: Stage: Silver Jubilee at Stratford, Too
description: STRATFORD, Ontario, June 7It was virtually a state occasion here last night when the remarkable theater festival founded 25 years ago by the late Sir Tyrone Guthrie had its formal opening. There was a tent on the lawn for drinks, long black cars to deliver the guests of honor, and a company of bagpipers to blow them in.

title: U.P.S. Workers Ratify Contract
description: Members of Local 804 of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters have ratified a 22month contract with the United Parcel Service, Ron Carey, the president of the local, said yesterday. He said the pact would provide a raise of $1.79 an hour for fulltime workers and $2.68 an hour for parttime employees, in addition to fringe benefits.

title: Sunset Strip Is the Mecca Of Aspiring Rock Stars
description: LOS ANGELESThe road called the Sunset Strip is only two miles long, and it is not very pretty.

title: Governor Writes His Own Script On Movie Set at College Campus
description: Governor Carey visited the set of a movie being filmed on the City College campus yesterday to give solemn assurance that he was doing all he could to see that more pictures were made in New York. But he spent most of the visit trading banter with actors and directors like a standup comic.

title: Lefkowitz Cautions U.S. on Environmental Procedure Changes
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz of New York warned the Carter Administration today against a proposed streamlining of Government environmental impact procedures that he said, might deny the states adequate forewarning of Federal actions that would affect their citizens.

title: Red Smith
description: CHICAGO, June 7I'll give you an exclusive, Charlie Finley said. The Yankees won't win the pennant, not with Reggie Jackson and Ken Holtzman. Jackson is a disruptive influence. Holtzman is the most miserable man I have met in baseball. He was with the Cubs and he hated it there. We had him in Oakland and he hated it. He hated it in Baltimore and he hates it in New York. He hates himself. We won in spite of Jackson and Holtzman, not because of them. Charlie (I'm proud to be controversial) Finley was relaxing with a double Scotch after telling a gaggle of Associated Press sports editors that he was preparing another lawsuit against Bowie Kuhn, a commissioner whom he describes contemptuously as a notary rather than a lawyer. It was pointed out that Jackson and Holtzman had been prominent in the success of Charlie's A's when they were winning three world championships in a row. In those seasons, Jackson hit 25, 32 and 29 home runs and batted in 75, 117 and 93 runs; Holtzman won 19, 21 and 19 games.

title: Corrections

But they proved no match for the strange alchemy of Joe Torre or for the oldtime fire of Tom Seaver, who pitched and batted the Mets to an 80 whacking of the world champions.

title: Topics
description: Where was Andrew Young when Jimmy Carter failed to avoid Playboy interviewers? Defending Jimmy Carter for his campaign crack about ethnic purity in neighborhoods. Where the one turned ethnic into a racist slur, the other now turns racist into an ethnic catchall. We continue to believe in Mr. Young's underlying message, but his sloppy habits of speech should draw a penalty: just one coherent speech on race in international affairs, delivered standing in one place.

Sentencing was postponed pending appeals by attorneys for the brokers, Charles Ohle of Massepequa Park, L.I., and Ronald Jackson of Westfield, N.J. The state paid the two brokers $609,000 in 1975 for premiums owed to the Reserve Insurance Company of Chicago for insurance covering the state's motor vehicles.
