description: TRENTON, June 23Governor Byrnes campaign organization spent $90,000 to cover Election Day expenses in the June 7 Democratic primary, according to campaign reports filed with the state.

title: How Peaceful Can a Nuclear Test Be?
description: The oldest floating SovietAmerican disarmament talks of the nuclear erato ban atomic explosionsare under way again. That could be good news for mankind, if the objective is achieved. But the first step is to be clear on the objective.

title: Paul Oppenheim, 92, of Princeton A Noted Philosopher or Science
description: PRINCETON, N.J., June 23Paul Oppenheim, noted philosopher of science, died yesterday in his home here. He was 92 years old.

title: Deaths
description: ALONZOGerard J.M.D. of North Caldwell, N.J. Husband of Dolores (Carey). Father of Joseph G. Gerard J. Jr. and Mrs. Jory Lennox. Brother of Mrs. Vivian Marcello. grandchildren. Funeral Sat. 10 AM. Notre Dame Church, No. Caldwell, N.J.

title: Cash Prices
description: Thursday, June 23, 1977

title: Klee at the Guggenheim: Paintings, Prints and Drawings From a Master of the Small Format
Bond Prices Increase as a Weekly Rise Is Reported for Lending by Banks
description: Commercial and industrial loans from major New York City banks increased $600 million in the week ended Wednesday, their largest gain since they rose by a record $1.2 billion in early July 1974, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

title: Cold Reception After Escape From Vietnam Hits Children the Hardest
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, June 23For the children, even Vietnamese children who have long experience of the worst, the boat trips are frightening and remain alive in nightmares. But the refugees' receptions wherever their boats arriveif they arriveare incomprehensible.

title: Abner Biberman, Actor, Director
description: Abner Biberman, a stage and screen actor and a motionpicture and television director, died Monday at his home in San Diego. He was 69 years old.

title: Companies List Earnings Reports
description: For periods ended May 31 unless otherwise Indicated. (N) Indicates stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) American Stock Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: New Face: Christopher Lloyd
description: It was over in an instant, and Christopher Lloyd still isn't sure how it happened. One moment he was striding about the stage at Brooklyns Chelsea Theater Center, whipping a gang of thugs into line in his role as Bill Cracker, the No. 1 gangster in the BrechtWeill musical, Happy End. The next moment he was grunting his lines through clenched teeth to keep from crying out in pain. Somehowhe thinks it may have been a fairly simple pivoting movementtwo ligaments had torn loose in his right knee. Mr. Lloyd managed to struggle through the rest of the performance, after which he underwent surgery at the hands of the same specialist who ministers ao the highpriced limbs of the New York Jets.

title: Klee: A Master of The Small Format
description: FOR THE CONTEMPORARY eye, trained for decades now on the outsize scale of paintings and sculpture that are virtual environments in themselves, the art of Paul Klee (18791940) requires a certain adjustment. Klee's paintings, prints and drawings are small, highly concentrated works in which a great deal of visual invention, intelligence and wit are compressed into a miniaturized space. We are obliged to read such pictures, not merely to look at them, if we are to grasp the full range of their complexity and humor.

title: ADVICE REVOKED ON USE OF SALT AS AN ANTIDOTE
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 (UPI)The Consumer Product Safety Commission today revoked a decadeold set of firstaid instructions for persons who accidentally swallow alcoholbased antifreeze, saying the advice could be fatal.

title: Soviet Assails Spanish Communist And Autonomy of Parties in West
description: MOSCOW, June 23The Soviet Union, using a personal rebuke of the Spanish Communist leader Santiago Carrillo as a platform, today made a broader attack on socalled Eurocommunism, saying that this concept of independent parties in Western Europe was designed to split the international Communist movement.

title: Demand for Soybean Futures Ends a TwoDay Slide
description: CHICAGO, June 23 (AP)A strong demand developed for soybean, soybean meal and oil futures on the Chicago Board of Trade today after two days of declining prices, and the three commodities in the complex closed sharply higher.

title: World News Briefs
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, June 23 (UPI)Ugan da radio said today that President Idi Amin was on a honeymoon with his bride of two years and that reports of his disappearance were malicious propaganda aimed at hoodwinking the whole world.

title: Searching For a Memory
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn.I tried to walk to the far side of the Williamsburg Bridge, but they've taken the sidewalks away. A cabdriver found the place easilythe almost empty street, the boardedup house, waiting now for the wrecker's ball. With the key that's been in my pocket all these years, I quietly let myself in. Surely, I thought, if I'm silent enough some shadow will show itself, a longago echo will be heard. I wanted to kneel down, to press my ear against the floor, listening. But the only sound was the wind at the door, kicking circles of dust and dirty papers against the curb.

title: Golf
description: AT OAK BROOK, ILL.

title: Belmont Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Yankees' Records
description: BATTING

title: Lionizing MGM in Retrospect
description: I've made a lot of films that were bigger hits and made a lot more money, Gene Kelly was saying, but now they look dated. But this one, out of all my pictures, has a chance to last.

title: S.E.C. URGES MORE ACTION IN FORMING STOCK SYSTEM
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 (Reuters)The securities industry is not making enough progress in creating a national stock market system and more Government action may be needed, the Securities and Exchange Commission said today.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Union Names Sakala
description: SCHENECTADY, N.Y., June 23 (AP)  Union college named Richard S. Sakala of Columbia yesterday as athletic director. The 37yearold Sakala, associate director of athletics and baseball coach at Columbia, was selected to succeed Craig Carlson, acting director of athletics since Bruce Allison's resignation a year ago.

title: Offer of $46 Million Is Received For Rust Craft Greeting Cards
description: Rust Craft Greeting Cards Inc.the owner of valuable radio and television propertiesdisclosed yesterday that it had received a $46 million takeover bid.

title: Notes on People
description: A campaign to unseat the judge in Madison, Wis., who said that a sexually permissive atmosphere and the provocative clothing of today's women provided an invitation to rape, has been moving rapidly ahead. Leaders of drive to force a recall election of the judge, Archie Simonson, said that petitions had already been signed by 21,580 people, 500 more than required. Mr. Simonson made his comments from the bench in sentencing a 15yearold boy who had pleaded no contest to the rape of a 16yearold girl in a high school. He ordered the boy to spend a year at home under court supervision.

title: Rescuer of Lauda Wins Queen's Gallantry Medal
description: LONDON, June 24 (Reuters)Guy Edwards, a British racing driver, was awarded Queen Elizabeth's gallantry medal for extricating Niki Lauda, a fellow driver, from his burning Ferrari during the West German Grand Prix last year.

title: Russian Criticizes West at Belgrade Parley
description: BELGRADE. Yugoslavia. June 23The Soviet delegate at the current preparatory conference on EastWest cooperation today accused the West of a frivolous and cavalier attitude that could lead to unpleasant consequences.

title: Busy Times for a Corporate Mover
description: When the Mobil Corporation decided this year to move its domestic marketing and refining division out of New York City to Falls Church, Va., a consultant hired by the big oil company played a key role in the decision.

title: Homesick Stanky Resigns
description: MOBILE, Ala., June 24 (UPI)Eddie Stanky returned to Mobile today after a oneday stint as manager of the Texas Rangers and explained that after the excitement calmed down I started getting lonesome and homesick. So he quit.

title: Who Killed Martha Moxley? A Town Wonders
description: GREENWICH, Conn.A year and a half ago this town of 63,000, one of the wealthiest and safest communities in the country, was shocked by the murder of a 15yearold girl.

title: Warning on Saccharin
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 (AP)The institute's acting director, Dr, Guy R. Newell, cautioned pregnant woman and young children today against taking saccharm or foods that contain saccharin Dr. Newell commented before a House subcommittee examining the Food and Drug Administration's plan to ban saccharin in food and drink but to allow its sale as an overthecounter drug.

title: OnceHailed Subway Is Scorned in East Harlem
description: When construction on the Second Avenue subway from 116th to 120th Street was started in East Harlem in 1972, the community welcomed the project.

title: Philadelphia Police Face Inquiry
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 23The Federal authorities are accelerating their investigation of allegations that there has been widespread brutality by officers of the Philadelphia Police Department.

title: A Letter From Warsaw
description: WARSAW, June 23For anybody who doubts the toughness of the human race, the Polish people once more provide an enduring answer. No disaster of the past or anxiety about the present or future seems to erode their national faith and character. Caught in a political and economic squeeze between the Russians in the East and the bankers in the West, they not only keep going but are now the youngest and fastestgrowing nation in Europe.

title: Williwaw Storm Trysail Victor
description: BLOCK ISLAND, R.I., June 23Williwaw, the new Peterson 47foot sloop raced by Seymore Sinett of Plainfield, N.J., won in Class A around Block Island in light northwesterly winds today in the fourht race of the Storm Trysail Club's race week.

title: Antiques
description: SPECIALTY museums are proliferating now, thanks in part to enthusiastic collectors who spend decades amassing comprehensive materials relating to a single interest. This month one of the most interesting of these new institutions, the United States Tobacco Company Museum, opened in Greenwich offering an absorbing assemblage of rare, superbly crafted and curious pipes, cigar store figures, snuff boxes and bottles and spittoons.

title: Caramoor Festival Carries On
description: Of all the summer music festivals in this area, the one that probably appeals most to connoisseurs is that at, Caramoor, the estate in Katonah, N.Y., of the late Walter Tower Rosen and his wife, Lucie Bigelow Rosen. The combination of a beautiful setting, programs and performances of high quality and imagination and the limited size of the audience makes it special among the many large and small outdoor events that dot the Northeast at this time of the year.

title: Agatha Christie Book Saves an Infant's Life
description: LONDON, June 23 (AP)Agatha Christie's 16yearold detective story The Pale Horse saved the life of a 19monthold girl dying of a condition that baffled London doctors, the British Journal of Hospital Medicine reported today.

title: Broadway
description: THE SHOW OPENS this way: It is Central Park, and the cast of 12six men, six womensings This Is My Song, which is also the name of the show, and then does a snappy dance. The choreography is by Donald Saddler. The music is by Gary Friedman, and the lyrics are by Will Holt. The director is Robert H. Livingston, who has also put together the book. We have, therefore, a show that has eminently respectable names connected with it, even though the cast is to be made up for the most part of unknowns. Anyone can cast an unknown, of course, but these unknowns must be special. They all must be at least 60 years old. This Is My Song is a musical about the elderly.

title: Polaris Make Believe Takes Large Pony Title
description: WESTPORT, Conn., June 23  Mrs. Gene DeMatteo's Polaris Make Believe won three classes and outdistanced the field to capture the large pony hunter championship today at the opening session of the fourday Fairfield County Horse Show. Handled by Mrs. DeMatteo's daughter Robin, Polaris Make Believe finished with 16 points. Mrs. DeMatteo is from New Canaan, Conn.

title: Hunger Strike Ends in Chile
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 23Pledges obtained by Secretary General Waldheim from the Chilean Government were credited today with ending a 10day hunger strike by 26 Chileans at the United Nations office in Santiago. Chile. The Chileans had been demanding information about missing relatives who were said to be under arrest for political offenses.

title: North Sea Find Of Oil Reported By Shell, Esso
description: LONDON, June 23Shell and the Esso subsidiary of the Exxon Corporation announced jointly here today that they had made a potentially commercial oil strike in the North Sea in relatively shallow water about 170 miles east of Dundee. Scotland.

title: Issue and Debate
description: A main underlying issue in the recent controversy surrounding the repeal of a Dade County, Fla., ordinance banning discrimination against homosexuals was the fear of what the presence of admitted homosexual teachers would mean to children in their classrooms.

title: CAREY SIGNS INTO LAW BILL ENLARGING POOL FOR SELECTING JURIES
description: ALBANY, June 23Governor Carey today signed into law a major revision of the juryselection system. It is expected to enlarge jury pools and requires the random picking of grand jurors from the same pool that provides trial jurors.

title: General Tire Quarter Net Up 29.3% And 35% for the HalfYear Period
description: The General Tire & Rubber Company, the nation's fifth largest tire maker, reported yesterday profit increases of 29.3 percent for the second fiscal quarter ended May 31 and 35 percent for the halfyear period. It also noted that the proposed spinoff of its RKO General subsidiary to shareholders has been deferred.

title: Harry Blumberg, Metallurgist, Virginia Burdick Have Bridal
description: Virginia Burdick and Harry S. Blumberg, a widower, both of New York, were married yesterday morning. New York County Surrogate Millard L. Midonick performed the ceremony in his chambers.

title: About Real Estate
description: The Department of Housing and Urban Development is coming under increasing pressure to ease its environmental review requirements for projects that use Federal community development funds.

title: Books of The Times
description: WAS WAR WIRKLICH im Al asked Rainer Maria Rilke. A good question. I will tell you what is real in the world, at least this morning: my impatience. Is impatience a critical category? If I am impatient inside Peter Handke's new novel, is it my fault or is it Peter Handke's? Something has happened to me, I can't doubt it any more, said Antoine Roquentin in JeanPaul Sartre's Le Nause. Nothing at all has happened to me; I just sit here, annoyed.

title: Peyser Tells Senate Panel He Is Fit to Head P.S.C.
description: ALBANY, June 23Peter A. Peyser today tried to convince a Senate panel that despite a confessed lack of technical knowledge about utilities, or regulationand in some ways because of ithe was qualified to be chairman of the states Public Service Commission.

title: Mariners 8, Royals 6
description: KANSAS CITY, June 23 (AP)Craig Reynolds's single to left field scored Dan Meyer, and when Fred Patek bobbled a soft liner by Jose Baez another run scored, as the Seattle Mariners defeated the Kansas City Royals, 86, in 10 innings tonight.

title: INDUSTRIAL NATIONS ARE URGED BY VANCE TO SPUR ECONOMIES
description: PARIS, June 23Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance today urged the major industrial countries to set national economic growth targets for next year to create a more expansionary world economic environment.

title: Pictures That Speak of Asia's Dances
description: To those who believe, it was Krishna the god whose domain included the dancewho set the world in motion, and motion has moved the world and the people in it ever since. In the lands touched by Hindu faith, past or present, the dance reflects the sensuous beauty of religion, the employment of body to describe man and god, good and evil.

title: Indians 4, Blue Jays 0
description: TORONTO, June 23 (AP)Wayne Garland pitched a fourhitter and Buddy Bell and Rico Carty hit home runs as the Cleveland Indians beat the Toronto Blue Jays tonight, 40, for their eighth straight victory.

title: Desjardins Has Eye Surgery
description: BUFFALO, June 23 (AP)Gerry Desjardins, goaltender of the Buffalo Sabres, underwent surgery today for removal of a cataract from his right eye. A spokesman for the National Hockey League team said he was in satisfactory condition and would be in the hospital several days. Desjardins developed a cataract after suffering an eye injury when struck by a puck during a game last winter.

title: A Depressing Diagnosis of V. A. Hospitals
description: In the ongoing discussion about the nationalization of American medicine, it usually goes unnoticed that the largest single centrally directed medical system in the country is already run by the Federal Government. With a budget of around $4 billion a year, the Veterans Administration operates 171 hospitals and employs about 200,000 persons, including 16,000 doctors and more than 58,000 nurses. On any day, about 80,000 patients occupy V.A. beds.

title: Money
description: Thursday, June 23, 1977

title: Auto Sales Rose 14% in MidJune, Setting 2d Straight Selling Mark
description: DETROIT, June 23The United States automobile industry reported today that midJune sales increased 14 percent from last year to give it a second consecutive 10day selling record.

title: It Was a Night for Handshaking and Hobnobbing With Power
description: Peter Duchin's band struck up Happy Days Are Here Again at 8:19 last night, and the man who got half as many votes as uncommitted delegates in New York's 1976 Presidential primary stepped into the Grand Ballroom of the WaldorfAstoria Hotel.

title: Management
description: Do you find reading new material In your field difficult to understand, become confused by new concepts, find new assignments very difficult and realize your advice is not taken by others?

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: CoffeeDemand Dip Hits General Foods
description: Reflecting a sharp drop in coffee demand, the General Foods Corporation said yesterday that it was, in effect, withdrawing an earlier forecast of recordbreaking earnings for its fiscalyear first quarter ending June 30.

title: Immigration Settlement May Bring 145,000 From Hemisphere to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, June 23A settlement reached in a Federal court in Chicago this week could pave the way for about 145,000 persons, many of them Mexicans, to immigrate to the United States or, in the case of some already in the United States without visas, to legalize their status as resident aliens, Government sources said today.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT Thursday. June 23, 1977 PETITION FILED BY:

title: Jews in a Chicago Suburb Brace For July 4 March by Nazi Party
description: SKOKIE, ILL., June 23After World War II, thousands of Jews who survived the death camps of Nazi Germany settled in this quiet suburb of Chicago.

title: Conoco Offshore Well Suffers Gas Blowout
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 (AP)The United States Geological Survey said a gas blowout occurred today at an offshore well being drilled by the Continental Oil Company about 100 miles south of New Iberia, La., in the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Summaries of Wimbledon Tennis
description: MEN'S SINGLES

title: HOUSE BARS U. S. AID TO SEVEN COUNTRIES IN REBUFF TO CARTER
description: WASHINGTON, June 23The House today approved a $6.7 billion foreign aid appropriations bill, but only after placing Cuba, Angola and Mozambique on a list of nations excluded from receiving any. American aid, directly or indirectly.

title: Publishing: Revisiting Mencken
description: MARK TWAIN called the human species the only animal that blushesor needs to. In the same spirit H. L. Mencken discovered a certain subspecies that he named the boobus Americanus. He was our own G. B. Shaw: the American in charge of outrage. All through the Roaring Twenties and Depression Thirties he helped to keep the country going with epigrams and attacks upon censorship and sham.

title: Books:
description: This gracefully written critics! survey of the work of Frank O'Connor memorializes in a way an Irish writer whose name does not quite enjoy the luster it did at the time of his death in 1966. The book is not an ericomium however. It searches out O'Connor's faults as well as his virtues as a writer and critic. Mr. Wohlgelernter, on the English faculty of Baruch College, gives him highest marks for his short stories and lowest as a systematic critic of literature. He tells why.

title: Turner Shows His Braves How to Rally for Victory
description: NEWPORT, R. I., June 23Ted Turner put on a show at the America's Cup trials today for his baseball team, the Atlanta Braves, who were watching from an excursion boat on a day off, and also for the New York Yacht Club's Selection Committee.

title: Akron Area Rocked as Naphtha Explodes in Sewers
description: AKRON, Ohio, June 23 (UPI)Three thousand gallons of volatile naphtha, believed poured into the city sewer system by striking rubber workers, exploded here today, sending manhole covers into the air, shattering the stained glass windows of a cemetery chapel and leaving a twomile scar.

title: Retail Store Sales Advance 11%
description: WASHINGTON, June 23The Department of Commerce reported today that total retail store sales last week were about $13.88 billion, up 11 percent from the yearearlier level of $12.48 billion. Department store sales were an estimated $1.47 billion, up 9 percent from last year's $1.35 billion.

title: Taxing Cigarettes Less to Take In More
description: It is not easy to err in taxing cigarettes. Nonsmokers take pleasure from the knowledge that their weaker (though perhaps happier) friends must pay the government to exercise their vice. Smokers who feel spasmodically guilty in their habit can relieve their consciences by contributing to the state.

title: Film: Vulnerable Work by Visconti
description: THE VERSION of Luchino Visconti's "Conversation Piece" that opened yesterday at the D. W. Griffith Theater is virtually the same film I saw and reviewed when it was shown at the 1975 New York Film Festival. There is one difference. The festival film was in English, while the Griffith version is in Italian with English subtitles.One might be tempted to believe that the Italian language version is the original though, as it so often the case with Italian films with international casts, there really is no original version. At least some of the actors in each versionItalian, French or Englishare dubbed by other actors for the postsynchronized soundtrack.It is important to point this out because a number of observers tended to blame the mostly unfavorable critical reception to the film in 1975 on the fact that the festival showed it in English. Having just seen the Italian version, I stand by my original review, though the Italian dialogue, translated by subtitles, does have the effect of slightly distancing some of the screenplay's banalities. It is thus easier to see the film as an old man's musings, which are sad because they are so impotent, and because the film that contains them is so vulnerable.The following an excerpts from my original review, which appeared Sept. 27, 1975."Conversation Piece" is a disaster, the kind that prompts giggles from victims in the audience who, willingly, sit through it all feeling as if they were drowning in three inches of water.The film continues to explore concerns that occupied Mr. Visconti in both "The Leopard" and in his later, much less successful screen adaptation of "Death in Venice." The barbarians, the forces that represent social and political change and that acknowledge their physical passions, are attacking a citadel of the intellect, a place where reason has reigned at the cost of any possibility of love or commitment. It's one of Mr. Visconti's more dubious propositions that a person of taste and intelligence must always sleep alone in sterile splendor.In "Conversation Piece" the citadel is the handsome old Roman palazzo owned by the Professor (Burt Lancaster), an aging, American-born, Romanbred art historian who devotes his life to his books, his paintings by Old Masters, and his stereo recordings of Mozart. His life is turned upside down when his house is invaded by the real world as represented by a rich, pushy, overdressed marquesa, played by Silvana Mangano, the wife of a Fascist industrialist, her teen-age daughter (Claudia Marsani), her young German lover (Helmut Berger) and her daughter's lover (Stefano Patrizi).The members of this rampaging horde of four are supposedly so vital and so fascinating that they are able to persuade the Professor to lease to them his upstairs apartment for a year, though to anyone watching the movie they seem less interesting than a group of ordinary, run-of-the-play dress extras. Part of it has to do with what they say and the way we hear it.The screenplay is by Mr. Visconti and his longtime associates, Suso Cecchi D'Amico and Enrico Medioli and is said to be based on "an idea" by Mr. Medioli, which may well have once been a one-set play, the kind that has carefully timed entrances and exits and makes frequent use of the telephone to pass on information to us, if not people offscreen."Conversation Piece" is a movie made up of one part chitchat ("May I use your telephone?), one part unwanted confessions ("I threw myself into the student movementdeeper than most") and one part lumpy aphorisms ("The way of progress is destruction").As in bad plays, everyone always means exactly what he says and never has to think a second before saying it. There is no feeling for the complexity of the mental processes, for the mysterious ways in which the mind works. This, of course, wouldn't be bad if these people had the wit and insight of George Bernard Shaw characters, but they don't.As the invaders ultimately destroy the old professor, they also are the undoing of the German gigolo who, we are asked to believe, was once politically committed until ravaged by the bourgeoisie. Possibly some other actor could have handled this part, but Mr. Berger (who played the title role in Mr. Visconti's "Ludwig") is such a lightweight he can function no more than as an ideogram for decadence.Miss Mangano is grotesque in a grotesque role, while Miss Marsani, as her daughter, acts as if she'd seen too many "Gidget" movies.Mr. Lancaster, fine old professional that he is, is awful, adopting that humble, "Birdman of Alcatraz" manner he uses when employed in what he apparently thinks is serious movie-making. "Conversation Piece" is the kind of fatuous film that the professionally pragmatic Burt Lancaster, the action movie hero, would snort at and leave in the middle of.

title: Cauthen Returns in Winning Style
description: Steve Cauthen returned to center stage at Belmont Park yesterday, and in keeping with his stature as a matinee idol, the jockey made his firstact entrance a winning one.

title: Thyroid Cancer Risk Linked to Children's XRays
description: The National Cancer Institute says that as many as four million Americans may be threatened with thyroid cancer as a result of Xray treatments they received as children in the 1940's and 1950's. But the institute says it cannot find all the potential victims and must leave that up to local physicians.

title: CANADA TO INCREASE GAS PRICES FOR U. S.
description: OTTAWA, June 23Canadians will pay more for gasoline and heating oil, and a series of price increases announced today.

title: In Memariam
description: BERNSTEINMollie C. Who shares the eternal sleep of our beloved son, Albion. Peace to you Mottle.

title: Taxi Driver Shot to Death
description: A 25yearold taxi driver was found shot to death early this morning sitting behind the wheel of his medallion cab at West 129th Street and Fifth Avenue in East Harlem. His identity was being withheld, the police said, until notification of his next of kin. The body was found at 12:45 A.M. by patrolling police officers who were responding to a tel phone call that a man had been shot.

title: The Pop Life
description: WHEN IT comes to presentday Britain, it would be hard to think of two greater musical opposites than Steeleye Span and the Sex Pistols. Of course, for all this observer knows, Maddy Prior, Tim Hart and the rest of Steeleye Span may be the closet anarchists, longing for the violent demise of the ruling class. And the Sex Pistols may spend their time at home, crocheting doilies as they watch endless reruns of Upstairs, Downstairs on the telly.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: The caption under a picture on page 1 of yesterday's editions identified a visitor to the White House as Under Secretary of Commerce Sidney Harman. It was Alfred H. Moses, a vice president of the American Jewish Committee.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Fiftyone of 72 city, state and Federal employees accused of fraudulently receiving welfare checks totaling $356,825 voluntarily turned themselves in yesterday to District Attorney Mario Merola of the Bronx.

title: Guillotining of a Killer In France Denounced
description: DOUAI. France, June 23 (AP)A 36yearold farmhand was put to death by guillotine today for having drowned an 8yearold girl in a marsh in 1975. He was the second killer of a child to be guillotined in the last 12 months, and his death set off new denunciations of capital punishment.

title: Federal Supervision of Water Purity Begins Today
description: A new era begins today in the supply of the nation's most widely used and essential commodity, drinking water.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Prices of Commodity Futures
description: Thursday, June 23, 1977

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Friday

title: Management
description: Managerial and professional obsolescence has become a growing problem for companies. A professor of psychol, ogy at Pennsylvania State University believes that the crux of the problem involves motivation, which, in turn, depends on such factors as work environ. ment, the role of the manager and top, management policy. Page D5.

title: Antitrust Study in International Oil Sector
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 (AP)The Justice Department's antitrust division is making a preliminary investigation of possible anticompetitive behavior in the international crude oil market, the division's acting chief said today.

title: At the Movies
description: PEOPLE ARE saying it's a movie about male chauvinism, but it's not, insisted Martin Scorsese, the director of New York. New York, a controversial musical set in the 40's which has thrilled some and depressed others because of its bold blend of the melodic and the morose, the nostalgic and the nasty. With its morebitterthansweet portrait of the marriage between a loving but fatally competitive singer and a saxophonist, New York, New York is nearer in tone to Mr. Scorsese's scalding, operatically harsh Mean Streets and Taxi Driver than it is to tne glittering backstage baubles manufactured by Hollywood in its heyday.

title: FRANCE WILL NOT STATION AARMS OUTSIDE COUNTRY
description: PARIS, June 23 (Reuters)  Prime Minister Raymond Barre today ruled out the stationing of French atomic weapons outside France.

title: Mail Service to Lebanon Expanded
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 (AP)Air mail service to Lebanon, previously restricted to letters weighing one ounce or less, is being expanded to include all classes of mail except parcel post, the Postal Service announced today. Surface mail service to Lebanon remains suspended.

title: HERBERT T. EDWARDS, 76; LED U.S. FILM SERVICE
description: Herbert Threlkeld Edwards, former director of the Motion Picture Service in the State Department's Overseas Information Program, died Tuesday evening of an apparent heart attack at the home of friends here. He was 76 years old and lived in Greenbrae, near San Francisco.

title: Gullikson And Martin Post Upsets
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 23The hungry Americans had their day in the sun at Wimbledon today. And what a day it was for Billy (the Kid) Martin, Tim Gullikson and John McEnroe.

title: Business Interests Unite for Battle Over Labor Laws
description: WASHINGTON, June 23Business and industrial interests, joined by the foes of organized labor, have created a powerful coalition to fight unionbacked legislation to reform national labor law.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: IRAN ARRESTS AND TORTURE CHARGED BY U.N. AFFILIATE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 23The International League for Human Rights has protested to Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi of Iran, saying that it has evidence of mass arrests and torture of Iranians as well as harassment by the Government's secret police of Iranian citizens living abroad.

title: CAREY SIGNS INTO LAW BILL ENLARGING POOL FOR SELECTING JURIES
description: ALBANY, June 23Governor Carey today signed into law a major revision of the juryselection system. It is expected to enlarge jury pools and requires the random picking of grand jurors from the same pool that provides trial jurors.

title: The Problem of Lagging Capital Spending
description: Most discussions of the United States economic outlook these days eventually turn to capitalspending prospects as the key to future growth, employment and inflation. The trend in that sector of the economy is important at this stage of the recovery because auto sales, housing activity and other components of consumer expendiScene tures that have provided the upturn's main thrust the last two years may have already peaked.

title: Theater: Evening Of Cole Porter
description: TO MAKE A theater evening out of those Cole Porter songs that are more or less forgottensome of them dropped from his musicals before their openingsis a doubleedged venture.

title: WEEKEND MOVIE CLOCK
description: Below 42d Street

title: 2 Centuries Of Black Art At Brooklyn
description: THE ATTEMPT of black artists to establish identity through group exposure has been intensified this past decade, with an unprecedented succession of shows devoted solely to their work.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Stock Trading Continues Heavy With Indecisive Change in Prices
description: The stock market continued its recent indecisive pattern yesterday and finished mixed in heavy trading.

title: The Gentle Art of Showing the Flag
description: WASHINGTON  President Carter chose not to use American armed forces to support Zaire in its recent troubles. Some military assistance was provided, but the Administration was so cautious that it chartered commercial aircraft to deliver nonlethal goods, rather than either sending weapons or using Air Force transports.

title: B'nai Torah Institute to Get Funds
description: The Board of Estimate voted unanimously last night to give the B'nai Torah Institute of Brooklyn $1 million in new Federal job funds, although the institute is. under investigation by three different Federal agencies for its operation of summer job and lunch programs last year.

title: Careless DogOwners May Face $100 Fines
description: ALBANY, June 23The Legislaturd gave final passage today to a bill requiring dogowners in New York City and Buffalo to clean up after their pets on streets or in any other public places, under penalty of a $100 fine for each violation.

title: The Standings
description: Friday, June 24, 1977

title: Irish Rider in Jumping Lead
description: VIENNA, June 23 (UPI)Capt. Con Power of Ireland, riding Castle Park, was in the lead after the opening round of the European horse jumping championships today. Paul Schockemoehle of West Germany, riding Agent, was second and Johan Heins of the Netherlands, on Alme, was third.

title: Milton Young, at 67, Practiced Tax Law and Lectured About It
description: Milton Young, a lawyer who specialized in tax law, died Tuesday at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at 303 East 57th Street.

title: News Summary
description: FRIDAY, JUNE 24, 1977

title: Office Tower AboveGrandCentral Barred by State Court of Appeals
description: New York State's highest court yesterday unanimously upheld a lowercourt decision affirming the landmark status of Grand Central Terminal and denying the Penn Central company permission to build a 55story tower atop the terminal.

title: Cosmos Lose To Stars, 20, Ending Streak
description: ST. LOUIS, June 23The Cosmos appeared to forget tonight that a soccer game is played in two 45minute halves. After playing poorly in the first half and allowing two goals, the Cosmos dominated most of the second half to no avail. The St. Louis Stars wound up with a 20 victory before 32,605 fans, the largest soccer crowd in Missouri history.

title: Mexico Fights Losing Battle Against Encroaching Desert
description: LAS DELICIAS, MexicoWhen the Mexican Army water truck is a few days late, the villagers of Las Delicias drink from a watering place used by cattle and goats and, almost overnight, they fall ill.

title: ZERO POPULATION GROWTH BY 2008 IS URGED FOR U.S.
description: The Zero Population Growth organization held news conferences in nine cities yesterday to announce its national policy, which includes proposals to change the Federal tax code, eliminate illegal immigration and reduce the number of legal immigrants allowed into the United States.

title: Stage: Mamet's Space Pandas
description: The northern Queens region of Flushing has not, except for recurrent melodrama at Shea Stadium, had its name in lights as a performing arts center. A small and fortunate move in this direction has been started, since last September, by the Stage Company, a professional acting troupe that is at once regional and Off Off Broadway.

title: CANCER TEST REPORT BRINGS E.PA INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, June 23The Environmental Protection Agency, acting on a request from the White House, said today that it was investigating a report that some of its officials arrangedthen abandonedcancercausing experiments on prison convicts and Mexican citizens in 1975.

title: Seales Triumphs Over Wills
description: VANCOUVER, B.C., June 23 (AP)Sugar Ray Seales, a 1972 Olympic champion from Tacoma, Wash scored a unanimous 10round decision over Clifford Wills of Cincinnati tonight in the first professional fight program here in five years. Seales continually was the aggressor, outpointing Wills in every round of the middleweight bout.

title: U.S. Study Sees Peril in Selling Arms to China
description: WASHINGTON, June 23A major policy review in the Carter Administration has concluded that the sale of United States military technology to China would lead to a fundamental reassessment of Soviet policies toward the United States and an increase of tension between Moscow and Peking.

title: Dollar Makes Comeback On New York Markets; Price of Gold Fluctuates
description: The dollar made a comeback on New York foreignexchange markets yesterday, but had a mixed and uneventful day in Europe. The Associated Press reported.

title: 50 Years of Ups and Downs for Cyclone
description: People who like their nostalgia spiced with a twist of fright might look into Coney Island on Sunday where the Cyclone is celebrating 50 years as a roller coaster.

title: Bosworth May Head WagePrice Council
description: WASHINGTON, June 23Barry Bosworth a 34yearold economist at the Brookings Institution who believes in an interventionist role by the Government in the wageprice sector, was reported today to be President Carter's choice for director of the Council on Wage and Price Stability.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Rises 3.2%
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 17 billion tonmiles, up 3.2 percent from the yearearlier level. Carlcadings in the same period totaled 496,471 cars, up 1.2 percent from last year. The American Trucking Associations Inc. reported intercity truck tonnage rose 8.2 percent from a year ago.

title: Open Interest
description: Thursday, June 23, 1977

title: Mass Transit Bill Is Voted by Senate
description: WASHINTON. June 23The Senate passed today a new mass transit bill to allot an additional $5.8 billion to transit construction and operating programs over the next five years. but none of the new money could become available until after Oct. 1, 1978.

title: Manager Shuffle: New FreeAgent Game
description: When Joe Torre was named manager of the Mets, he received a telegram from Tom Lasorda, manager of the Los Angeles Dodgers. One more Italian manager in the majors, Lasorda told Torre, and we'll hold the winter meetings in Rome. This has not been a good, week for Italian managers. Frank Lucchesi was dismissed in Texas and Billy Martin teetered on the brink of joining him in New York. But it hasn't been a good week for black managers, either. Nor has it been a good season. for Irish managers. In short, it has been open season on managers, who seemingly are being ousted earlier and more often than in any other recent season.

title: U.S. Checking Airbus Accord
description: Eastern Airlines' plan to lease tour Airbus A300 jumbo jetsat no cost for the planes themselvesis being informally investigated by the International Trade Commission.

title: Nine Are Honored for Public Service
description: WASHINGTON, June 23The American Institute for Public Service announced today nine recipients of its annual Jefferson Award for high achievements in the field of public service.

title: U.S. OFFICIALS DIVIDED OVER LOANS TO CHILE
description: WASHINGTON, June 23Administration officials said today that arguments had been going on in several Government agencies for more than a week over three proposed agricultural loans to Chile by the Agency for International Development.

title: New York Ready for Parking Ban
description: New York City's Traffic Department said yesterday that it had finished covering parking meters and erecting noparking signs in the core area of Manhattan as set out in the parking restriction plan imposed on the city by a Federal court last week.

title: Lietzke Tied With M'Cord For Lead
description: OAK BROOK, Ill, June 23 (AP)Gary McCord, hoping for his first victory since joining the tour of the Professional Golfers' Association in 1973, and Bruce Lietzke, seeking his third triumph of the year, fired fiveunderpar 67's today and shared the firstround lead in the Western open golf tournament.

title: Jazz: David Summers at Ballroom
description: David Summers has a mouth that is as cavernously gleaming as Carol Channing's and eyes that can project a variety of vivid emotions. At the Ballroom, West Broadway just below Houston Street, he is presenting himself as a singer, but his physical attributes give his work an added dimension that can range from comedy to thoughtful characterization.

title: Court Eases Curb on Right Of Makers to Limit Outlets
description: WASHINGTON, June 23Overruling a 1967 antitrust decision, the Supreme Court held today that a manufacturer's restrictions on the number and location of franchised retail sales outlets for its products were not necessariy ilegal

title: Roosevelt
description: ENTRIES

title: Federal Supervision of Water Purity Begins Today
description: A new era begins today in the supply of the nation's most widely used and essential commodity, drinking water.

title: DOCKWORKERS ELECT PRESIDENT ON COAST
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 23As expected, James R. Herman has been elected to succeed Harry Bridges, who is retiring at the age of 75, as president of the International Longshoremen's and Warehousemen's Union.

title: JUDGE STRIKES DOWN SAFETY BAN ON IRIS
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., June 23 (UPI)Federal District Judge Robert F. Chapman, in a sharply worded ruling, struck down today the Consumer Product Safety Commission's ban against Tris, a flame retardant used in children's sleep wear.

title: The Trout Was a Pregnant Lady
description: GREENOUGH, Mont., June 23There was just enough snow water to fill a bird bath this spring on the western slope of the Continental Divide and as a result the Blackfoot River is lower for this time of year than it ever has been in all the summers that Skipper Lofting has been walking up and down in it and snatching trout out of it. Skipper says it is hard to read the river in its present state because places where he remembers pools or riffles or deep runs don't look the same at all. He says that if it keeps on this way, flycasters in August may be reaching areas never before invaded by a Royal Coachman or Dark Cahill and fish living there won't know enough to eat these delicacies. He says come to think of it, maybe something like that has been happening already, because the trout he has raised so far have been only curious about his offerings and just slapped at the fly playfully. In his three days here he has managed to provide this companion or that friend with breakfast but has yet to sink a fang of his own into rainbow, brookie or brown trout.

title: Black Youth Dies in Soweto Clash; Johannesburg Has New FlareUp
description: JOHANNESBURG, June 23Hundreds of young blacks mounted an audacious protest in downtown Johannesburg today and thousands more rioted in the black township of Soweto, provoking clashes with the police in which at least one youth died.

title: Dance: City Ballet in Balanchine Premiere
description: IN THE LAST few years, the New York City Ballet seems to have designed its major premieres expressly for the armchair traveler. the French flag was waved discreetly during the company's 1975 Ravel festival, while last year we were taken on a trip to Britain in George Balanchine's spectacular and unique Union Jack. Now Mr. Balanchine has pulled back the curtain on the Vienna of the waltz kings in his Wiener Walzer. Vienna Waltzes, as the new ballet is subtitled in. English, had its premiere last night at the New York State Theater.

title: New York's Senate Fails in an Attempt To Revise NoFault
description: ALBANY, June 23In the latest episode of an intricate legislative duel over nofault automobile insurance, the New York Senate tonight rejected a Republican effort to enact proposals originally advanced by Governor Carey but no longer fully supported by him.

title: Major League Scores
description: EDowning. DPChicago I. LOBCalifornia 6. Chicago 13. 2BRoJackson, Garr. 3BBrohamer, RoJackson. HRL Johnson (6). SBBonds 3. Orta, Downing, Bannister. SFGuerrero.

title: ExKorea Aide's Testimony Lauded By Leader of House Investigation
description: WASHINGTON, June 23Representative Donald M. Fraser, chairman of the subcommittee that heard testimony yes terday from Kim Hyung Wook, a former chief of the Korean Central Intelligence agency, said today that his evidence was consistent with information gathered from other sources.

title: REBATE CLASH PERILS TAX ON DOMESTIC OIL
description: WASHINGTON, June 23Northeastern and rural Southern Congressmen are threatening to kill the centerpiece of President Carter's energy programa new tax on domestically produced oilif rebates are not provided to their constituents for higher homeheating costs.

title: Derailment of Freight Disrupts Service for 30,000 Amtrak Riders
description: METUCHEN, June 23  Rail service for at least 30,000 commuters and longdistance travelers on Amtrak's busy BostontoWashington corridor remained disrupted today because of a freighttrain derailment at the southern tip of the business district here last night.

title: Cabaret: A Night With Soupy Sales
description: REMEMBER Soupy Sales? Back in the mid60's he was a daily television event, throwing pies at the likes of Frank Sinatra and Jackie Gleason, inventing dances called the mouse because he didn't like the monkey, trading life experiences with a huge imaginary dog he called White Fang, drawing an adult audience to his allegedly childrens' show and packing 3,000 fans into the Paramount.

title: The Modern China for Foreign EyesAs Much Theater as Reality
description: NANCHANG, ChinaAt first it seemed like another one of those heroic accomplishments of the new Maoist man. Here was a commune that had transformed itself in just eight years, building a network of big dams, reservoirs and aqueducts and achieving huge increases in the rice crop.

title: Men's Fashions: Formal to Funky
description: The satin jackets were a hit. So was the cook's vest. And the unexpected colors had their enthusiasts too. Robert Lamont Green, men's fashion authority, showed the first collection of men's clothes he designed at the Four Seasons the other day and had a diverse audience cheering.

title: U.S. CANCER INSTITUTE PLANS LAETRILE TESTS
description: WASHINGTON, June 23The National Cancer Institute will start clinical trials in the near future of the purported anticancer chemical, laetrile, Federal scientists told Congress today.

title: METALS
description: COPPER

title: Cunard Lines Docks At Compton Agency
description: Having talked to 10 agencies and having seen creative presentations from five of them, Cunard Lines, it is understood, has decided to tie up at Compton Advertising. The account bills at least $2 million. Ogilvy & Mather had been the agency for about seven years.

title: REBATE CLASH PERILS TAX ON DOMESTIC OIL
description: WASHINGTON, June 23Northeastern and rural Southern Congressmen are threatening to kill the centerpiece of President Carter's energy programa new tax on domestically produced oilif rebates are not provided to their constituents for higher homeheating costs.

title: Yachting
description: AT BLOCK ISLAND, R.I.

title: Advertising
description: Sussman & Sugar Advertising has resigned the Grove Press account partly, it said, for fear that My Story, the Judith Exner book being published by Grove, might involve it in litigation. The book concerns the relationship that Judith Campbell Exner says she had with the late President Kennedy.

title: Fire Captain Dies As Wall Collapses In Brooklyn Blaze
description: A 40yearold New York City Fire Department official was killed early yesterday when a wall of a burning discotheque in Brooklyn collapsed.

title: Carter Picks Schaufele for Athens
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 (Reuters)President Carter today nominated William E. Schaufele Jr., Assistant Secretary of State for African Affairs, as Ambassador to Greece. The 53yearold Mr. Schaufele, whose nomination is subject to confirmation by the Senate, has served as Ambassador to Upper Volta and has had other diplomatic posts in Africa.

title: HOUSE BARS U.S. AID TO SEVEN COUNTRIES IN REBUFF TO CARTER
description: WASHINGTON, June 23The House today approved a $6.7 billion foreign aid appropriations bill, but only after placing Cuba, Angola and Mozambique on a list of nations excluded from receiving any American aid, directly or indirectly.

title: Carter Attends Democratic Dinner At Waldorf That Raises $1 Million
description: In his first political visit to New York city since his inauguration, President Carter was hailed last night by the Demo. cratic Party's Establishment, the same Establishment he had to fight his way into in a grueling twoyear campaign for the Presidency.

title: Mrs. Cooperstein Wins L.I. Golf by 4
description: JERICHO L.I., June 23Judy Cooperstein of Glen Oaks won her third championship in three weeks today as she captured the 36th Women's Long Island Golf Association title with a 54hole total of 235 at the Meadow Brook Club. She had previously won the 1977 Women's CrossCounty Golf Association and Women's Metropolitan Golf Association titles.

title: Letters
description: Agony Without Ecstasy

title: JUSTICES BACK CURBS ON PRISONER UNIONS
description: WASHINGTON, June 23The Supreme Court ruled today, 7 to 2, that prison authorities may prohibit inmates from unionizing and also from operating previously established inmate labor unions.

title: Who Killed Martha Moxley? A Town Wonders
description: GREENWICH, Conn.A year and a half ago this town of 63,000, one of the wealthiest and safest communities in the country, was shocked by the murder of a 15yearold girl.

title: Burns in Plea for Fed Independence
description: WASHINGTON, June 23Chairman Arthur F. Burns of the Federal Reserve Board made a strong plea today for continued independence of his office, warning that otherwise monetary policy will be determined by this or that political hack in the basement of the White House.

title: 2 Pedestrians Are Shot by Officer
description: Two pedestrians were wounded by gunshots from a policeman who opened fire on a stolen car whose driver the officer said, was attempting to run him down in crowded Union Sqare yesterday morning.

title: Rear Adm. Ross P. Whitemarsh, 82; Survived 10 Days at Sea in Boat
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 23 (AP)Services for retired Rear Adm. Ross P. Whitemarsh, who died this week, will be held here Monday.

title: REGENTS ACT TO CURB LAX COLLEGE COURSES
description: ALBANY, June 24In an action designed to weed out lax college programs of questionable academic content from participation in state tuition aid, the State Board of Regents today significantly tightened the academic requirement for approved courses of study.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Vance Concedes Certain Strains In Ties to Soviet
description: PARIS, June 24After an hourlong report from President Valry Giscard d'Estaing on the recent FrenchSoviet meeting, Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance changed his assessment of United StatesSoviet relations today and acknowledged that there were strains in certain areas.

title: Letter: On City Parking Restrictions
description: To the Editor:

title: Thornton Continues Assault on Tigers
description: Andre Thornton, a righthandedhitting outfielder for the Cleveland Indians, hasn't much of a batting average against anybody except Detroit in the American League. His Batting mark is .209 against all the other teams. Against Detroit he is hitting .444.

title: Report on Soviet Nuclear Strategy Says Moscow Emphasizes Victory
description: The Soviet Union's strategic nuclear doctrine seeks victory, not deterrence, superiority in weapons rather than sufficiency, and offensive, perhaps preemptive, operations rather than retaliation, according to Dr. Richard Pipes of Harvard University who headed Team B of the Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board.

title: He ThreePutted in 48 Countries
description: At the Lagunita Country Club in the mountains outside Caracas, Venezuela, a few years ago, Fred Corcoran missed a short putt and turned to the others in his foursome.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: DRAMA, DANCE and TALK The fiveyearold Black Theater Alliance, whose members are 52 theater and dance companies, is presenting its sixth annual festival, running through July 4. Today, at 2 P.M., an alliance symposium at the Negro Ensemble Company's St. Marks Playhouse, at St. Marks Place, 133 Second Avenue, discusses The American Black Theater Movement: Dateline '77. The panel of scholars, playwrights and producers includes Ellis Haizlip, Woodie King Jr., Barbara Ann Teer, Richard Wesley and Owen Dodson.

title: Belmont Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Personal Investing
description: Due to a deadly combination of rising interest rates and declining stock prt comparatively few new convertible bond issues have been brought to market in the last three years.

title: Bryan Ferry Sings Along Alone
description: Roxy Music was about the most interesting rock band from Britain in the early 1970's. But it was always wracked with tensions between its members, and ever since Bryan Ferry, the lead singer, put out his first solo disk in 1974, he seems to have devoted more energy to his own career than to the band.

title: Books of The Times
description: Here are two impressive books that tun the laser beam of modern historical scholarship on the institution  slavery in the United States and pierce the magnoliascented fog that has all but blotted out the true dimensions of the bondage system in the South. That it should require more than

title: BLACK AFRICAN PICKED AS LUTHERAN LEADER
description: A black activist bishop from Tanzania yesterday became the first African and the first of his race to head the 58 millionmember Lutheran World Federation.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Saybean Prices Advance After a Wide Swing; Pork Bellies Climb Limit
description: Soybeans and soybean oil prices moved wildly yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, closing above the preceding day's level after having taken an early morning plunge.

title: LEE L. CORELL, 66, NOTED CIVIC LEADER
description: Lee Laimbeer Cornell, a civic leader and a former assistant to Helen Rogers Reid, late president of The New York Herald Tribune, died Thursday night at the Memorial SloanKettering Cancer Center. She was 66 years old and lived at 45 Sutton Place South.

title: CBSTV PLANS A PROGRAM TO AID READING IN SCHOOL
description: CBSTV yesterday announced a project to motivate and stimulate reading among its schoolage viewers. The project, to begin next fall, aims to create a wider interest in reading by building on the children's attachment to television.

title: Dutchmen Fight for Major World Economic Role
description: PARIS, June 24Three Dutchmen and the international organizations they head are maneuvering for a major role in helping the world pay for its soaring oil bill.

title: Kummerfeld Sworn In
description: With more than a hundred of his friends and colleagues in attendance, Donald D. Kummerfeld was sworn in by Mayor Beame yesterday as First Deputy Mayor, succeeding John E. Zuccotti. At a ceremony in the Board of Estimate chamber, Mr. Kummerfeld, a 43yearold native Californian, pledged, to continue his efforts in fiscal and management programs in service of. this city, which I love with all my heart. Mr; Beame praised him as a man of outstanding professionalism and capability. Mr. Kummerfeld is to be succeeded as Budget Director by Robert J. Bott.

title: Major League Scores
description: EHTorres 3, Velez. DPToronto 1, Baltimore 2. LOBToronto 7, Baltimore 5. 2BAult, PaKelly 2, Velez. HRFairly (8) SBBumbry. SHowell, Bowling.

title: Weekly News Quiz
description: Questions are based on news reports in The Times during the last week.

title: Cajun Language Textbook Seen As Helping to Preserve Culture
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 24For 200 years, in the watery land south of New Orleans and in the western Louisiana prairie, the Cajuns have been a race apart.

title: B.P. Share Offering Is Oversubscribed
description: LONDON, June 24 (AP)The biggest stock offer in British history opened and closed in one minute today as the Bank of England announced that its sale of more than 66 million shares of the British Petroleum Company had been oversubscribed.

title: All New York City Highway Patrol Cars to Get Radar
description: The New York City Police Department will soon supply all its highway patrol cars with radar in a move to tighten enforcement of speed limits and reduce accidents.

title: Carter's Gift Is Going For General Expenses
description: WASHINGTON, June 24 (AP)President Carter's $6,000 gift to the Government will go into the same Treasury funds that were built up by patriotic contributors and members of Congress who have refused pay increases.

title: Vegetable Stores Provide a New Start for Korean Immigrants
description: If II Y. Chung were Chinese and he had immigrated here, he might well have gone into the laundry or restaurant business. If he were Greek, he might have gone into a coffee shop or delicatessen. But.Mr. Chung is Korean and so he entered the newly popular KoreanAmerican enterprise: he opened a fruit and vegetable stare.

title: Jazz Festival Gets Started On Latin Note
description: Last summer's NewportNew York Jazz Festival began with a concert by a pop singer, Tony Bennett, a choice a number of observers found inappropriate. This year's festival began yesterday with a free concert in Washington Square Park by Eddie Palmieri and his Latin orchestra. There will be more free Latin concerts throughout the jazz festival's 11day run, all of them on the Jazzmobile's traveling stage, at various locations around the city.

title: Crime Unit Checks Report Mob Set Up Legislators' Dates
description: WASHINGTON, June 24Local police and a Justice Department strike force are investigating the alleged involvement of members of Congress and their aides with highpriced prostitutes furnished by organized crime, according to sources on Capitol Hill.

title: ke Sea Plunge in Search of Thrills
description: SAN SALVADOR ISLAND, the Bahamas, June 18Bored above sea level and undaunted by sharks and other creatures below it, growing numbers of Americans are bubbling Into the deep in search of recreational thrills.

title: Ethiopia Extends Curfew in Capital
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, June 24 (UPI) Ethiopia denounced the United States today as a nation soaked in blood and imposed an extended curfew on this capital city on the eve of a review of its peasant army.

title: Jazz Events
description: Following is a schedule of today's Newport Jazz FestivalNew York events:

title: It's Summer in the City
description: Fashion is easy this summer. The greater the volume of air between clothes and body, the greater the look. It's called looseness of silhouette.

title: Senate in Albany Votes a Bill to Allow Terminal Cancer Patients to Use Laetrile Under Strict Supervision
description: ALBANY, June 24The New York Senate today passed without debate and with only one dissenting vote a bill to permit terminal cancer patients to receive the controversial drug' laetrile under close medical supervision.

title: Yachting
description: AT BLOCK ISLAND

title: Horse Shows
description: AT NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J.

title: Watson (69) and North (70) Tie For Western Open Lead at 139
description: OAK BROOK. Ill., June 24 (AP)Tom Watson shot a 69 and Andy North a 70 today as the two close friends tied for the lead in the Western open golf tournament with 36hole scores of 139 five under par.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Three youths convicted last month of the hammer murders of 76yearold Joseph Tucci and his wife, Angelina, 82, were sentenced in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn to 25 years to life in prison. The elderly couple were slain Aug. 10 in their apartment at 1048 63d Street in the Bensonhurst section of Brooklyn during a robbery that netted the three suspects two bankbooks and a ring.

title: CANCERCONTROL BILL ASSAILED IN SENATE
description: TRENTON, June 24  A legislative proposal to regulate the use of cancercausing chemicals in New Jersey came under strong attack today from the chemical industry.

title: Craftsmen Offer a Toast To Those with a Taste For the Unconventional
description: Surely you can't serve coffee in that, said a tall, grayhaired man, furrowing his brow at a clay coffeepot that bore more resemblance to an abstract painting than to a conventional utensil.

title: Cuba Shows ABC Castro Interview
description: HAVANA, June 25 (Reuters)  In a unique move for a Communist country, Cuba has broadcast a virtually uncut version of an ABCTV interview by Barbara Walters with President Fidel Castro. About two weeks after the program was shown in the United States, it ran for two nights in Cuba. Topics included press freedom and political prisoners here and Cuba's relations with the United States, the Soviet Union and Africa.

title: ExNew York Executive Is Killed In Knife Attack in West Indies
description: KINGSTON, St. Vincent Island, June 24 (AP)An axwielding assailant attacked a former New York executive aboard his, sailboat early today, the police said. The victim, Carl E. Schuster, died a few hours later in a hospital here.

title: In Memoriam
description: DINTENFASSChaya Freide, mother died Jure 25, 1908. The message is still with me.,

title: Senators Hear Pros and Cons Of OTB Curbs
description: WASHINGTON, June 24With high stakes involved, the Senate Commerce Committee opened the starting gate today on a battle to determine if Congress should prevent stateoperated offtrack betting parlorsmainly those in New Yorkfrom accepting bets on outofstate races.

title: Kaiser Steel Names New Chief
description: Mark T. Anthony, 60 years old, senior vice president of the Kaiser Steel Corporation. since last September, has been named president and chief executive officer, the company said yesterday. He succeeds William R. Roesch, 51, who has resigned as chief executive officer and as a director, and George A. Jedenoff, 60, who has retired as president and a director.

title: Stuttgart's Sleeping Beauty Is Pretty but Curious Hybrid
description: The first thing to be said about the Stuttgart Ballet's new production of The Sleeping Beauty, which had its. New York premiere at the. Metropolitan Opera House Thursday night, is how pretty it looked. The second thing is to inquire how Pretty The Sleeping my should look. Might not a case be made for magnificence, ratter than prettiness?

title: The Imponderables of the Giant California Redwoods
description: REDWOOD NATIONAL PARK, Calif.Nothing provokes argument like a lack of factual information, and that seems to be the reason that wrangling about saving the majestic California redwoods goes on and on. Interior Secretary Cecil D. Andrus recently spent a whole day in Redwood National Park trying to sort out the pros and cons of the protracted treepreserving If he learned nothing else he found that relevant, documentable facts were scarcer than redwoods.

title: N.H.L. Offers Plan to Add Teams From W.H.A., Starting Next Season
description: CHICAGO, June 24The National Hockey League finally extended its hand today to the beseeching World Hockey Association and agreed to negotiate a consolidation of the two rival leagues.

title: Their Way Is Not My Way
description: BOSTONI am one of those people who are always standing up and speaking out against a perceived justice. I do it on all manner of subjects and hang the consequences. I don't believe one has to make peace with an unjust world in order to survive.

title: Swiss Credit Bank Sues Company In Liechtenstein for $680 Million
description: ZURICH, June 24 (AP)  The Swiss Credit Bank, which is embroiled in Switzerland's biggest banking scandal, announced today that it had filed a $680 million claim against a financially troubled Liechtenstein holding company.

title: Father of Krishna Member Loses did to Have Guardian for His Son
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. June 24A judge turned down today a father's plea to have his 23yearsold diabetic son, a member of the Hare Krishna religious sect, placed under a permanent guardian.

title: U.S. SAID TO SEEK REPORT ON CHILEAN ALTERNATIVES
description: WASHINGTON, June 24 (AP)Administration sources say that a National Security Council official asked for a Central Intelligence Agency analysis of possible alternatives to Chile's rightist military junta, but spokesmen for the White House, the council and the C.I.A. all denied it today.

title: Low Profile Yields High Returns for West Coast Firm
description: LOS ANGELESMoney managers often brag about their prescience and their ability to pick winners in the stock market. Here, in the city of superhype, exaggerations really flourish; the extraordinary is commonplace.

title: Dual Purpose Funds
description: Week ended June 24, 1977

title: Indonesia Debates How Long Its Oil Wealth Will Last
description: JAKARTA, IndonesiaA debate has erupted in Indonesian Government cirdes over when the country will run out of oil and therefore over its continuing ability to attract investment and borrow on world financial markets.

title: Dr. Beverly Pawson Wed To Dr. Arnold Liebman
description: Dr. Beverly A. Pawson of Montclair, N. J., was married there yesterday afternoon to Dr. Arnold A. Liebman, a widower of Upper Saddle River, N. J. The Rev. Deborah Kapp performed the ceremony in the Central Presbyterian Chuch.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, June 24 (AP) Faced with. overwhelming public opposition; the Government has abandoned its plan to Convert the nation's highway signs to the metric system.

title: Strict Queens Principal Is Cheered As He Castigates Education Board
description: A principal who fought the Board of Education over an order to reinstate a girl he had suspended was cheered and applauded by students and their parents at his high school's commencement exercises yesterday.

title: Jackson's Hit in 11th Brings 65 Victory
description: The awesome Boston Red Sox unloaded three more home runs on the Yankees at the Stadium last night, but a runscoring single in the 11th inning by Reggie Jackson, with an assist from Gabe Paul, won the game for the Yankees, 65.

title: Attack by Moscow Viewed as Attempt to Split Spanish Communists
description: MADRID, June 24The Soviet Union's attack yesterday on Santiago Carrillo, the Spanish Communists maverick secretary general, was widely seen here today as an attempt to stir opposition to his leadership following the party's relatively poor showing in last week's elections.

title: Bill Greeley, 56, a Reporter And Television Critic at Variety
description: Bill Greeley, one of the most respected television critics and reporters, died yesterday, while on assignment in Los Angeles for Variety. He was 56 years old and lived at 95 Christopher Street.

title: Cauthen Scores Twice In 6 Races at Belmont
description: Steve Cauthen, feeling his way through his second day of riding after month's absence because of injury, scored twice in six starts at Belmont Park yesterday, thereby assuring his followers that he had not lost his winning touch.

title: Congressmen Form a Caucus to Work for Little Guy
description: WASHINGTON, June 24They were prizefighters and pipefitters. They worked along the docks, on the railroad, in factories. Now, as lawmakers, they hav,e joined forces in a Congressional blue collar caucus.

title: Bicycle Is Developed With Variable Speeds
description: A variablespeed bicycle drive is being developed by a group named B5 Associates in Stamford, Conn. The inventor is Hamlin Leonard of Darien, who was granted patent 4,030,373 this week.

title: Albany Votes PropertyTax Study, Thus Putting Off Issue Until 1979
description: ALBANY, June 24The Assembly gave final Legislative approval today to a bill setting up a ninemember commission to study the problem of property assessment and report back by the end of next year.

title: HOUSE UNIT SEEKS AID OF NEW YORK OFFICER
description: The House Select. Committee on Assassination is seeking to appoint as its senior investigator a New, York City police detective who is an authority on organized crime.

title: Sports Today
description: AUTO RACING

title: Newton Said to Plan Return to U.S.
description: TORONTO, June 24 (AP) Huey P. Newfly here tomorrow from Cuba on ton, the Black Panther leader is to the first leg of a journey to California, where he faces murder and assault charges, the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation reported.

title: Mrs. Carner Leads on a 68
description: PLYMOUTH, Ind., June 24 (AP)JoAnne Carner took a careerlow 25 putts today and shot a fourunderpar 6S for the firstround lead in the 550,000 Ladies Professional Golf Association Hoosier Classic at the Plymouth Country Club.

title: Pope Warns Rebel Prelate of Irreparable Break
description: ROME, June 24Pope Paul VI has warned a suspended French prelate that he risks an irreparable break with the Roman Catholic Church if he goes ahead with plans to ordain 14 priests next Wednesday in defiance of a papal ban.

title: Vance Concedes Certain Strains In Ties to Soviet
description: PARIS, June 24After an hourlong report from President Valery Giscard d'Estaing on the recent FrenchSoviet meeting, Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance changed his assessment of United StatesSoviet relations today and acknowledged that there were strains in certain areas.

title: BrewerShipley Folk Duo at Crossroads
description: Brewer and Shipley, the folk duo appearing at the Other End through this weekend, seem to have reached a crossroads in their career. They have left California for homes in the Missouri Ozarks and left their record label, Capitol. At present, they are without a label, but they are not without fans. The crowd at the Other End on Thursday evening cheered lustily, especially for the duo's drugsanddrink songs Brain Damage and One Toke Over The Line.

title: Bridg
description: Bridgeplayers, like Gaul, are divided into three parts, at least when it comes to leading from a worthless threecard holding. The traditional choice is the high card, the top of nothing. Many tournament players favor MUD. which means that they begin with the middle card, then play up and finally down. And a substantial number of experts, especially on the East Coast, lead low from three small cards.

title: China's New Heads Indicate A Party Congress This Year
description: HONG KONG, June 23In contrast to the cataclysmic style of Chairman Mao Tsetung, Peking's new leaders seem to be moving methodically, with a thoroughness characteristic of their bureaucratic background, taking each problem in turn. Thus, having first dispatched their political opponents, the notorious Gang of Four, including Chiang Ching, and then, this spring having worked out a program for economic development over the next decade, they now seem to be preparing for a party congress to legitimize their new order.

title: Wondering Why
description: YONKERSPeople are beginning to accept the fact that the old neighborhood isn't what it used to be. But no one ever asks why. I asked myself why and then I realized why no one asks: It's hard to find an answer. It's easier to stay cozy and warm, wrapped up in yesterday's memories than to accept the reality of the new neighboyhood.

title: Thwarting Free Talk From Pay Telephones
description: Some telephone users who have been called from a coin station have been able to simulate additional coin deposits and continue to talk free. Bell Telephone Laboratories has developed a way to prevent fraudulent signals from being accepted.

title: About New York
description: In royal blue caps and gowns, the graduating class of Public School 109 sang to their parents and teachers. I am music, they sang. I write the songs that make the whole world sing.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: CANADIAN PARTY LEADER DIES AS CAR FALLS IN RIVER
description: DRUMMONDVILLE, Canada, June 24 (AP)Andre Fortin, leader of Canada's Social Credit Party, was killed early today when his car plunged into a river near this city in Quebec, the police said. He was 33 years old.

title: Inhuman Rights
description: New York is the only city in the world where you can get deliberately run down on the sidewalk by a pedestrian. Off your guard for an instant, and they smash headon into you, or more commonly, they clip you blindside on one shoulder and send you skidding out of control into an oncoming mass of pedestrians who batter your hipbones and dent your sternum. It's a sidewalk demolition derby.

title: Mets' Records
description: BATTING

title: ke Sea Plunge in Search of Thrills
description: SAN SALVADOR ISLAND, the Bahamas, June 18Bored above sea level and undaunted by sharks and other creatures below it, growing numbers of Americans are bubbling into the deep in search of recreational thrills.

title: U.S. Custom House Will Reopen  On Wednesday as an Arts Center
description: The United States Custom House, a dramatic example of the Beaux Arts style of architecture and a city landmark whose halls bear the handiwork of an earlier era of monumental sculptors, will, for the second year, open its doors to a new generation of artists and the general public next Wednesday for a summer program of cultural events that will extend through Seat. 11.

title: Notes on People
description: W. Michael Blumenthal, Secretary of the.Treasury, and his wife of 26 years, Eileen, have agreed upon a separation, according to a Treasury spokesman. The Blumenthals, who have three grown daughters, reached, the decision by mutual consent and. after long and searching thought, it was said. Mrs. Blumenthal recently received a doctorate in education from the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor, and is doing scientific research in Washington.

title: Charts for Teaching Word Pronounciations
description: Edward J. McGinley, president of McGinley Systems, short Hills, N.J., which develops educational material, was granted a patent this week on series of Instructional charts for teaching and testing word pronunciation and spelling.

title: Italian Communists React
description: ROME, June 24 (AP)Italy's independentminded Communist. Party reacted to a Soviet attack on a Spanish Communist: leader by reminding the Kremlin that each party is autonomous and responsible for its positions and choices.

title: The Parking Farce, Contd.
description: Just as Mayor Beame planned it, merchants are angry and the public is disoriented. And the environmentalists, who hold a court order over his head,, protest that he is doing too much against auto parking in downtown New York to hide the fact that he has done nothing about it or any other program for cleaner air over the past four years. The letter below, from attorneys representing The Friends of the Earth in legal action against the city, makes their case: first, that they wish to be economically responsible but can deal only with the plan of action that the city itself once put forward and then abandoned without alternative; and second, that even at this late stage the plan is negotiable and could have been adjusted, for example, to ban midtown parking only in daytime business hours and not at all times as the Mayor has ordered.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, June 24Judge George H. Barlow will hear arguments Monday in Federal District Court here on a request by State Attorney General William F. Hyland that the court lift its stay against enforcement of a 1975 state law barring Medicaid payments for elective abortions.

title: Citibank Raising Keogh Rate
description: Citibank said yesterday that it would begin paying 7 percent interest on Keogh retirement accounts effective July 6. It now pays 7 percent. Under Federal law, selfemployed people may set aside 15 percent of their income (up to $7,500 a year) in a retirement fund called a Keogh plan after its Congressional sponsor. Income taxes on the amount contributed and on interest earned by the fund are deferred until the person retires and begins drawing money from the account.

title: Dance: Balanchine Adapts Waltz
description: In the last few years, the New York City Ballet seems to have designed its major premieres expressly for the armchair traveler.

title: Medicaid Recipients Win Stay on Paying A Part of Drug Fees
